Reporting to the Protective Services Supervisor the Control Room Operator assists the Protective Services Department in leading Cleveland Clinic London’s (CCL) Regional Security Operations, London Security Operations Center (LSOC), combined with emergency & disaster management functions to reduce risks to people, property and activities in the organization.
The control room operator will also assist in coordinating CCL’s response to an emergency. In this capacity they will also support the response teams for the various emergency code calls (First response) teams.
The control room operator is responsible for the operational and technical and administrative functions of the Protective Services Department when on duty. They acts as a resource for the team members working on shifts.
What will your duties include?
Process incoming and outgoing communications in the Security Operations Center
Monitor PSIM, fire panels, access control, cameras and other equipment to provide vital information to dispatched responders
Receive and transmit all security and emergency information over multiple systems including two-way radio, Emergency management systems, Wi-Fi devices, Overhead Page
Collaborate with Caregivers to ensure a safe and secure environment for patients, visitors and Caregivers
Lead projects associated with the strategic initiatives
Develop and prepare presentations to various audiences
Ensure the LSOC is operated and complies with legal and regulatory requirements such as CQC, joint commission and SIA licensing requirements
Working Hours?

Operate 24/7/365
12 Hour rotating shifts
Pattern: x2 Days – x2 Nights – x4 Days off
Overtime available as Protective Services is self-covering

Valid SIA Public Space Surveillance (CCTV) license (Required)
Security NVQ’s (Required)
Control Room experience (Required)

Valid SIA Door Supervisor (Desired)
Up to date Security experience within a corporate or healthcare background (Highly Desirable)
What we can offer you?
We are offering an array of benefits to compliment working for a not-for-profit market leader, some of our benefits include:
210 hours Annual leave
Auto-Enrolment of 5% pension - Cleveland contribute 10% through Salary Exchange
Private Medical Insurance and Private Dental Insurance
Life Assurance
Discounted gym facilities in our Admin Office Building
Employee Assistance Programme

Interfaces with the business to deliver professional and competent advice and support, to ensure that the projects are managed in accordance with the contract, and meet the required reporting deadlines.

Raise Subcontract payment certificates for sign off by the Commercial Manager.
Preparing general correspondence on behalf of the business.
Subcontract administration/payments.
Production and distribution of detailed meeting minutes for all subcontract meetings.
Contractual Compliance, Quality and Risk Management

Acute attention to detail.

About the role
Here at our Greggs Enfield Supply site, the future home of our delicious Pizzas, we have an exciting opportunity for a Facilities Engineer to join our very friendly team working Monday - Friday day shift.
Our welcoming team here at Enfield have a passion for quality, ensuring our customer receive only the very best quality products.
Our people are what make Greggs, Greggs. We are proud to receive fantastic employee engagement scores year after year due to the commitment we have to valuing our employees. With regular social events, we enjoy all getting together to celebrate our successes.
The site is located within great transport links and is a 5-minute walk of Brimsdown Railway Station, we have ample free parting on site, and a secure bicycle shed if you prefer to cycle. We have great staff facilities including an on-site discounted canteen serving delicious hearty meals.
If this sounds like the role for you, please read on.
Pay rates
Circa £32,000 based on experience
Shift pattern
Hours: 40 hours per week
Shifts: As Facilities Engineer you will work Monday-Friday day shift, and one Saturday every 4 weeks
Contract: Permanent
What you'll do
Safety, Health, Environment & Food Safety: Adhere to all safe working practices and safety related documentation & Food Safety requirements (e.g. Safe Systems of Work, Risk Assessments, Isolation & Lock-out, Permits To Work, PPE, Plant Release Procedures, etc.)
Upkeep of Site Standards: Supports delivery of Supply Chain Maintenance Strategy though effective & efficient completion of work requests, supporting the Maintenance department where required, correct use of Engineering stores, in line with work plans developed by Maintenance Manager/Supervisor.
Personal Development: Proactively seeks to develop new and existing skills in line with the Supply Chain Maintenance Strategy and relevant skills matrices
Effective Communication: Build strong relationships with all key parties, including Manager, Engineering team and other departments
About you
Experience of building maintenance and site facilities duties is essential
NVQ level 3 or City and Guilds eg. plumbing, electrical, building services is essential

May require additional specific training in order to move into other roles
Have a proactive approach to maintenance and building management
Good understanding of Safety Health and Environmental responsibilities
Confident and enthusiastic
Willing to undertake further training
Good communication skills
Able to meet shift requirements
Customer focused
Computer literate
Knowledge of CMMS (Computer Maintenance Management System) or similar is desirable
What we can offer
Our Greggs Employee Staff Discount Scheme is very generous, offering you up to 50% off our food
Your holiday entitlement starts with 4.2 weeks, in addition to bank holidays, which increases with service up to a maximum of 6 weeks after 25 years’ service. (Pro-rata for part time)
After 6 months service you may be eligible for our profit share scheme where the company distributes 10% of its profits and allows you to share in the success of the business
You will receive free life assurance after 1 year’s continuous service. This is a death in service benefit which provides a lump sum payment equal to one and a half years’ salary
You will automatically join our Greggs pension scheme which is a fantastic way to save for your retirement and allows you to benefit from employer contributions and tax advantages

Employee Assistance Programme
Healthcare Plans
Cycle to Work Scheme

About the Company: We are purpose driven, pioneering and commercialising novel healthcare solutions for people with unmet needs. Over forty years of research has gone into our clinical pipeline, giving options to patients where there were none before. That knowledge is now being selectively translated into other applications, helping people both clinically and in the wider healthcare world. The Company is on a growth trajectory, and we are looking for candidates who align with our purpose, have an entrepreneurial mindset, and understand the needs of a small but fast-growing business and its leadership. You will join a friendly, dynamic, and committed international team to deliver consistent results to tight deadlines.
The Company facilitates flexible and remote working, with most staff based remotely and reporting into global offices. The PR & Communications Manager would be expected to work with the team in person on a semi-regular basis (two days per week in our Leatherhead office), while maintaining a remote working space.
Primary objective: Contribute to the development, planning and implementation of the PR and Communications strategy covering consumer and corporate elements. Through ongoing review, evaluation and implementation of comms strategy, increase overall brand awareness aligned with the corporate brand positioning to tap into and grow new audiences. The ideal candidate will support the visibility, brand perception and strategic development of our core initiatives.
_ Key result areas: _
· Deliver a PR/Communications strategy covering corporate and consumer touchpoints which clearly positions the corporate brand and increases consumer awareness and affinity.
· Create and manage a Communications/PR calendar which maximises brand visibility at key moments throughout the year in line with associated KPIs (multichannel communication campaigns).
· In-Market Crisis Management and handling multiple and varied queries from a plethora of sources, think shareholders through to National Press.
· Leverage, develop and manage top tier media relationships relevant to our core audiences, exploring opportunities for increased PR coverage including partnerships, sponsorships, events and Ambassadors.
· Identify potential awards which would be relevant for the healthcare solutions range to deliver coverage and increase awareness; supported by a product seeding programme.
· Ensure communications and brand consistency across all comms and stakeholder activity.
· Working with various heads of departments to develop new ideas and innovative strategies to develop product brand narrative, including development and guardianship of house styles.
· Drafting key documents, including company releases, online and social media content, the Annual Report, launch campaigns and product-specific communications materials.
· Develop and manage stakeholder engagement activity and campaigns, including media liaison and briefing, internal communications, and patient relations.
· Support communications for other external facing roles (such as investor relations) with key messaging development and document review.
· Events management.
· Develop, implement and monitor Company’s internal communication strategy.
· Be able to distil complex, technical topics into clear, accessible narratives for a range of technical and non-technical audiences across a range of media.
· Oversee press and general enquiries processes, including media and social media monitoring.
· Prepare detailed quarterly media activity reports.
· Monitor press releases that relate to the Company’s brand.
· Lead junior communications staff to deliver projects in a high-pressure environment.
· Contribute to the implementation of a key (biennial) event for the Group.
· Regular reporting around coverage, sentiment, and competitor activity; a future orientation to identify and implement the actions as a result.
Skills/abilities/experience
· Extensive communications work within or alongside a range of companies, or with a singular entity for an intensive and extensive period.
· Experience in Media Outreach and Media Events on an international stage with a knack for identifying the ‘hook’ to drive earned coverage and create ‘buzz’ and delivering a clear POD vs. competition.
· Communications risk assessment and crises management readiness.
· A get-it-done, flexible attitude with a willingness to pivot quickly and frequently.
· Work within or alongside a publicly listed company, preferably in the healthcare or pharmaceutical space
· Leading functional teams across multiple locations within ‘hands-on’ roles, including mentoring junior staff.
· The development of communications campaigns, including writing media releases, Annual Reports, and social media content, building digital advertising campaigns and facilitating media liaison.
· The development of existing and new brand narratives, working closely with senior creative staff.
· Stakeholder engagement, including as a company spokesperson with traditional and online press and patient or consumer groups.
· Successful delivery of new brands and products to audiences.
· Ability to work in complex technical environment, distilling a wide range of information into key themes which are simple, clear, distinctive, and supported by communications frameworks which capture the core of the concept.
· Contributing to high end events and experiences.
· Managing multiple ongoing projects (some long-term) while ensuring a consistency of narrative.

Position Overview
The Project Manager is responsible for managing project scope all scales of events. This position will monitor progress and performance against the project plan, identifying, resolving, escalating operational problems, and minimising delays. This position is responsible for the end-to-end execution of projects from event design and development through closing. The Project Manager will ensure successful and profitable execution of events by following Technical and Production Standards and supporting the implementation of processes and SOP’s that drive consistency in event production. This position will partner with Project Management, Sales, and Operations teams in determining event technical requirements and communicating event execution plan with all parties. The Project Manager will report to the Director, Project Management or General Manager in area.

Key Job Responsibilities

Event Project Management
Prepare and communicate technical production & labour schedules, sub-rental requirements, project scope, execution plan and individual responsibilities to team members, vendors and venue partners.
Determine and secure the resources required to successfully complete each project.
Drive Results - Maintain focus on client needs by attending client meetings, creating and maintaining organised show documentation and responding to client concerns and questions.
Monitor project scope throughout the event planning process and adjust as necessary to ensure the successful completion of the project.
Assist sales and operations teams to help determine equipment needs and technical solutions for the project.
Assist with the creation of technical diagrams when required.
Review all sales documents to confirm that the equipment and technical positions will meet the client’s needs.
Deliver World Class Service - Develop and maintain strong relationships with clients at all levels of their organisation and provide outstanding customer service while focusing on client retention.
Provide leadership for Technical teams on events.
Ensure that all the necessary HSE documentations including but not limited to Risk Assessments and Method Statements are in place and communicated to the project delivery team prior to the execution of an event.

Event Execution
See the Bigger Picture - Act as the project leader and onsite contact for the client throughout the event.
Manage all phases of event technical execution from load-in through run of show to load-out.
Assume ownership of inventory management throughout the event.
Communicate the project plan and client expectations to event team.
Manage onsite changes, including schedule, equipment or workforce modifications.
Value People - Mentor and communicate with Encore Team Members on event execution and best practices to help improve the local knowledge base and experience in the market.
Do the Right Thing - Ensure compliance with established Technical Standards and Production Standards.
At all times, the Project Manager is expected to abide by all health and safety requirements to company and international standards and to ensure that all team members and subcontractors working onsite adhere to the same.
Follow up with clients on-site to ensure that their needs are met and the equipment setup is working properly.
Financial Management
Assist in the creation, analysis, and execution of the project budget, partnering with regional leadership to mitigate external workforce and sub-rental spend.
Manage event costs to align with budget and ensure all onsite changes are communicated to sales for billing purposes.
Assist with the completion of post-event client invoice. Work with operations management to ensure the prompt payment of all external vendors
Ensure compliance with Encore Policies and Procedures to minimise company’s exposure to liability claims and property damage, theft and misappropriation.

Administrative & Training
Complete Encore post-event process, to include the completion of all post-show reporting, confirming all workforce hours are accurately entered and ensuring that outsourced equipment is returned to appropriate provider.
Participate in the development of Project Management SOP’s.
Conduct review and analysis of proposed events as required.

The duties and responsibilities described are not a comprehensive list and may change, or additional tasks within scope of work may be assigned at any time with or without notice, as necessitated by business demands.

Work Environment

Work is performed in an event environment with, at times, moderate exposure to outdoor temperatures and to dirt, sand and/or dust. The working conditions will vary between moderately quiet to noisy volumes. Team members will use high-end audio-visual equipment and electrical components and will be exposed to heights via lifts and ladders. Team members may be asked to work in multiple locations. Job Description

The Portfolio Managers Assistant (“PMA”) will be responsible for providing essential support to the Fixed Income and Commodities Investments teams to add value to the investment process and increase and strengthen front office controls.

Responsibilities

Provide operational support to the Portfolio Managers (“PMs”). This will include:
o Input and 4-eye checking of trade orders
o Management of cash flow movements
o Monitoring and managing corporate action opportunities
o Monitoring and responding to Compliance violations
o Run, review and reconcile any daily desk reports
o Query resolution and other ad hoc requests
o New Instrument and Country request instruction and process monitoring

Become Aladdin (order management) systems expert, representing desk / group interests at ‘superuser meeting, identifying and following up on any enhancements.
Represent supported Investment Desks in any projects, initiatives, client on-boardings and enhancements.
Adhere to all risk and control policies in undertaking all support activities.
Liaise with the Front Office Assurance & Oversight team and the PMs to report errors and suggest process improvements.
Continually challenge and implement process improvements.
Integrate with the Investment teams and create strong open lines of communication with the PMs and other PMAs.

Develop and maintain effective working relationships with internal and external parties.
Support the Fixed Income and Commodities Business Manager with any initiatives affecting the asset class when requested.

Portfolio Management Assistant role experience

Team-orientated but able to act on own initiative.

We are recruiting for a passionate and experienced Nursery Manager to join our Parsons Green Team. Previous experience as a Nursery Manager is essential.
Key Accountabilities:
· Responsibility for the success of the nursery, including administration and day to day operations of the nursery.
· Key holder responsibility and security after a successful probation period has been fulfilled.
· Lead responsibility for any safeguarding concerns. To have also completed Designated Safeguarding Lead Training (DSL) with the local authority.
- Set and deliver clear operational objectives and performance standards of the nursery working within agreed company policies and procedures.
· To develop, lead and motivate a team, ensuring performance is maximised and potential managed.
· Deliver a programme of childcare from birth to 5 years old which meets legislative standards and considers children from differing cultures, families, religious backgrounds and those who may have additional needs.
· Ensure the nursery offers an environment which reflects the cultural diversity of all children.
· Implement, and monitor the organisation of activities to ensure they have reference to the Early Years Foundation Stage and your own individual nursery curriculum to develop all aspects of a child’s individual development in a stimulating environment.
· To work alongside, monitor and review staff performance; ensure that at least once a month peer to peer observations are completed through ILD.
· Ensure that children’s files and developmental records are kept up to date on paper, ILD and INM including allergies and any identified/non-identified additional needs.
· Developing and maintaining a partnership within the local community to create a positive reputation for the nursery.
· Creating and maintaining successful, positive and professional partnerships with parents/carers and external agencies.
· Ensuring that communication within the nursery is a priority. This includes; at least fortnightly newsletters and at least 2 Facebook posts.
· To ensure that the nursery is GDPR compliant in line with the policies and procedures.
· Represent the nursery, internally and externally arranging show around appointments, organising other special events and act as a role model throughout the business as a representative of the company.
· Having sole responsibility for organising and attending events that publicise and market the nursery.
· Maximizing occupancy levels through proactive marketing and outstanding presentation of the nursery.
· Coach and develop the team to ensure positive and proactive attitudes and behaviours that are demonstrated throughout the nursery.
· Conduct regular termly supervisions.
· To have sole responsibility for recruitment within the nursery and to ensure that you as Manager have completed the safer recruitment training.
· Devise and implement developmental plans for the team in conjunction with the framework.
· Ensuring any staff matters/concerns/conflict are dealt with promptly and fully in line with our policies and procedures.
· To manage the supervision of new staff, apprentices and volunteers within the Nursery.
· To deal with parental complaints in a timely manner in accordance with the policies and procedures.
· Manage the efficient upkeep of maintenance/stock of equipment, furnishing and fittings ensuring the nursery environment is safe, hygienic, tidy and well presented at all times.
· Organising and attending a minimum of three parents/carers’ evenings per year and you are to be in attendance.
· To lead monthly staff meetings and training sessions outside working hours which should include minutes being written up and all staff signing them off. Which then needs to be sent to your Regional Manager.
· To ensure that children’s allergies are visible within each room and the kitchen. Placemats are in place and each room has a designated allergen to oversee any allergies within the rooms. This must all be in line with our company policies and procedures.
Health & Safety
· Ensure that the nursery meets the required health and safety standards, ratios and conditions of the statutory framework.
· Provide strong support for the team ensuring safe working practices and staff ratios are effectively deployed to adequately meet the needs of the children.
· Ensure all risks assessments are carried out and frequently reviewed and updated. Including; for all outings, new equipment, chemical products current COSHH, staff medication.
· Ensure that daily risk assessments are completed on the INM and signed off by the Nursery Manager or Deputy Manager.
· Ensure weekly, monthly and yearly tests are carried out in relation to the Fire/Evacuation policies.
· To have due regard for safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and to follow the child protection procedures adopted by the Company and to have completed Safeguarding training by the local authority.
· Implementing the company’s Safeguarding/Child Protection policies and procedures.
Personnel
· Following company and safer recruitment procedures to ensure effective and fair recruitment and where applicable, promotion of employees.
· All interviews that carried out on staff members applying a Senior role which includes; Team Leaders and Deputy Manager will be carried out with the Regional Manager in attendance.
· Ensure all nursery employee records are accurately updated including holidays, application form, supervisions/appraisals, bank details, attendance on courses, sickness/lateness, certificates, a completed policy and procedure sign off sheet, individual risk assessment, right to work, emergency details, contract, job description, DBS, health declaration and references .
· Ensure that all staff have completed the On-Boarding process including monthly meetings. Also have a completed their probationary period which has resulted in a face to face meeting and a signed off confirmation letter that they have passed probation.
· Identifying and addressing staff training needs and logging this information onto the INM.
· Undertaking investigations and carrying out disciplinary’s where necessary.
· Ensuring that in the absence of the Manager the Deputy is on site at all times.
· Maintaining appropriate levels of qualified/unqualified employees within the nursery.
· Deploying staff effectively to maintain the correct staff ratios in accordance with the Statutory Framework.
· Providing leadership and day to day management for the team which will involve working alongside the staff in the rooms on a daily basis.
Interactive Learning Diary/Interactive Nursery Manager
To have a thorough knowledge of the INM & ILD which can be cascaded to the rest of the team.
To deliver training where needed to staff members.
To ensure that accurate information is logged daily onto each child’s portfolio. This includes; signing in/out, nappy logs, food, medication, accidents/incidents and sleep records.
To upload staff shifts on INM by every Wednesday.
To effectively monitor staff training needs through the online CPD log on INM.
To approve daily observations and give feedback to the team where necessary.
Oversee and ensure that 2 year checks, school leaver reports and parents evening reports are being completed in a timely manner on the ILD.
Financial
Effectively managing the nursery budget in accordance with the monthly P&L’s.
Monitoring parental accounts on INM to ensure the timely collection of nursery fees by the 1st of each month.
To complete the payroll report at least 7 working days prior to the pay date.
Ensuring that Datamolino is completed every Friday.
To maximise and deliver on financial targets directly related to nursery performance including age debt.

The Company
Are you looking to join an organization that is growing and dynamic? What about a high-energy, collaborative environment that rewards hard work?

J.S. Held is a global consulting firm providing technical, scientific, and financial expertise across all assets and value at risk. Our professionals serve as trusted advisors to organizations facing high-stakes events demanding urgent attention, staunch integrity, clear-cut analysis, and an understanding of both tangible and intangible assets. The firm provides a comprehensive suite of services, products, and data that enable clients to navigate complex, contentious, and often catastrophic situations. We have over 100 locations worldwide. We are highly committed to all members of our community, both employees and clients. Our organization focuses on promoting a sense of community and inspiring our people to achieve results that exceed goals.

The Team and Job Summary
J.S. Held’s Global Investigations Practice provides companies, legal counsel, financial institutions, and other organizations with the information required to make well-informed business decisions. Our team is retained to advise in multi-jurisdictional business transactions and investments, regulatory inquiries, compliance issues, and legal proceedings. With experts located across the globe, we support clients in North America, Latin America, Europe, Africa, Asia Pacific, and the Middle East.

Our Global Investigations Practice has openings available at the Managing Director level. The candidate will join an experienced and closely-knit team of investigative professionals, with deep experience in handling complex research projects.

Job Responsibilities
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to develop and implement go to market strategies related to driving revenue growth
Utilize knowledge of databases and programming languages to analyze and interpret data, to include historical financial, operational, and transactional data, and identify potentially sensitive data content
Prepare and validate analyses, reports, presentations, quantitative exhibits, and other client deliverables results of work performed
Participate in client meetings to review results of work performed
Responsible for management of day-to-day activities of a project including interaction with other team members, professionals from other firms involved in the engagement, and clients
Mentor and drive team development as part of (and outside of) engagements
Execute and expand on projects involving the identification, collection, processing, review, and/or analyses of electronic data relevant to management consulting, financial investigation and/or regulatory/compliance engagements
Lead a team using industry accepted tools/practices to perform the preservation electronically stored information (“ESI”) and validating preservation
Lead a team performing investigative analysis on digital devices or electronic data using forensic tools such as EnCase, Axiom, Cellebrite Physical Analyzer, Cellebrite Inspector to carry out an investigation
Build relationships and engage in activities to generate qualified leads
Working on other project-based work, across all industries and geographies
Production of written reports, often with tight deadlines; and
Provide support in other ad-hoc tasks.

Required Qualifications
15+ years of relevant work experience in the consulting industry
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college/university. MIS, Computer Science, or Business Analytics degrees preferred
5+ years of experience with database programming languages (SQL, PL/SQL) and other database applications (MySQL, Oracle, MS SQL)
Experience with eDiscovery tools including – but not limited to – Relativity, Disco, Nuix, Brainspace, Reveal, IPro, Concordance, etc.
Strong organization and attention to detail skills

Physical and Mental Job Qualifications
Ability to travel as needed

J.S. Held is dedicated to becoming the global leader in providing multi-disciplinary consulting services to the construction, government, healthcare, industrial, insurance, energy, legal, and technology, communities. We have diverse practice areas including Construction Advisory, Financial Investigations, Forensic Accounting & Economics, Forensic Architecture & Engineering, Surety, Environmental Health & Safety, Equipment, Toxicology, and Building & Property Consulting, among other disciplines. J.S. Held is devoted to recruiting and cultivating top industry talent to build a collaborative and diverse team of experts. We leverage our experience to provide local, cost-efficient solutions and an unrivaled client experience.

Our mission is to serve as trusted, expert advisors to organizations around the world facing high-stakes situations that demand urgent attention, exceptional knowledge, staunch integrity and objective, clear- cut analysis and advice.

Why choose us?

We at PEI Group are looking for a Head of Platform Architecture to join our welcoming, diverse, and growing team based here in London. Successful candidate will be the most senior architect in the engineering team, and the organisation will look to you ensure that the organisations internal and external facing platforms are architected in a way that will ensure that technology is enabler.
Currently the business generates revenue from editorial content (both print and digital), specialist industry events, sponsorship of events and publications, and a data platform that surfaces a wealth of interesting data relating to the alternative assets industry.
Your main responsibilities will include:
Be responsible for leading the technical design of systems and services, justifying, and communicating design decisions
Assure other services and system quality, ensuring the technical work fits into the broader strategy
Provide mentoring within teams
Regularly collaborate and find agreement with senior stakeholders, providing direction and challenge
Be proactive in identifying problems and translating these into non-technical descriptions that can be widely understood.
Who we are:
PEI Group is a subscriber-focused business intelligence company. With our multi-talented global team of over 300 people, spread across EMEA, USA & Asia, our purpose is to inform and connect investment professionals across global, specialised markets. We identify specific high growth, high value investment sectors and themes where deep insight, strong market relationships and active capital flows are critical for success.
What we do:
PEI Group provides industry-leading journalism, data, and market insight to subscribing clients via a wide portfolio of specialist brands supported by our robust and scalable digital publishing, analytics, and database platform.
We also track the firms and individuals who shape markets and bring client-communities together to enable knowledge sharing, profile building and relationship development through professional networks and events.
Wherever our markets are active – in New York, Los Angeles, Tokyo, Sydney, Hong Kong, London and elsewhere – PEI is hard at work examining crucial market forces and shifting investment themes, identifying active investors and their capital allocations, and scanning ahead for regulatory changes, new compliance requirements and other risk factors.
Requirements
Although we are keeping direct experience and knowledge requirements to a minimum, we do need you to demonstrate your capabilities in relation to the points listed under essential requirements in the person specification. You should prepare to discuss illustrations on how your competencies have helped you to achieve positive results.
Essential Experience:
5+ years' experience as a lead engineer or sub system architect
Extensive experience in building and designing distributed web applications with NodeJS and React
Extensive experience in micro service architecture, domain-driven design, and RESTful Services
Extensive experience in building and designing cloud-based services with AWS
CI/CD evangelist
Essential Knowledge/Skills:
Communicating between the technical and non-technical (technical architect). You can mediate between people and mend relationships, communicating with stakeholders at all levels.
Making and guiding decisions. You can make decisions characterised by medium levels of risk and complexity and recommend decisions as risk and complexity increase. You can build consensus between services or independent stakeholders.
Strategy. You can define and challenge strategies, patterns, standards, policies, roadmaps, and vision statements. You can provide proactive advice and guidance for their definition across the organisation.
Turning business problems into technical design. You can design systems characterised by high levels of risk, impact, and business or technical complexity.
Technically hands on. You are comfortable with NodeJS, ElasticSearch, Lambda, AWS and ideally have exposure to content management systems like WordPress or Gatsby.
Agile working. You are fully versed about agile methodology and can apply an agile mindset to all aspects of your work. You can work in a fast-paced, evolving environment and use an iterative method and flexible approach to enable rapid delivery. You are unafraid to take risks, willing to learn from mistakes and appreciate the importance of agile project delivery for digital projects in government. You can ensure the team knows what each other is working on and how this relates to practical government objectives and user needs.
Community collaboration. You can contribute to the work of other teams, building successful teams through understanding team styles and influencing as well as motivating team members. You know how to give and receive constructive feedback, facilitating the feedback loop. You can facilitate conflict resolution within teams, ensure the team is transparent and that the work is understood externally. You can help teams maintain a focus on delivery while being aware of the importance of professional development.
Digital perspective. You understand how the digital economy is changing user behaviour. You can make informed decisions based on user needs, available technology, and value for money. You know about the wider digital economy and advances in technology.
Leadership and guidance. You can interpret vision to lead on decisions. You can create a collaborative environment and sustain a good service. You can understand and resolve technical disputes across varying levels of complexity and risk. You can solve issues and unblock problems. You know how to drive teams and set the pace, ensuring teams are delivering. You can manage risk, including effectively managing and tracking the mitigation of risks. You can manage various dependencies across teams.
Prototyping. You can apply technical knowledge and experience to create or design workable prototypes, both programs and physical outputs. You understand parameters, restrictions, and synergies.
Strategic thinking. You can take an overall perspective on business issues, events, activities and discuss their wider implications and long-term impact. This could include determining patterns, standards, policies, roadmaps, and vision statements. You know how to focus on outcomes rather than solutions and activities.
Benefits
25 days annual leave (+8 bank holidays)
You deserve a break and are entitled to 25 days paid annual leave in addition to the 8 public/bank holidays. Long Service award PEI offer a scheme to increase an employee's holiday allowance according to length of service. After 2 years of service, you will receive an additional day’s annual leave, you will receive an extra day up to 4 years of service, taking you 28 days annual leave.
Holiday-Flex
Any permanent employee of PEI can buy from or sell PEI up to three holiday days. The value is calculated as 1/260th of the employee's current annual basic salary.
Flexible working policy
We know how busy life can get and believe it is very important to have a good work-life balance. That is why we have a comprehensive Flexible working policy so you can best fit work into your life.
4 days volunteer leave per year
Volunteer leave at PEI offers employees the option of taking 4 working days per year (fully paid) to give back to a charitable cause of their choice.
Life Cover
The Company provides you with life cover of 4 times your “basic salary”, as long as you are on a permanent contract with PEI.
Free access to Employee Assistance programme
The Company provides staff with access to a confidential employee assistance programme (EAP), which is available 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. The EAP provides access to trained experts either via the phone or on a face-t0-face basis.
Employee Referral scheme
We offer incentives for successfully recommending someone new into the business. If you make a recommendation for a vacancy, you will be eligible for a £1,500 bonus.
Private Medical Insurance
After successful completion of your probation period, PEI offer Private Medical Insurance via BUPA as a free benefit to you, but it is taxable.
4.5% matched pension contribution
After three consecutive years in the pension scheme with PEI, employees will have the opportunity to have any increased pension contributions (above 4.5%), matched by the business up to 5%.
Cycle to work scheme
After successful completion of your probation period, PEI will work with you to ensure that the loan of a bicycle can be treated as a tax-free benefit, enabling you to cycle to and from work (we also have great shower facilities on site, as well as plenty of bike racks to safely store your bike!) Season ticket / Travel loan After successful completion of your probation period, PEI offers an interest free travel loan, available for all permanent employees, for rail or tube annual tickets, for the purpose of you travelling to and from work.

ABOUT HERSCHEL SUPPLY
Welcome to Herschel Supply, where we make quality products for a lifetime of better journeys. Designed with timeless form and intuitive function in Vancouver, Canada, every piece is backed by our signature warranty for wherever you're going next.
Since 2009, we've never stopped taking risks. We're constantly innovating, growing our community, reducing our impact on the environment and heading on new journeys. We've gotten lost in new cities, made lifelong friends all over the world, road tripped with no GPS, and explored a ton of creative pursuits along the way.
Putting yourself out there isn't easy. It means stepping outside of your comfort zone and trying something new. It might be scary at first, but it also leads to the best parts of life. Inspiring others to take that leap is what we live for. Wherever you're headed, we're here to help you pack your future with possibilities.
So, come along for the ride, get inspired and Put Yourself Out There.

ABOUT THE ROLE
The Account Manager plays a key part in supporting sales growth across all accounts in the UK & Ireland, as well as Europe. You will provide essential sales planning support to Sales Management from pre-sales to execution to post-sales, and yearly as well as seasonal forecasting will be a major part of the AM's role. The successful candidate will be highly commercial, detail-oriented, analytical and an excellent communicator to build strong relationships with all Accounts within the UK & Europe. Whilst the majority of the role will focus on nurturing existing independent and national key accounts, you will also focus on new business as we expand our product portfolio. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a supportive and collaborative team, and be part of a fast-growing brand that can offer future development opportunities.
A DAY IN THE LIFE
Our workplace is dynamic, supportive and entrepreneurial in spirit, and we pride ourselves in being a collaborative, open-minded and imaginative team.
On a day-to-day basis, the Account Manager will:
Develop and maintain trusting relationships with accounts. Understand partner needs, business potential and positioning in the market.
Analyse and interpret data (sell thru, weeks of supply, margin and replenishment programs) to reduce liabilities and maximise opportunities.
Support and sell-in product to assigned accounts via phone, email and in person.
Collaborate with Accounts to ensure orders are accurately processed and shipped on time.
Maintain a high level of HSC product knowledge while understanding the competitor landscape.
Work closely with Marketing to plan and support Marketing projects.
Work closely with the Sales team to provide accurate yearly, seasonal forecasting.
To input and help develop a 3-year Business Plan consistent with target consumer, marketing objectives and fiscal targets working closely with Sales team and Marketing.
To develop and drive 3-year Business plan (as above) together with key UK team members.
To manage and oversee sales with accounts ensuring that both Brand and Financial targets are achieved.
Actively seek, drive and open new business.
360-degree Account Management
Working closely and supporting all departments which include Operations & Finance
ABOUT YOU
Proven sales record, at least 2 years' Account management experience preferably in the fashion/lifestyle sector
Ability to present to large groups
Advanced proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint.
Advanced understanding of retail math; margin calculation, IMU, profitability, and product turn.
Ability to foresee deadlines and plan accordingly
Excellent organizational, planning, and scheduling skills.
Excellent communication and coordination with internal and external team.
Previous experience with EDI, SPS Commerce (or like program), Microsoft GP Dynamics or ERP & B2B Sales platforms
Attention to detail and a strong ability to problem solve.
Able to travel as needed
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
When you apply to a job on this site, the personal data contained in your application will be collected by Herschel Supply Company Ltd. which is located at 327-611 Alexander Street Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada, V6A 1E1, and/or Herschel Supply UK Ltd., which is located at 5 New Street Square LONDON, EC4A 3TW United Kingdom. ("Controller"), and can be contacted by emailing Controller's data protection officer email line at: privacyofficer@herschel.com .Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing Controller's recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating, and assessing the results thereto, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes. Such processing is legally permissible under Art. 6(1)(f) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation) as necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the Controller, which are the solicitation, evaluation, and selection of applicants for employment.
The Controller operates globally, so your personal data may be transferred from time to time to other companies in the Controller's group of companies and affiliates. Before transferring your personal data to entities outside of EU, Controller will ensure that the necessary safeguards with regard to safeguarding privacy and data protection are offered.
Your personal data will be shared with Greenhouse Software, Inc., a cloud services provider located in the United States of America and engaged by Controller to help manage its recruitment and hiring process on Controller's behalf. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the United States, your personal data will be transferred to the United States once you submit it through this site. Because the European Union Commission has determined that United States data privacy laws do not ensure an adequate level of protection for personal data collected from EU data subjects, the transfer will be subject to appropriate safeguards under standard contractual clauses.
Your personal data will be retained by Controller as long as Controller determines it is necessary to evaluate your application for employment. Under the GDPR, you have the right to request access to your personal data, to request that your personal data be rectified or erased, and to request that processing of your personal data be restricted. You also have to right to data portability. In addition, you may lodge a complaint with an EU supervisory authority.
Please also see Controller's general privacy policy: https://herschel.ca/privacy-policy
DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSION AT HERSCHEL SUPPLY
We're committed to creating a workspace that is safe, secure, inclusive and enjoyable for all. Stemming from our core values and initiating dialogue around our programs, we aim to empower everyone to share their individual voices and experiences. An ability to lead and provide training to staff members

Convera, the largest non-bank provider of foreign exchange services to businesses in the world, is looking for a growth-minded contributor, committed to our vision of making moving money so easy, that any company in the world can grow with confidence.
This is a rare opportunity to join Convera as a founding member of the Growth Enablement function within Customer Success (CS); helping to shape the future of customer experience. The Growth Enablement Specialist is responsible for supporting the design and implementation of test and learn initiatives within Convera’s Go To Market (GTM) division, to enable insight-driven change transformation and accelerate growth and productivity across the business.
Growth Enablement (or Growth Experimentation) is the practice and methodology of robust testing of growth motions. A fundamental component of Customer Success, growth experimentation allows businesses to test ideas in a coordinated way, using measurable success metrics to derive actionable insights that can unlock paths to scale. Keeping value to the customer as its core principle, growth experimentation reduces decision-making risk in effecting changes that impact customers and employees, and celebrates a culture of learning. When scaled, GE becomes a core competency of the entire organization at every level.

To be successful in this role you’ll combine experience in communications and insights, with strong critical thinking skills and a passion for innovation and process change. As a Truth Seeker, you’ll have excellent analytical skills, and the ability to distill key learnings from a wide range of project data and stakeholder feedback. As an outcome-driven candidate, you’ll work closely with internal stakeholders within regional GTM, product, operations and marketing teams, to collect, understand, translate and distribute learnings from our growth and productivity experimentation to enable Convera teams to deliver long-term value to customers.

You will be the principal owner of the Growth Enablement Learnings Velocity Program, and a key contributor to growth experimentation globally, which includes:

Building and owning the internal communications plan for sharing the successes, failures and key lessons from ongoing growth experimentation efforts across the business, including contribution to specific internal communication channels (blog, webinar series, internal centers of excellence) and driving the roadmap for learnings distribution within the GTM (Go To Market) function
Developing engaging and informative presentation decks to various audience levels (senior executive, company-wide) which highlight the key learnings from growth experiments, pulling out interesting findings, challenges and insights from the data and participating stakeholders
Working closely with the lead project owners and experimenters to break down and understand the experiment output data, asking challenging questions to surface insights and meaning, and to understand the root causes to our failures with objectivity
Conducting pre- and post-experiment interviews with participants to capture perceptions and impact of the changes in question, working in partnership with the lead experimenter to develop interview question sets
Presenting experiment learnings to select audiences
Participate in cross-functional working groups with other departments (Product, Operations, Marketing, etc.) to share and bring in learnings from the work being undertaken in different parts of the business.
You should apply if you have:
Experience in internal communications, business insights or in a capacity where communications to different stakeholder levels was a significant part of the role.
Must have the capacity to collect, structure, interpret and translate different types of information, including data and other subjective insights, into digestible format for a broad range of audiences
Must have excellent writing and PowerPoint skills and the ability to distill a complex array of learnings into meaningful and impactful messages
Must have excellent people skills and the confidence to probe deeper for underlying truths or biases
Interest in the operational and human processes that lay behind the customer experience, and a passion for change management / business transformation
Must have the patience, diplomacy and perseverance to work with diverse internal go to market stakeholders
Comfortable working with start-ups as both partner and competitor
Must have intellectual curiosity to learn the myriad nuances of Convera. The ideal candidate has some knowledge of B2B payments, with a hunger to keep learning
Must have comfort working in regulated businesses, where innovation and compliance, security and scalability must all work in harmony
About Convera
Convera is the largest non-bank B2B cross-border payments company in the world. Formerly Western Union Business Solutions, we leverage decades of industry expertise and technology-led payment solutions to deliver smarter money movements to our customers – helping them capture more value with every transaction. Convera serves more than 30,000 customers ranging from small business owners to enterprise treasurers to educational institutions to financial institutions to law firms to NGOs.
Our teams care deeply about the value we bring to our customers which makes Convera a rewarding place to work. This is an exciting time for our organization as we build our team with growth-minded, results-oriented people who are looking to move fast in an innovative environment.
As a truly global company with employees in over 20 countries, we are passionate about diversity; we seek and celebrate people from different backgrounds, lifestyles, and unique points of view. We want to work with the best people and ensure we foster a culture of inclusion and belonging.

We offer an abundance of competitive perks and benefits including:

Market competitive monthly gross salary
Opportunity to earn an annual bonus
Great career growth and development opportunities in a global organization
A flexible approach to work
Generous insurance (health, disability, life) and retirement programs
Paid holidays, time-off and leave policies for life events (maternity, paternity, adoption, bereavement, military)
Paid volunteering opportunities
There are plenty of amazing opportunities at Convera for talented, creative problem solvers who never settle for good enough and are looking to transform Business to Business payments. Apply now if you’re ready to unleash your potential.

From these humble beginnings, Ocean Holidays was created, and the company now consists of three unique and distinct travel brands. Ocean Florida, the largest direct to consumer Florida specialist of their kind in Europe; personalised travel management company, Winged Boots which leads in luxury leisure followed by business travel; and Ocean Beds, the largest worldwide provider of Florida vacation home rentals to the global travel trade.

In addition to this, Ocean Holidays is currently the UK’s largest growth travel company as per the 2021 ATOL rankings when compared to 2019 figures. Conscious inclusion encompasses social, cultural, and cognitive differences and cultivates an ethos of belonging, connection, and shared purpose. It is the integration of this philosophy that allows us to create meaningful experiences for our employees, drive better business practices with our vendors and clients, and lead with purpose.

Depending on your team, typically this means that colleagues spend a minimum of between 20% to 60% of their time in the office, which could be over a week, a month or a quarter. Developing the targeting approach to identify and understand customer needs by designing tests, delivery campaigns, and reviewing performance to ensure campaigns are effective
Sharing complex ideas, issues, and recommendations in presentation and written form to gain agreement from stakeholders at different levels and with different backgrounds
What we’re looking for:
Previous experience in creating business models, both financial and consumer behaviours
Experience in using innovative customer analysis to identify commercial opportunities

Senior Product Manager, Compliance
At Ripple, we provide one frictionless experience to send money globally using the power of blockchain. By joining Ripple's growing global network, financial institutions can process their customers' payments anywhere in the world instantly, reliably and cost-effectively.
Risk and fraud Management is a core function of Payments and with the emerging crypto regulatory policies, this will become even more important in blockchain. In this role, you will build functionality and solutions that enables Ripple to measure, manage and project our liquidity risk, market risk, and credit risk. Your work will be key in establishing Ripple as an industry leader in risk and identity management in crypto. In this role you will be responsible for:
Manage the strategy and successful delivery of the risk and identity platform that powers the workflows of Ripple's innovative Risk, Compliance and Privacy functions
Lead and Drive vision, roadmap, and development of next generation of risk and compliance platforms for all of our payments products
Work closely with the business stakeholders across Risk, Compliance, Legal & InfoSec to understand the business needs, come-up with creative solutions and provide the best customer experience
Partner closely with Ripple's policy and security teams in assessing commercial and regulatory requirements to meet future growth
Synthesize product ideas from cross-functional teams and other Risk counterparts such as Product, Operations and Data Science.
This person will bring strong and inclusive leadership skills as they will need to collaborate heavily with cross-functional internal teams and with the risk and compliance ecosystem of partners and customers. The role resides at Ripple's corporate headquarters in San Francisco.
WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR:
5+ years of product management experience with top payments, internet, enterprise software and/or financial services companies
3+ years of experience with KYC/KYB, AML, compliance, fraud prevention, or identity solutions
Ideally someone who holds CAMS (Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist) accreditation
Or has held a role in a Compliance Oversight Function e.g CF10 or equivalent Proven track record of leading and influencing a Product-driven organization
A passion for payments and a strong interest in the blockchain and crypto ecosystem
Ability to work with internal and external risk, privacy, and compliance teams

WHO WE ARE:
Ripple is doing for value what the internet did for information: enabling its instant and seamless flow around the world. We call this the Internet of Value (IoV). Using blockchain and cryptocurrency technology, Ripple is dedicated to creating powerful gains in financial efficiency, equity and inclusion. In addition, Ripple is developing and enabling the future use cases that will catalyze the new digital economy for governments, businesses and consumers.
Ripple has offices in San Francisco (HQ), New York, London, Mumbai, Singapore, São Paulo, Toronto, Reykjavík, Washington D.C. and Dubai.
WHAT WE OFFER – The resources and support to be your best at work and beyond:
Do Your Best Work
The opportunity to build in a fast-paced start-up environment with experienced industry leaders
A learning environment where you can dive deep into the latest technologies and make an impact. A professional development budget to support other modes of learning.
Thrive in an environment where no matter what race, ethnicity, gender, origin, or culture they identify with, every employee is a respected, valued, and empowered part of the team.
Ripple is Flexible First: you have the option to work remotely, from our offices, or a combination of the two within the 11 countries we are located around the world.
Weekly all-company meeting - business updates and ask me anything style discussion with our Leadership Team
We come together for moments that matter which include team off-sites, team bonding activities, happy hours and more!
Take Control of Your Finances
Competitive salary, bonuses, and equity
Bonus Flexibility Program: Participants in the Corporate Bonus Plan have the option to elect to receive their annual bonus in cash, equity or XRP, or a combination.
100% paid medical and dental and 95% paid vision insurance for employees starting on your first day
401k (with match)

Employee giving match
Mobile phone stipend
Take Care of Yourself
Twice a quarter R&R days so you can rest and recharge
Generous wellness reimbursement and weekly onsite & virtual programming
Flexible vacation policy - work with your manager to take time off when you need it
Industry-leading parental leave policies. Family planning benefits.
Catered lunches, fully-stocked kitchens with premium snacks/beverages, and plenty of fun events

Our Senior Service Managers are responsible and accountable for the day-to-day management of their direct Service Centre whilst overseeing other Service Centres in their region. They play a key role in the growth and retention of our customer base by delivering a high-quality service and experience in an increasingly competitive market.
Utilising operational expertise, this role is responsible for the ‘on time’ service delivery for the site/area, increasing efficiencies and achieving our operational targets, including P&L management.
As a member of the service management team, people management and promoting health and safety best practice is an essential part of this role, as well as driving high performance culture across the respective area.
_________________________________________________________________________________________
Key Responsibilities
Operational Planning
To work closely with the Operational Router to plan work demand to meet customer specification, whilst maximising efficiencies, operational resource and ensuring quality of service is maintained
To ensure all operational and service delivery requirements for the site/area are fulfilled as per the issued work planner
To oversee and manage ‘in-flight’ work activity and any re-routing requirements outside of the work planner
Work with defined metrics and utilise this date to provide valuable insight into potential service improvements and efficiencies
Identify and solve operational problems whilst understanding and recognising any broader impact across the operation
To work in collaboration with the company Fleet Administrator and ensure all vehicle related processes are completed for your site/area

To deliver excellent customer service through the consistent management of our service offering including installs, repairs and removals

Drive high performance through effective check in meetings, performance reviews and development planning
To ensure all Hygiene Technicians are trained to high standards and have the relevant product knowledge to deliver a great service to our customers
Health & Safety
Champion Health & Safety and promote best practice and ensure all tasks and processes are completed on the relevant H&S platform or system
Attend regular H&S meetings and regularly monitor/report site and area activity
To ensure the site or service is compliant with waste management processes, documentation and any relevant legislation
To ensure all team members are managing hazardous waste safely and other high-risk activity completed within Operations
To ensure all site Health & Safety standards and safe systems of work are maintained by all team members
To ensure Hygiene Technicians complete daily vehicle inspections, maintain safe loads, drive vehicles safely and keep within all prevailing road traffic and transport legislation
Project Support
Support on the management and delivery of operational projects or new processes and procedures
Complete all project action or tasks on time and keep the project lead regularly updated
Ensure any local initiatives are aligned to the wider Operational strategy

Experience in leading an operational/service delivery functions
Operational and/or logistical background working with KPI’s and targets
Experience in working with a varied range of internal and external stakeholders

Desirable
Knowledge of the washroom or consumable industry markets

Presentation skills –presenting updates to team members or management team
Excellent communication skills – both written and verbal
Excellent time management, reporting and analysis skills
Ability to analyse operational data to drive performance
Ability to meet robust operational targets that focus on quality assurance
Ability to work independently, as well as part of a team
Good organisational skills with a detailed and structured approach to work

Ability to appraise situations quickly and react accordingly, considering fluctuation workloads and deadlines

Who are we?
Ocean Holidays was founded in 2004 by two sets of brothers: Directors Daniel and David Ox and George and Harry Hastings who are still very much active in the business today. They set out selling holidays with no website, just a handful of staff and Teletext as their only form of marketing.
From these humble beginnings, Ocean Holidays was created, and the company now consists of three unique and distinct travel brands. Ocean Florida, the largest direct to consumer Florida specialist of their kind in Europe; personalised travel management company, Winged Boots which leads in luxury leisure followed by business travel; and Ocean Beds, the largest worldwide provider of Florida vacation home rentals to the global travel trade.
In 2018, 2019 & 2020 Ocean Holidays won ‘Best Holiday Company to the USA’ at the British Travel Awards and in 2018 Ocean Holidays was named as the fourth fastest growing travel company by independent accountancy firm, BDO. In addition to this, Ocean Holidays is currently the UK’s largest growth travel company as per the 2021 ATOL rankings when compared to 2019 figures. We have also been achieved for 2022 a B Companies ‘Very Good Company to Work for’ company award.
Our commitment to equal opportunities
For us, diversity is a business imperative – one that must be embedded into every aspect of how we operate to drive success. Simply put, we believe an encouraging and inclusive environment makes sound business sense.
We are a customer experience-driven business, and a diverse workplace means that we not only build a healthy culture of diversity and tolerance but can also serve our clients with empathy and understanding.
Conscious inclusion encompasses social, cultural, and cognitive differences and cultivates an ethos of belonging, connection, and shared purpose. It is the integration of this philosophy that allows us to create meaningful experiences for our employees, drive better business practices with our vendors and clients, and lead with purpose.

Infopro Digital’s Ignite team creates bespoke content and thought leadership campaigns for market-leading media brands in the risk management, capital markets and fintech space.
We are seeking a production subeditor who will be responsible for editorial work, layout, production and delivery of the division’s commercial editorial projects, including advertorials, white papers, market reports and commercially driven supplements. With a focus on our awards campaigns, the candidate will work with clients, marketing and editorial teams co-ordinating and delivering awards collateral across multiple projects.
As well as working on commercial editorial projects, you will ensure the related marketing and events literature is being produced to the highest standard. You will review marketing content for quality, accuracy and consistency, including customer communications, website assets and messaging, as well as internal and external presentation decks. Ideally, you can turn sometimes clumsy messaging into something more clear, succinct and engaging.
This is a challenging and diverse role, ideal for an experienced subeditor interested in a position working across multiple titles and projects, often simultaneously, and across a variety of media. With the ability to produce meticulous content, the successful candidate will work within the commercial editorial team to ensure paid-for and marketing content is produced to the highest standard and, as an advocate for best practice, you’ll be detail-focused and proactive.
Responsibilities:
The role covers commercial editorial projects across a range of titles and involves working closely with global clients post-sale: from chasing copy, interpreting and implementing clients’ requirements and meeting their expectations to production and delivery of final copy and content for publication across a variety of media. Duties on commercial supplements, market reports, white papers and other projects include design, layout and managing copy flow and deadlines with editorial, commercial teams, events, marketing and production staff.
You will be responsible for the creation and delivery of awards collateral – including winners’ features, logos, social media and marketing content – to clients and winners across a variety of campaigns. You will also assume responsibility for presentation of these assets online across our websites.
Commercial production duties include:
Editorial work, layout, production and support on commercial editorial projects, white papers, advertorials, market reports, supplements and other projects, in print and online, requiring copy-editing, subediting, proofreading, writing headlines, standfirsts and captions.
Layout and some design work using Adobe InDesign, Photoshop, Acrobat and Illustrator.
Liaising and working with clients post-sale to ensure an efficient production process, including interpreting and implementing their requirements within reasonable parameters, managing and meeting client expectations to produce final copy for publication, launch or supply across a variety of media/platforms.
Working closely with the sales and marketing teams to create and provide awards packages, comprising customised PDFs, logos plus any associated print and online editorial and video content to clients, award winners, and co-ordinating the awards collateral delivery process.
Carry out design work as and when required, which could include creating infographics, marketing collateral and InDesign templates.
Creating print-ready and online reports and supplements and associated material, requiring a working knowledge of Adobe InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator and Acrobat, and workflow systems, ensuring schedules and deadlines are adhered to.
Any other work-related tasks that may reasonably be requested.
Marketing duties include:
Subediting marketing and events copy, from email campaigns to conference brochures, awards literature, internal and external marketing projects, and any other related text.
Liaising with the marketing and events teams to ensure ongoing education with regard to quality and standards.
Spotting any issues with image quality and working towards rectifying them by requesting new images or fixing existing issues using Photoshop where possible.
Liaising with the marketing and events design team to advise on any necessary text or visual changes.

Requirements
Essential skills:
Extensive, proven, practical knowledge of and expertise in using Adobe InDesign, Photoshop and Acrobat within a Mac environment are a must, with Illustrator knowledge or experience desirable.
Extensive subediting experience, including writing headlines, captions and standfirsts, proofreading and copy-editing.
An unfailing attention to detail, ensuring copy conforms to four distinct house styles.
The ability to work on multiple projects and sometimes brands simultaneously.
Practical ability in the use and creation of publications in print and other media – applicants must have some background knowledge in digital media/publishing.
Practical knowledge of and experience in using a content management system.
Excellent communication skills, both written and interpersonal, including the ability to liaise with clients and staff at all levels of the organisation, and with a passion for educating others on good practice.
Desired skills:
Solid, practical experience as a production editor or similar (subediting, layout, image creation/manipulation, online work, graph/chart/table creation).
Experience of advertorial work.
Ability to contribute to project management and deliver high-quality work on time, sometimes within a tight schedule, and with minimum supervision.
Not essential, but some experience of finance and trading technologies would be advantageous.
Knowledge of print publishing practices.

Tradeweb is looking for a compliance officer to support our European (EU & UK) compliance programmes. You will an important support for our international compliance advisory work, with a reporting line to a supportive and experienced compliance officer based in Amsterdam.
Description
You will have relevant regulatory knowledge, experience and confidence, which you will use to advise colleagues about internal policies, draft good quality policiy and compliance documents, track incidents and risk mitigation work, and organise periodic management reporting. Depending on any subject matter expertise you may have you may be expected to take a lead on specific aspects of our overall programme. This is a broad and varied role, with lots of opportunity to make a difference across many compliance topics.
To succeed, you will need to be a team-player, pragmatic, and be able to maintain good relationships of trust with colleagues. You will need to be flexible enough to deal with a variety of day-to-day enquiries/tasks/approvals (be hands on), whilst also able to draft important documents such as policies, management information and regulator communications (be detail oriented).
Outside of compliance, you should expect to work most closely with enterprise risk management colleagues (to track and mitigate incidents/regulatory risks) and finance (to support inbound audit requests and monitor regulatory reporting).

This is a hands-on role which would suit someone who works at pace, is detail orientated, flexible, and adaptable. As an inclusive team we want to hear from everyone with the relevant skills and interest, and we are particularly keen to hear from you if you also have some practical experience in one of the following three subjects: (1) investment firm prudential requirements and documentation (ICAAP/ICARA); (2) transaction reporting oversight; and (3) transparency reporting oversight.
Responsibilities
Providing reactive advise on internal policies to colleagues, supporting our compliance culture at Tradeweb
Managing approvals on behalf of the compliance function, recommend improvements to our procedures and implement improvements
Monitoring and overseeing the completion of periodic regulatory reporting requirements on behalf of the compliance function
Working with relevant legal entity compliance officers, ensure our policies and documents are reviewed and updated at the required cadence
Improving and routinely prepare compliance management information for use by the Head of Compliance in governance fora
Supporting us to maintain strong and co-operative relationships with our European regulators by tracking deliverables and drafting initial correspondence, where appropriate
Working with risk management colleagues to track incidents and monitor remediation work
Being flexible and willing to take on projects that arise from time-to-time, for example licence applications
Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree
Good knowledge of relevant regulations, notably UK and EU requirements relevant to Trading Venues, and able to intergpret and apply these to day-to-day operational and policy work; you must be able and confident to provide reasoned opinions and recommendation to compliance colleagues and support the development of our positions to other stakeholders.
Good project management and/or demonstrable organisational skills, with a willingness and capability to handle multiple projects at one time.
Excellent research and analytical skills, and able to present reasoned recommendations to compliance and risk colleagues, and to provide guidance on internal policies to business stakeholders as questions arise.
Skills / Attributes
You will have experience ideally gained in brokerages, securities trading, regulator or exchange environments, with a good knowledge of relevant regulations
If you are a specialist you must be looking expand your horizons to make a difference in a broad range of markets infrastructure compliance topics, and you will need to demonstrate a willingness and the skills to grasp new subjects quickly
You must be able to interact professionally and effectively with a diverse group including business colleagues and other corporate function, notably risk management, human resources, finance (regulatory capital and audit colleagues), and legal
You will be resilient, proactive and sufficiently organised to help keep the EU and UK trading venue compliance deliverables on track
You will need to have a dedication to maintaining and continuously influencing good corporate culture and ethics, be a self-starter, and be able to work independently
About the Company:
Tradeweb Markets Inc. (NASDAQ: TW) is a leading, global operator of electronic marketplaces for rates, credit, equities and money markets. Founded in 1996, Tradeweb provides access to markets, data and analytics, electronic trading, straight-through-processing and reporting for clients in the institutional, wholesale and retail markets. Advanced technologies developed by Tradeweb enhance price discovery, order execution and trade workflows while allowing for greater scale and helping to reduce risks in client trading operations. For more information, please go to www.tradeweb.com .
Tradeweb values diversity of culture and thought and seeks talented, qualified employees in all its operations around the world regardless of race, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other protected classification under country or local law.
