Job Description:
Product Manager
Dow Jones is on a journey to take our products to the next level and we need you to assist in making that happen. The Operations team is key to ensuring that our deliverables are executed as efficiently as possible. They are also our cultural backbone, team mentor, and give life to the organization.
The FN/PEN news pages are committed to informing our readers, and our editorials are dedicated to advocating a consistent philosophy and positions that emanate from it. That philosophy can be summed up as ‘free markets, free people.’ You will be responsible for the delivery of clearly defined requirements and their functions and impacts within the ecosystem. You will also be responsible for translating the obtained information into usable work components that our engineering partners can work off of. Partnering with cross-functional teams to identify system constraints, and manage expectations, and risks.
Who You Are:
A detailed oriented individual
Possess the gift of gab with the ability to translate the technical into business and business into technical
Understands the product's business and technical needs
Are a proactive problem solver
Are thorough: Demonstrates strong attention to detail, good follow-through, and clear communication
Questions value and encourage others to do the same
Stays calm under pressure, acts fast, promotes and sees the big picture, embraces change; is resilient
Is continuously learning, actively listens, and is a thought leader in project management
Have an agile environment background
Capable of working well with team members on different teams and in different locations
Responsibilities include:
Develop an expert understanding of our current and prospective consumers
Understand the nuances behind different types of news content and define how they should be communicated to consumers.
Champion the user experience while delivering key business outcomes
Work cross-functionally across Design, Research, Engineering, Experimentation, the newsroom, and business stakeholders to define and prioritize business and newsroom requirements for FNLondon.com and PENews.com, driving user engagement as well as subscriptions and advertising revenue
Work with the Product team to define the product vision and roadmap that achieves product strategy and business outcomes for the Opinion and Style content sections
Proactively manage and prioritize a backlog
Write clear, concise requirements and user stories that clearly and unambiguously communicate acceptance criteria (i.e. what success looks like) and work closely with software developers throughout the product life cycle
Coordinate communication between developers, designers, and business stakeholders regarding goals, requirements, and growth expectations
Define success criteria and measure Key Performance Indicators to demonstrate ROI and P&L impact of product enhancements
Work with research teams to gather and analyze audience research and feedback regarding new products and enhancements
Other duties as assigned
Requirements:
1-2 years of product management experience with consumer-facing products.
5+ years in a Business/Systems Analyst role
Passionate and knowledgeable about mobile, digital media, and news.
Decisive with a bias towards action; must thrive in fast-paced, agile environments
Ability to accurately handle multiple tasks and projects in a fast-paced environment
Strong analytical skills, including knowledge of Adobe analytics platform and/or others
Ability to effectively present and explain results with quantitative information
Experience analyzing qualitative and quantitative consumer research.
Experience defining and implementing product requirements for mobile apps.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills; ability to communicate and collaborate effectively across the full spectrum of internal stakeholders and customers.
Experience working closely with engineering and design teams.
Dow Jones , Making Careers Newsworthy

Non-Union role
Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world’s top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron’s, MarketWatch and Financial News.
This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

Risk Learning is looking for a creative, enthusiastic, self-motivating individual who will be working with a global team and is passionate about creating engaging learning experiences and events.
As a Learning Events Producer, you will take direct responsibility for researching, producing, developing, and running training courses within Infopro Digital's global Risk Learning portfolio. These events focus on financial risk management in global capital markets.
Our brand is rapidly expanding, and we are always looking for innovative new talent. Our range of events are held both virtually and in-person offering travel, hybrid-working, and progression opportunities.
Key responsibilities include:
Ownership and project management of multiple learning events through their full lifecycle- from creation of agenda to execution of event
Identification of key areas of learning development and emerging trends in financial risk management supporting innovation of topics, formats, and features to rapidly develop new training ideas to expand the brand portfolio
Conduct in-depth telephone and face-to-face research with high-profile individuals within the sector to support creation of engaging agenda content
Identification, sourcing, and management of professional relationships with key senior level industry subject matter experts as speakers pre/post event
Collaboration with the Risk Learning wider team to support commercial deliverables, maximising delegate revenues achieved and including creation of dynamic marketing and sales copy
Facilitation of virtual (and in-person) learning events representing Risk Learning to external audiences
Requirements
We are looking for a positive, creative, and resourceful candidate for this role. While we are not looking for a candidate with a specific background, we do welcome all applicants who are excited by learning in all its forms, offering:
An ability to adapt and enthusiasm for developing new skills
Persuasive communication skills- particularly written and listening to aid creation of engaging agendas and marketing copy
Ability to conduct analytical research (both desk and phone call)
Comfortability in engaging with high level content from various sources and senior industry subject-matter experts
Strong interpersonal and relationship management skills with the ability to form, influence, and manage relationships with prospective, senior-level speakers
Project management skills- with particular focus on time management, prioritization, deadline management, and detail orientation
Multi-tasking is essential to this role as you will project manage all aspects of training programmes, while constantly keeping an eye on the industry for new trends and players
Benefits
We know great people make great companies. Infopro Digital is defined by people and passion, and powered by knowledge and innovation. Everything we do is centred on trust, integrity and respect. Our collaborative approach drives creativity across our markets; and our focus on giving teams ownership allows us to build an entrepreneurial culture where our people and brands can thrive and grow.
We run a Foundation which supports a number of charities. Staff can volunteer to contribute their skills and expertise to make a meaningful difference to the lives of others.

Southern England

James George Recruitment has partnered with a Tier 1 Asset Finance House that is looking to add an additional Channel Development Manager to their Technology Finance team in Southern England. Your territory is likely to include Bristol across to London, Midlands and the South East.
Our Client’s significant growth plans have various “routes to market” but this particular route will focus mainly on Vendors/Resellers. This is a client development and sales focused role that will be exciting and challenging where your success is within your own control.

Under the general direction of the National Audit and Compliance Manager, the Auditor will perform a wide variety of tasks relating to the management of client and group quality management systems. The role will also entail auditing, coaching, safety and education of all Kelly Group operatives, and that of those directly linked to business on behalf of our clients
Responsibilities:
· Responsible for carrying out quality, H&S, tooling and vehicle audits on Kelly Group engineers, with focus on civils and cabling.

About Kelly Group:
Established in 1985 to support the emerging UK cable television market, Kelly Group has diversified to meet the needs of our clients. With over 35 years’ experience and customer service at the heart of our business, Kelly Group is renowned for building networks in collaboration with several major leading telecommunication service providers, delivering innovative multi-functional solutions - connecting people globally.
Working across several industries including telecommunications, rail, metro, highways and fleet, Kelly Group operate nationally with 40+ operational centres and deliver a full suite of services. From the initial planning, design, notification through to installation, final commissioning and maintenance of networks, Kelly Group deliver a ‘one-stop solution’ to meet the needs of our clients and delight their customers.
As a service provider, our workforce is our extended family, which is why we invest in their safety, training, careers, welfare, vehicles and tools they need to deliver excellence. The best of both worlds. That is what a position with Infopro Digital offers you. We are first a global company with 4,000 employees and annual revenues of over half a billion dollars with a presence in 18 countries. Through our market-leading brands, we serve five professional communities – insurance and finance, automotive aftermarket, construction, retail, and industrials – enabling our clients to make informed business decisions and create new opportunities.
Secondly, our global brands focused on the financial services industry, known collectively as Risk Global, is a 300-person organisation with offices in Hong Kong, London, Nashville, and New York. Working in the Risk Global teams means being part of a company that has strong financial backing, while at the same time giving you the power to truly make a difference.
Risk Global’s portfolio of brands include Central Banking, Chartis Research, Insurance Post, Insurance Age, Risk.net and WatersTechnology. Through our proprietary editorial platforms, we create unique market insight and technical content for senior risk, technology and trading professionals at banks, asset managers and insurers. In addition, we create high-value marketing services and research solutions to partners who seek access to our engaged communities.
An opportunity has become available in our London offices for selling enterprise subscriptions to various clients across
the UK and Europe.
We are seeking a talented sales professional to join our London-based subscription sales team.
The job will suit an ambitious,creative and hard-working person keen to accelerate their career in sales.
The Subscription Account Manager will be responsible for:

Delivering significant uplift in our individual and enterprise subscriptions through up-sell and new business
Retaining our existing client subscription base at a ratio > 80%
Building and developing client relationships across their book of business of clients
Presenting usage statistics to key customers
Protecting our copyright and monetizing opportunities highlighted through client infringement
Establishing best-in-class sales and client engagement practices (in close partnership with the Group Marketing Director and Head of Customer Services)
Transitioning our subscription business from individual subscriptions to enterprise subscriptions
Driving increased penetration and engagement across our existing client base
Building close partnerships with the enterprise customers



Requirements
The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate a track record of exceeding targets, of delivering creative and valuable solutions to their clients and of developing and motivating high-performing teams. Previous experience of media sales is important as we are looking for individuals who can accelerate the growth of our brands and customer base.
Only the most ambitious salespeople with strong track records should apply for this role. If you are creative, consultative, able to build strategic relationships with your client base and motivate others around you, then this is the perfect role for you.
Building a detailed understanding of our markets and global accounts, including their business strategy, drivers, goals and initiatives and translating these into valuable marketing strategies
Communicating and creating compelling high-quality proposals independently – as well as supporting innovation and developing new products and services
Establishing and maintaining executive relationships with clients in all their primary locations
Sales planning across your accounts and team to deliver global growth objectives, with responsibility for accurate pipeline management and forecasting

A fantastic holiday allowance that increases as you spend longer with the company
Take your birthday off…on us
Access to our Group pension plan, life assurance, private medical & dental insurance, retail discounts, and much more
Access to a 24/7/365 Employee Assistance Programme offering support and guidance around all areas of wellbeing and mental health, including face-to-face counselling.
Access to our extensive learning programmes, through our dedicated platform, Generation Infopro
Paid volunteer days throughout the year where you can contribute your skills and expertise to make a meaningful difference to the lives of others

JOB TITLE
Service Manager – Together and Youth Connex
SALARY
£35,000 per annum
ACCOUNTABLE TO
Director of Operations
RESPONSIBLE FOR
Leading the delivery and development of Together and Youth Connex services and activities ensuring high quality care and support to achieve desired outcomes for individuals
Manage the service lifecycle, including its strategic and operational goals while ensuring attainment of targets and business sustainability
Act as the Ofsted Registered Manager for Youth Connex
HOURS OF WORK
35 hours per week
SUMMARY OF ROLE
To oversee the day to day operations and development of a range of centre and community facing services for disabled people and children with SEN, providing high quality care and support that meets the desired outcomes of the people we support. Services include day opportunities for adults, short breaks, after school, weekend and holiday clubs.
Lead the delivery of highly effective and aligned operational practices to deliver intended outcomes across services including, individualised approaches, strength based support planning, positive risk taking that gives each person the strongest voice with regards to decision making and life choices.

Keep abreast of sector wide developments, initiatives and innovative solutions and approaches to service delivery/offers
Develop and sustain positive relationships with commissioners, funders and partners from the public, private and voluntary sectors to enhance and develop services and provisions
Provide accountability to the Executive Team and make presentations when required on issues and business performance.

FairHeat is a heat network consultancy playing a leading role in the decarbonisation of heat in the UK.
Founded in 2015 by innovators in the sector, FairHeat has rapidly established itself as the leading experts on how to specify, design, delivery and operate low temperature heat networks in the UK. This has received wide recognition within the industry, with FairHeat receiving multiple awards, including ADE Consultancy Project of the Year (2016), ADE Innovation of the Decade (2017), Network Awards Heat Network of the Year (2019), CIBSE Employer of the Year (2019, 2021) and CIBSE Building Performance Award – Collaboration (2022).
FairHeat’s data-based approach is one of its key points of differentiation in the heat network industry, with unparalleled access to performance data.
FairHeat is also well known for its innovative approach in developing and deploying standardised processes that improve system outcome, particularly with respect to commissioning processes. As an example, FairHeat developed a standardised Acceptance Testing process, which has just been adopted as a minimum requirement within the latest version of the CIBSE Heat Network Code of Practice (CP1 2020).
In contrast to most design consultancies in the sector, FairHeat is positioned as client representative, working with other design consultancies and contractors to ensure optimum results for clients. Primarily focused on London, FairHeat has many of the largest London based social housing organisations and private developers as clients. There are two main parts to the business: (1) A New Build practice, focused on supporting clients from specification through to system commissioning; and (2) an Operations practice focused on ensuring that systems perform well, with a heavy focus on improving the performance of poorly performing legacy systems.
In line with its success in the market, FairHeat has experienced rapid growth and is looking to support the ongoing development of the business by bringing in additional talent.
The Role
The Project Manager reports to Head of Delivery and is responsible for ensuring the project deliverables she/he works on meet the client requirements and are delivered safely, on time and within budget across a wide range of activities.
The role will require a mix of project management, technical engineering and strong stakeholder management. You must be proactive and comfortable working with minimal supervision, but also understand your own limitations and seek support/approval when required. You must be engaged in your own personal development, as it is essential the Project Manager has a strong technical and commercial understanding of most of the areas and services that FairHeat manage.
The Project Manager will look after a range of live heat network construction projects of the following typical scope:
Plantroom and network end of life equipment replacements.
Full plantroom and network retrofits to improve performance (e.g. Heat Network Efficiency Scheme funded projects).
Heat pump retrofits to decarbonise existing buildings (e.g. PSDS project delivery management).
HIU and heat meter upgrade/replacement works.
District Heating project installations, including energy centres, buried networks and substation plantrooms.
Duties & Responsibilities
Core Role
To manage the above projects, you will be expected to:
Manage a ranch of projects, with multiple live contracts at different stages of design/construction/commissioning.
Oversee and monitor the Health & Safety management of the project, ensuring the relevant RAMS are in place for all internal and external works and all near misses, incidents and accidents are reported in line with the relevant processes.
Ensure FairHeat is fully compliant with the Construction and Design Management Regulatory (CDM 2015) and ensure that all legal duties are carried out, documented and regularly reviewed.
Monitor and measure project expenditure against budgets throughout the project lifecycle and report to line management.
Develop and maintain effective working relationships with Clients and other key stakeholders.
Advice our clients on their CDM 2015 duties and provide support as required to assist them with the management of these duties.
Manage tender processes for both design and contractor packages, including preparation of bid materials, review of tender responses, responding to RFIs and making recommendations to the Head of Delivery on appointments.
Overall contract management to ensure the work is being delivered in line with the contractual scope/appointments.
Manage the projects during delivery. This will involve ensuring the contracted scope is delivered within the agreed budget and timescales. You will be expected to own and manage the project risk registers and use these as your primary communication tool to internal and external stakeholders on project risks, delays, changes and opportunities.
Ensure the projects have sufficient resources allocated to them, and that the resources have suitable experience, competence and training to deliver the scope of works under the contract. This will involve the production and management of project programs/Gantt charts/coordinated resource plans.
Due to the nature of the role, you also be expected to take technical ownership on the onsite Quality Assurance of the delivered system. This will involve coordination and management of FairHeat’s engineering resource to support as necessary, but you will be responsible for:
Administration of FairHeat’s industry leading Employer’s Requirements for heat networks.
Ensuring the technical submittal and contractor design approvals process has been complete before purchase or installation of equipment.
Ensuring method statements have been approved before commissioning activities commence.
Ensuring water quality is being monitored onsite and the results are within the contracted KPI limits.
Ensuring the installation has been inspected and signed off at the contractual milestones prior to handover.
Ensuring the contractual KPIs have been independently tested by FairHeat prior to handover, such as Acceptance Testing and plantroom load testing.
Ensuring the O&M manuals and as built documentation is provided prior to final contactor payment.
Communication, management and resolution of any snags/issues/remedial measures that arise from the above Quality Assurance process.
In addition, you will have responsibility for managing key clients, involving building client relationships and producing proposals that match FairHeat services with their requirements.
The Project Manager is expected to provide mentorship to all engineers, ensuring the upskilling and knowledge growth of these individuals. You will also be expected to support the wider team in developing Project Management competence within the business.
It is expected that the Project Manager will develop into a leading expert within the market with regards to heat network construction, performance monitoring and the cost and effectiveness of implementing different types of physical interventions to heating systems and component equipment (e.g. HIUs). As part of this, you will be expected to support FairHeat in their industry initiatives, which includes technical webinars to CIBSE, steering committee members of various working groups/technical standards and marketing events.
Support the development of new tools and systems and ad hoc projects
Support in identifying, scoping, receiving management sign off and then project managing:
o Business improvement tools such as new processes and documentation.
o New ways of working e.g. more efficient utilisation of resources.
Support business development activity and project management of FairHeat projects
Assist the Associate/Principal Engineer in producing quotes for projects, based on calculation of likely time cost against client requirements.
Develop and maintain client relationships and ensure these grow overtime into successful long-term partnerships.
Assist the Head of Delivery in managing projects to ensure safe delivery within time and cost, ensuring clear, timely communication to both clients and the MD when likely overruns are identified.
Key Requirements
BEng or MEng degree in a relevant engineering discipline OR equivalent qualification in construction/project management.
Minimum 5 years’ experience in project management and/or technical management of M&E systems/heat networks.
A CSCS Card.
SMSTS/SSSTS qualified.
A HSE recognised First Aid at work qualification.
Engineering project management experience of M&E systems, ideally heat networks.
Budget and contract management of construction packages, ideally M&E and/or heat networks.
Desirable
Direct experience of managing the delivery of internal building communal heating system upgrade works (dwelling, network and plantroom).
Direct experience of the delivery of major Energy Centre and/or buried network projects for large scale District Heating networks.
Knowledge of District Heating network design, construction and operations.
APM/PRINCE2 or equivalent Project Management Qualification.
Salary, Benefits and Other Information
Attractive & market competitive remuneration in heat network business sector.
Annual discretionary bonus.
FairHeat will match 5% pension contributions.
25 days annual leave in addition to the normal public/bank holidays.
Full time, 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday, 9.00am – 5.30pm.
Can work up to 2 days per week from home.
Be part of a growing innovative business and help shape the future of energy.
Collaborative, supportive, flexible and friendly environment.
Comprehensive Induction Programme.
Buddy Scheme.
2 Volunteer / Social Engagement Days.
Quarterly and annual social events, from sports day to a whole company getaway.
Free coffee, teas and fruit every day, and a variety of beverages.
FairHeat is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of any kind: FairHeat is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. FairHeat is committed to achieving a diverse workforce through application of an affirmative action, equal opportunity approach in all aspects of employment including recruitment, hiring, promotions, discipline, terminations, salary, benefits, and training.

As Chief Technologist (Security), you will be the face of our Security growth pillar from a technology and market perspective, playing an integral role in the development of our Integrated Technology business through progressive and balanced thought leadership, collaboration with wider business units as it pertains to market and opportunity assessment, and assist with proposition or service capability development.

You will proactively engage and collaborate with customers, sales leadership, sellers, and the wider business, ensuring our opinion in the market is well communicated through internal and public speaking, and assist with the development and publication of whitepapers, blog posts, VT and/or podcasts.

As a member of the Office of the CTO you will collaborate with leaders across the Integrated Technology business to help develop and evolve our strategy in line with market dynamics, helping develop business cases, roadmaps and partner training and certification plans.

Key Responsibilities
Be the thought leader/evangelist for the Security business, helping customers improve their security posture using relevant security platforms and control mechanisms (infrastructure security, endpoint protection platforms, identity & access management, Secure service edge, workload and application protection, data security, vulnerability & risk management, SOC services & tooling, compliance, and governance)
Regularly communicate CDW UK’s market opinion, relevance, and capability through a variety of forums as a brand ambassador (e.g., internal seller enablement briefings, win wires, case studies, public speaking, partner engagements, quarterly state of the market reports, podcasts, VT creation)
Meet and collaborate with key customers and partners frequently to understand priorities and roadmaps, helping drive increased revenue by identifying new opportunities
Host, attend and participate in internal, customer or partner events to showcase CDW’s capability
Build meaningful and lasting relationships with senior stakeholders within our partner community
Contribute to the development, launch and evolution of packaged Professional and Managed Services products as they pertain to propositions
Assist in the identification of new partners and technology which will contribute to CDW’s success and market relevance
Qualifications, Skills, and Experiences
10+ Years’ experience in the Information Technology market with proven experience working as a senior leader combined with a demonstrable track record of leading and developing teams and individuals
Proven experience of CxO level interaction, engagement, and relationship management
Proven track record of driving revenue growth, managing cost, and attracting, retaining, and developing talent
Strong understanding and experience of the procurement lifecycle including negotiation, contracting, and the management of third parties
Experience in building internal departmental brand and engaging with multiple internal business units
Professional certification (desirable) such as TOGAF®/Architecture, Leadership & Management, Expert, or advanced level certifications within specialism
Existing public personal brand (desirable) with links into wider technology communities or participation in executive councils or invite only community initiatives
Experience in the development of engaging public facing content in written, audio and/or visual formats
Essential Attributes
Highly ambitious, credible, motivated, and accountable individual with an appreciation for building meaningful and lasting relationships, combined with a desire and ability to “win hearts and minds” - Confident yet humble in their approach
Detail-oriented with strong time management skills combined with the capacity to lead and work on multiple initiatives, as well as dynamically prioritise and pivot based on changing business needs
Outstanding communications skills, with the ability to clearly and concisely present concepts and recommendations in verbal, written, and presentation formats to customers, senior leaders, and cross-functional audiences
High levels of industry-related knowledge with an insatiable thirst for new information relevant to the market
Prepared for occasional travel between CDW UK & International offices as the role requires whilst maintaining a suitable home life balance
Ability to allocate time to undertake personal development activities such as attending training, achieving certifications, and focusing on soft-skill development – always seeking to personally develop as an individual

Job title: Global Assistant New Product Development & Innovation Manager
Description:
Job Title: Global Assistant New Product Development & Innovation Manager
Location: Brentford
Contract: Fulltime/ Permanent
Hours of Work: 37.5 (Hybrid, 2-3 days in the office)
Department: Marketing
Reporting to: Global Senior New Product Development & Innovation Manager
Aromatherapy Associates has been sharing the therapeutic powers of essential oils for over 35 years. The Brand was founded in 1985 by Geraldine Howard & Sue Beechey, therapists that had trained under the renowned aromatherapist Micheline Arcier, who can be traced back to the modern-day founders of aromatherapy. It was then that they experienced first-hand the powerfully positive effects of essential oils on our physical and emotional wellbeing.
As a Company we have a family culture and live by one of Geraldine’s beliefs: “It’s more than just a business, it’s a way of life”.
The brand is present in over 50 markets globally with Regional Sales offices in the UK, US and Hong Kong.
Distribution is across Spa, Retail, Online Retailers, E-commerce and Distributor partners.
As aromatherapy experts, our vision has remained constant for a generation – sharing the power and therapeutic effects of natural essential oils. Our award-winning blends have gained recognition across the beauty world for their transformative effects on the mind, body and skin.
We care deeply about the ingredients we use and how we deliver them to you. We take a mindful approach to the origins, workers wellbeing and certification of all our oils and botanicals, with a commitment to evolving our support for global community projects.
Our sustainability vision is an ongoing endeavour, along with our desire to create the very best aromatherapy products, so you can enjoy beautiful, glowing, healthy skin, free from harsh chemicals and unnecessary synthetics.
Overview of the role
Our brand has gone from strength to strength, continually winning awards, making a difference and just voted Cool brand of the year for those that are up and coming. Our leadership and plans are strong. As a Global Assistant New Product Development & Innovation Manager, you will be a key member of the team to support the creation of the right products and experiences to delight our new wellbeing consumer.
You will lead the development of our new products from concept stage to launch, including working with a cross functional team, manufacturers and creative agencies. You will create and own the critical paths, as well as manage costing and budget to ensure timely delivery of new product launches, holding the consumer and customer at the heart of your thinking.
You will report into the Global Senior New Product Development & Innovation Manager and work collaboratively with Marketing, R&D, Operations, Sales and Finance.
Key Responsibilities
Overall, the day-to-day responsibilities and accountabilities are as follows:
Successfully manage multiple projects simultaneously, developing & delivering strong products that reflect Aromatherapy’s Associates philosophy.
Manage new product development from concept through to delivery, taking full ownership of the critical path to ensure timely delivery.
Management of Stage Gate sign offs according to project CPA’s, including working on COGs, RRPs and margin to hit the budgets.
Communicating project CPAs internally as well as with key external stakeholders such as suppliers, to ensure that project timings are maintained and be responsible for escalating risks to Leadership
Team.
Chair weekly NPD marketing meeting to track NPD project updates.
Creating and presenting product concept decks to NPD, wider teams & Leadership members when relevant.
Prepare artwork briefs and manage the artwork approval process, as well as develop packaging copy including claims.
Manage external stakeholders and their work from brief & evaluation specifically design & packaging.
Ensure ongoing analysis of data, consumer, competitor and trend insights to support the development of concepts and to input into the NPD plans.
Supporting the Senior Innovation & NPD Manager on projects, according to set objectives.
The Ideal Candidate
As a Global Assistant NPD & Innovation Manager, you will have an innate sense of gravitas and the consumer, you will want to drive best-in-class innovation and continually develop as a professional, you will hold the consumer at the heart of everything you do, which in turn will drive a clear route to sales.
On top of this, we would like you to demonstrate some, or all, of the following:
Have 2+ years of experience working in NPD, with a track record of developing successful product concepts within beauty and personal care.
Have a passion for luxury beauty & wellbeing, a self-starter who’s ready to roll up your sleeves and help shape the future of the NPD process within Aromatherapy Associates.
Love to make things happen and have hands on experience of cross-functional CPA project management - delivering innovative & luxury products on time & within budget.
Have excellent commercial acumen, ensuring that NPD projects reflect the key growth objectives of the brand through strong business cases proposals.
Experience in delivering strong product, packaging and artwork briefing and managing external stakeholders such as design agencies and packaging suppliers.
Strong creative skills from developing creative concepts and packaging briefs, to the product copy on pack.
Excellent Project Management & time management.
Resilient, able to adapt to the NPD process which is undergoing change, being proactive and resilient to anticipate issues and provide solutions and willingness to roll sleeves.
Strategic Thinking – ability to analyse, understand core areas of opportunity and propose solutions and ideas to the team.
Relationship, Collaboration & Stakeholder Management.
Strong negotiation skills.
Problem-solving mind-set.
Creative thinking.
Strong attention to detail.

As part of our B Corp, we proudly allocate 2 days a year for community/charity work

INTRODUCING CONVERA
Want to be part of a transformation journey with a company that feels like a start-up but already has a successful business with significant runway for stronger and faster growth? Are you interested in building a career in Fintech at a place with the ambition and means to become a unique B2B platform that is truly agile-at-scale? Do you want to work somewhere with great people from a wide variety of backgrounds because people are what power our company’s success? Then Convera is the place for you!
In 2021, we launched Convera, a company committed to bringing its customers the most advanced business payments and FX platform in the world. Convera was formed to acquire the assets and companies that previously comprised Western Union Business Solutions, a division of The Western Union Company. Convera’s acquisition of Western Union Business Solutions is subject to requisite work council and trade union consultations, regulatory approvals and other customary closing conditions. Following this acquisition, Convera will become one of the largest non-bank B2B cross-border payments companies in the world. Leveraging decades of industry expertise to deliver smarter money movements, Convera is committed to ensuring that our customers capture more value with every transaction.
WHAT WE DO & WHO WE SERVE
Providing tech-led payment solutions to a broad range of organizations globally, Convera serves customers ranging from small business owners to enterprise treasurers to educational and financial institutions. Delivering solutions ranging from simple currency exchanges to sophisticated cross-border payments platforms and solutions, everything we do is designed to enhance the customer experience and seamlessly power their global commerce needs.
In 2020, the business processed over $110 billion in transactions. With an existing customer base of more than 30,000 small and medium-sized businesses, educational institutions, financial institutions, law firms, and NGOs spanning over 40 countries and territories and 140 currencies, the business possesses a truly global footprint and serves some of the fastest-growing segments of the B2B cross-border payments markets.
Powered by a sophisticated and expansive global settlement network, Convera’s capabilities are built on efficiency, accuracy and compliance at its core, alleviating risk and accelerating smarter decision making.

As a standalone fintech, Convera will build on its customer-led culture and accelerate its investments in technology, product innovation and people to drive growth.The ideal candidate has strong experience making change happen by being data & insights-led, a strong communicator and an empathetic influencer. There are many backgrounds that successful candidates could draw from – some of the most common ones include management consulting, product/program management, and internal corporate strategy roles. The candidate should be excited to be part of building this new capability and function for the organization.

In your role as Principal, Global Transformation, you will:
Help Convera transform into one of the premier
Manage a highly ambitious, complex, and cross-functional transformation program
Drive informed decision-making on competing priorities to optimize overall results and outcomes
Manage execution of the corporate transformation program, taking a more direct and greater leadership role on priority initiatives partnering with leaders across the org
Stress test initiatives to help ensure they are robust and truly drive better customer delivery, growth, productivity and margin improvement
Bring visibility to resource and budget plans, escalating risks and making recommendations to executives as needed
Lead management of cross-functional dependencies, stepping in to drive resolution as needed
Lead progress tracking and reporting, including raising key issues to executives
Track transformation initiative results & impacts
Support
Help teams crisply frame a problem, communicate how insights lead to their recommendations, and facilitate decision-making by the C-suite and Board
Show teams how to use structured logic, and develop insights from data-led research/analyses to inform potential paths and trade-offs
Be a self-motivated go-getter who is willing to take on work outside your comfort zone, and works well in ambiguity
Be highly data/insights-led – laying out the evidence when presenting recommendations to the C-suite and other senior leaders to make choices
Be a culture-carrier as a critical member of an empowered and enthusiastic team who partners well throughout the organization
A successful Principal, Global Transformation for this fintech should ideally have:
Strong experience in transformation,
Prior experience at a top tier consulting firm (Bain, BCG, McKinsey) or tech company a plus
Experience in B2B payments, FX, banking and/or the Fintech space preferred
High degree of digital / technical literacy i.e. able to understand digital/technical work enough to question approaches, and identify potential risks / dependencies
Highly structured ways of working and outstanding problem solving skills with an emphasis on data-driven decision making, even when you don’t have all the data
Able to take complicated questions, break them down, and analyze complex quantitative and qualitative inputs to make recommendations
Strong communication skills – able to present arguments simply & logically, including use of verbal and written communication to express ideas clearly and succinctly
build productive and positive
Ability to both think strategically and have a practical bias for action with an "ownership" mentality; will deep dive to drive execution in a fast-paced environment
Practical in how to execute the transformation agenda – willing to work hands on to help coach teams on best approaches to deliver results
Humble, can-do attitude with a learning mindset and ability to thrive in ambiguity; you are intellectually curious, have a passion for excellence and want to make a big impact
Works well in a fast-paced fintech, PE backed environment
Proficient in PowerPoint, Excel and Word – skilled in business logic development, analytics/modeling and communication to executive audiences
Bachelor’s degree or MBA preferred from an accredited educational institution
Able to travel as required

Market

Paid volunteering opportunities

Discovery is at the centre of everything we do. Wherever you find us around the world, if you can think of a product, you can probably find it in our stores. We are part of the TJX Family which includes TK Maxx, and Homesense in Europe and the UK and across the rest of the world you will find us as TJ Maxx, Marshalls, HomeGoods, Sierra and Winners. With variety comes plenty of surprises—our environment is ever-changing, and that’s just how we like it. Every day is an opportunity to discover something new about our business, our partnerships and even something exciting about yourself. Are you ready to Discover Different?

We may be famous for big brands at small prices, but our best kept secret is our amazing culture.

We’re part of the TJX Companies Inc, the leading off-price fashion and homeware retailer in the world. In Europe, we have over 600 stores across six countries, and two brands – TK Maxx and Homesense. We’re a passionate bunch here, and we’re looking for someone who’s as obsessed about fashion and home retail as we are.

We’ve been taking our responsibility as a business seriously for 25 years. Whether it’s the millions we’ve raised for our charity partners (over £55 million so far), our green initiatives through the Carbon Trust or the sustainable trade programme we helped set up in Uganda, we believe in giving something back to our community.

Everyone who becomes part of the TJX family brings something unique to our collective culture – a diversity of experience, gender, ethnicity, age, viewpoint and much more.

JOB SUMMARY

An exciting Pan- European role for a resilient, commercial, self-starter with a broad skill set to manage a unique end to end business unit. You will work with the Marketing groups and cross functionally in Europe as well as globally with the Gift Card Teams to share ideas and gain economies of scale, whilst managing a team to drive and initiate sales in all revenue streams. You will work collaboratively with our outsourced partner Diggecard to drive B2B and our external partners to pursue new opportunities and optimise existing relationships in all markets.

The role requires a variety of skills, ranging from team and business management, input into strategy, marketing, competitor and sector knowledge, presentation to internal stakeholders, and external relationship building, where we are the supplier rather than the customer. A high degree of numeracy is essential with an omnipresent focus on delivering results whist maintaining the principles of the business model.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Day to Day Management of Gift Cards
Reviews weekly design performance with team and proposes appropriate action
Sets up and manages all control documents and processes
Phasing
PO tracker, reflecting budget
Timescales with Creative to achieve on-time delivery of cards and Marketing materials
Manages store allocation process and sales/ inventory review
Seasonal planning and submission of allocations

Oversees new store opening allocations ensuring stock is allocated to arrive in conjunction with handover
Oversees Inventory count and analyses results taking appropriate action, increasing buys and proposing actions for team to progress with ops
Manages relationship with Store ops

Manages comms with stores and internal comms

Manages, collaborates and identify opportunities with B2B Sales and Fulfilment partner and other external partners
Understand our B2B agency’s business model and operation
Establishes and develops a B2B business plan and strategy including sales, profit, costs, marketing and inventory forecasts and projections by partner/ stream collaborating with business partners.
Optimise existing contacts with our outsourced partner and conduct regular reviews
Review and report on performance/ SLAs
Investigate, agree and initiate supporting marketing materials within budget constraints
Agree 3rd party promotions within the budget and in accordance with the model
Meets at least once annually with key partners.
Negotiates and oversees the progression of 3rd party contracts in accordance with business model & POs working in conjunction with Global Sourcing & Procurement, Legal and Global Payments.

Input into long term Gift Card overarching Strategy and annual planning
Provides commentary, feedback and proposals regarding existing processes
Manages the creative development process
Campaign & marketing planning, implementation, reporting and presentation internally and with external partners – status, decks, agreeing activity, briefing and progressing creative in timely way, monitoring activity with external partners and obtaining budget approvals when needed
Sets up and estimates production by design reconciling back to budget
Assists on sales and budget planning by Fascia/ revenue stream

Reporting
Ensures Officer works with Commercial Finance and Sales Audit to ensure all partners and streams are captured on the weekly Gift Card report
Checks weekly report from Finance before final issuance
Review SVS production reports, identifying any risks
Confirms stock holding/ value to Sales Audit as required

Understand the market
Maintains external perspective on market, trends, merchandising, selling and competitive landscape in Europe.
General understanding of regulations and tax implications
Attends industry conferences and GCVA (Gift Card and Voucher association) meetings

Manages, coaches and develops the Officer
Day to day management of the Gift card officer including: -
Overseeing timely and accurate raising, reporting and reconciliation of POs
Planogram- comms to store operations on gift card merchandising
Regular analysis of sales performance by brand and by design
Inventory count

Gift card inbox queries.
Conducts weekly 121’s, mid and end year reviews
Encourages the Officer to “Be their best self” and initiate self-development and a PDP

Key Skills, Knowledge & Experience

Experience in and knowledge of Gift card programmes preferable
Good at fostering relationships and partnerships
Strong organisational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks to the highest standard
Effective communication skills

Ability to think on their feet
High integrity

Customer focused

Models the leadership competencies

Come and Discover Different at TJX. From opportunity and teamwork to growth, we think you’ll find that it’s so much more than a job. At Knight Frank we believe in enduring partnerships, with our people and with our clients. This has been our philosophy for 125 years and we now benefit from a property services company that is big enough to be global yet small enough to make it work through the very highest level of customer service.

We have built an internationally-connected, diverse yet balanced organisation on a work ethos of collaboration, teamwork, leadership and adaptability.

All opinions are respected and everyone is invited to contribute. We think everyone should love working at Knight Frank. We understand that the only way we will continue to thrive is through the commitment and passion of our people. That is why investing in our people is as important to us as investing in our clients.

THE ROLE
The Public Sector is an area of immense opportunity and is of considerable strategic importance to Knight Frank. We see the role of the Public Sector expanding across all property sectors with a need for the very best strategic, commercial and financial advisory services rooted in mixed-use property expertise.

We are in the process of creating one of the market leading Public Sector Advisory teams with ambitious growth plans in the short term.

As a team, our over-riding goal is to make a positive difference by working hand in hand with central and local government and other Public Sector bodies, to help them to generate better value for money, manage risk and deliver ambitious regeneration programmes. We provide a full range of multi-disciplinary services to our clients combining expertise in property, commercial and financial matters. This includes including production of HM Green Book business cases, advice on PFI expiry strategies, advice on strategic, commercial and delivery structures, financial structuring, governance and procurement advice.

This position would suit someone who is interested in learning about how to develop and deliver advisory mandates to central and local government and other public sector clients. You will be comfortable working in a wider team and confident to present to our clients. You will also be comfortable working with numbers and capable of turning that analysis into easy-to-read narrative for inclusion in client reports.

Learning and development will be provided, along with on-the-job experience and training.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Support with proposal development and delivery of engagements.
Support the team on business development and identification of opportunities for the Public Sector Advisory team and wider Knight Frank business.
Produce high quality presentation and reports for clients.
Produce development appraisals (using industry standard software) and high-level financial models, including working with wider Knight Frank teams, inputting into and appraising financial models.
Supporting senior members of the team to provide strategic consultancy advice.
Active participation in business development activities and client pitches
Promoting/referring Knight Frank’s wider consultancy and agency services to clients.

EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
Professional Experience Profile
Relevant degree plus professional qualification in the property and/or financial sectors (e.g. MRICS, ACA, CFA).
Good project management skills and ability to deliver projects to time, quality and financial deadlines.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with experience of reporting and presenting to clients or wider Knight Frank teams.
Effectively deals with a wide range of technical issues and client situations

Personal Experience Profile
Personable and engaging personality
Personal drive and ambition
Someone that engenders trust and confidence from team members and clients
Organised and methodical in approach
Collaborative and values led approach

Lead the actuarial reporting team responsible for reporting, analysis and communication of financial performance information for use in key business decisions and in setting strategy, including solvency, liquidity and IFRS monthly MI, forecasting and planning. To provide leadership to the financial performance teams, applying deep technical & business knowledge to advise and guide senior management decision making and manage risk
Salary: Six figure base, 30-60% bonus, 12% Pension, PMI, 38 days holiday, Share Scheme

Job Type: Permanent

At Phoenix Group we're passionate about helping people achieve a more secure and sustainable future. With circa 14 million policies, we make a difference to the lives of millions of people as the UK's largest long-term savings and retirement business. Join us now and you'll grow with us as we build on our success.

We're currently recruiting for a Head of Financial Performance to join our Actuarial Reporting and Change Team in the Finance Reporting Centre. This is a strategically important role responsible for reporting, analysis and communication of financial performance information for use in key business decisions and in setting strategy, including solvency, liquidity and IFRS monthly MI, forecasting and planning. As a member of the Actuarial Reporting Leadership team this is a senior role leading the Financial Performance teams, applying deep technical & business knowledge to advise and guide senior management decision making, manage risks and controls and lead others either directly or indirectly in area of responsibility.

If you thrive in a change environment, enjoy variety and have experience of working at senior levels in finance and reporting, with expertise capital reporting, then we'd love to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities

Influence and challenge senior and executive level decisions, building strong cross-divisional relationships and networks to support the achievement of business objectives.
Effective stakeholder management at all levels, including Exec and senior leadership across Finance Reporting Centre and Finance.
Setting the strategic direction for the Financial Reporting Centre with respect to monthly MI reporting, and the actuarial forecasting for the business plan. Ensure major change programmes work to and support delivery of the strategic actuarial reporting processes.
Delivery of regular transparent reporting for the regular MI, forecasting and AOP including analysis, commentary and insight, to a high quality and on time. This covers solvency, IFRS, liquidity and reporting of external metrics.
Communicate reporting results and insight to actuarial reporting and director, LifeCo FD and other senior Finance and Finance Reporting Centre leads.
Communicate effectively with a non-technical audience, enabling them to understand complex financial or actuarial information.
Lead, develop, and coach the team to deliver effective and value add reporting and business insight. Manage and build a resource pool of senior actuaries, actuaries and analysts to deliver financial performance data and analysis and in support of strategic change programmes.
Continually challenge, shape and develop work processes to ensure plans are delivered efficiently and within company risk framework.
Ensure changes from programmes are appropriately managed into the team and all financial and operational impacts of change are correctly understood and addressed.
Manage the specification, development and testing of complex numerical models, analysing a range of business data, providing detailed interpretation and making recommendations to senior management to support decision making.


What We're Looking For

Essential
Qualified Actuary with significant post-qualified experience
In-depth technical knowledge of key reporting metrics and/or actuarial concepts relevant to actuarial reporting.
Strong senior stakeholder management experience.
People/team management experience
Ability to communicate complex actuarial and finance concepts to a range of technical and non-technical audiences
Knowledge of Capital Management processes and policies
Planning skills
- Languages - English

Desirable
Knowledge of Proxy Modelling techniques
Experience leading change projects or workstreams therein

What We Offer

Bring your 'whole self', skills and dedication to the Phoenix Group and we'll recognise your effort, support your development and help to drive your ambition. We'll ensure you're rewarded for your contribution with a competitive package that includes an attractive pension, annual bonus potential, private medical insurance, generous holiday entitlement, enhanced maternity and adoption leave and a range of other financial services and lifestyle flexible benefits.

Join us and you join a unique organisation. It's not just the 14 million policyholders we serve, or the £300 billion of assets we look after. Or that we're a FTSE 100 company that has been listed as one of the UK's Top Employers for nine years running. It's our talented, inclusive and diverse workforce that makes us a success. We offer flexible working opportunities ensuring we attract and retain the very best of talent. Find out about more about our people's stories, our values and our commitment to diversity.



Online Interviews and Onboarding

All our interviews, onboarding and new joiners are now managed remotely. We have in place a strong virtual support network to ensure new colleagues are supported and developed as they navigate their first few months with us

About Us

Phoenix Group is a member of the FTSE 100 index and is the UK's largest long-term savings and retirement business. We specialise in the acquisition and management of Heritage life insurance and pension funds. We've businesses in the UK, Germany and Ireland and hold a broad range of both Heritage and Open products split across three key business segments: UK Heritage, UK Open and Europe. Our open business manufactures and underwrites new products and policies to support people saving for their future in areas such as workplace pensions and SIPPs, primary under the Standard Life brand. And we market corporate pension trustee services and manufacture products to be sold under other brands. Did you know Phoenix Life manufactures SunLife's market leading Guaranteed Over 50's plan? Find out more about Phoenix Group here.

We value diversity in our workforce and welcome enquiries from everyone.

Job Description
Citrus Group as seeking a highly skilled and experienced commercial/residential surveyor to join their successful Residential Real Estate business. As a commercial/residential surveyor, you will deal with all aspects of residential and commercial property in both the private and public sectors. Principal activities are related to the management, purchase, sale or lease of land and property, as well as valuing/appraising and surveying property on behalf of the Group. You may act as an agent or broker during a sale and may also carry out contract negotiations between landlords and tenants.
We are looking for a high performing surveyor with specific experience in residential trading, who will meet and exceed our acquisition and revenue growth targets. You will be responsible for maximising our potential within the residential market, impacting results through effective delivery of strategy.
Key Responsibilities
Value properties by applying expert knowledge and awareness of the local property market
Take accurate measurements of sites and premises
Assess the impact of a property for development in terms of financial viability
Find and acquire land opportunities or commercial to residential opportunities
Consistently be involved in the refurbishment or development stages, visiting sites and reporting back to the team
Detail-orientated reporting and risk assessment analysis for investment opportunities, valuations for acquisition viability, disposals, among others
Negotiate with confidence, orally and in writing, on issues such as general residential trading of all types of property from normal residential to specialist retirement
Sell and buy properties and sites on behalf of the trading arm of the business
Apply and understand the appropriate law for landlord and tenant negotiations and enforce health and safety regulations
Assess properties for acquisitions and disposals
Manage and appraise large property portfolios and advise on the purchase and sale of individual investments
Manage all kinds of property on behalf of a landlord to meet the landlord's contractual obligations. This includes ensuring compliance with the conditions of the tenancy, collecting rents and handling building maintenance and repair
Work closely with other professionals such as highways, contractors and structural engineers, town planners and architects, in considering new developments or refurbishment works
Ensure that work is managed in accordance with the Equal Opportunities policy
Comply with all Data Protection legislation and Information Security Procedures
Ability to work within the wider company, applying skills to other areas where necessary
Basic Qualifications and Skills
RICS accreditation, undergraduate or postgraduate degree preferred or a relevant vocational qualification (HND/HNC/NVQ3/BTEC/foundation degree) with two years' experience
At least four years relevant experience
Enthusiasm and commitment for the surveying/property profession
Good oral and written communication
Excellent interpersonal skills
Negotiation skills
Strong numeracy skills, Microsoft Excel proficient
Readiness to take responsibility and act on your own initiative
The ability to work as part of a team
Confidence in your own judgement
The ability to develop and maintain a network of professional contacts
A driving license - this is usually essential,unless you are working in a defined urban area, such as a city local authority.
Equal Opportunities
Citrus Group is an equal opportunity employer and places high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis on any protected attributes, including race, religion, ethnicity, national origin, gender, gender identify, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy, disability or any other basis protected under applicable law.
We offer a competitive, results driven remuneration package. We also offer a number a benefits which include 20 days of annual leave.

Keep abreast of sector wide developments, initiatives and innovative solutions and approaches to service delivery/offers

Kelly Group is currently looking to recruit the very best talent as an experienced Auditor to join our expanding team.
Under the general direction of the National Audit and Compliance Manager, the Auditor will perform a wide variety of tasks relating to the management of client and group quality management systems. The role will also entail auditing, coaching, safety and education of all Kelly Group operatives, and that of those directly linked to business on behalf of our clients
Responsibilities:
· Responsible for carrying out quality, H&S, tooling and vehicle audits on Kelly Group engineers, with focus on civils and cabling.
· Complete quality assessments using field based systems.
· Audit and analysis of Group fleet reports looking at hire costs, fuel report data and have the ability to stop fraudulent activity.
· Provide feedback to Managers to help ensure continuous improvement.
· Identify any operational and regulatory risks, escalating as appropriate
· Operate information systems to the required standard to maintain accurate and secure records
· Maintain the process for recording compliance breaches and work closely with Managers to ensure breaches are addressed.
· Understand and adhere to the Company and departmental standards, policies and procedures. – Apply Kelly Communications values in all day to day activities
· The role is field based and will involve travelling. You will have a nominated area but you will be expected to work throughout your region as required. Patches/Geography will be reviewed regularly
· Overnight stays may be required.
· Support corrective action process working closely with field operational colleagues
Scope and Scale:
· You will act as a workforce-facing representative for the organisation to articulate both company and client methodology and solutions to our staff and all levels of management
· The Auditor position is a fused role that merges the oversight of company property management with hands on financial planning and execution to develop, maintain and project the health and ownership of the real assets of the organisation. The position is characterized by a high degree of responsibility, creativity, vision, accountability, technical aptitude and diplomacy
You will have the following qualifications and be able to prove experience and competence:
Proficient use and knowledge of field based software and MS Word, Excel, Outlook.
Computer Literate – field based and Microsoft office packages
A clear understanding of the importance of Quality Assurance to the business
Understanding of proactive and systematic auditing techniques
Conversant with best practice in relation to quality assurance and compliance
Aware of the commercial aims and objectives of Kelly Communications Ltd.
Ability to work with minimum supervision
Strong communication and strong interpersonal skills.
Confidence and credibility and able to communicate information and knowledge assertively.
Ability to work within a team
Strong organisational skills in order to set priorities, work to deadlines and achieve results under pressure.
Able to balance competing priorities and meet personal targets within a fluctuating & demanding workload
Line management experience
12 months driving experience on a full UK driving license.
What’s on offer for successful candidates?
· Competitive PAYE Salary
· 20 days’ holiday plus statutory bank holidays
· Company Pension scheme
· Cycle to work scheme
· Excellent career progression opportunities
Employee Discount Scheme
About Kelly Group:
Established in 1985 to support the emerging UK cable television market, Kelly Group has diversified to meet the needs of our clients. With over 35 years’ experience and customer service at the heart of our business, Kelly Group is renowned for building networks in collaboration with several major leading telecommunication service providers, delivering innovative multi-functional solutions - connecting people globally.
Working across several industries including telecommunications, rail, metro, highways and fleet, Kelly Group operate nationally with 40+ operational centres and deliver a full suite of services. From the initial planning, design, notification through to installation, final commissioning and maintenance of networks, Kelly Group deliver a ‘one-stop solution’ to meet the needs of our clients and delight their customers.
As a service provider, our workforce is our extended family, which is why we invest in their safety, training, careers, welfare, vehicles and tools they need to deliver excellence. With a workforce of circa 3500, 40+ national operational centres, 4 training hubs and a fleet of over 2500 vehicles, Kelly Group are committed to developing an excellent team, a fair culture and a safe working environment.

FairHeat is a heat network consultancy playing a leading role in the decarbonisation of heat in the UK.
Founded in 2015 by innovators in the sector, FairHeat has rapidly established itself as the leading experts on how to specify, design, delivery and operate low temperature heat networks in the UK. This has received wide recognition within the industry, with FairHeat receiving multiple awards, including ADE Consultancy Project of the Year (2016), ADE Innovation of the Decade (2017), Network Awards Heat Network of the Year (2019), CIBSE Employer of the Year (2019, 2021) and CIBSE Building Performance Award – Collaboration (2022).
FairHeat’s data-based approach is one of its key points of differentiation in the heat network industry, with unparalleled access to performance data.
FairHeat is also well known for its innovative approach in developing and deploying standardised processes that improve system outcome, particularly with respect to commissioning processes. As an example, FairHeat developed a standardised Acceptance Testing process, which has just been adopted as a minimum requirement within the latest version of the CIBSE Heat Network Code of Practice (CP1 2020).
In contrast to most design consultancies in the sector, FairHeat is positioned as client representative, working with other design consultancies and contractors to ensure optimum results for clients. Primarily focused on London, FairHeat has many of the largest London based social housing organisations and private developers as clients. There are two main parts to the business: (1) A New Build practice, focused on supporting clients from specification through to system commissioning; and (2) an Operations practice focused on ensuring that systems perform well, with a heavy focus on improving the performance of poorly performing legacy systems.
In line with its success in the market, FairHeat has experienced rapid growth and is looking to support the ongoing development of the business by bringing in additional talent.
The Role
The Project Manager reports to Head of Delivery and is responsible for ensuring the project deliverables she/he works on meet the client requirements and are delivered safely, on time and within budget across a wide range of activities.
The role will require a mix of project management, technical engineering and strong stakeholder management. You must be proactive and comfortable working with minimal supervision, but also understand your own limitations and seek support/approval when required. You must be engaged in your own personal development, as it is essential the Project Manager has a strong technical and commercial understanding of most of the areas and services that FairHeat manage.
The Project Manager will look after a range of live heat network construction projects of the following typical scope:
Plantroom and network end of life equipment replacements.
Full plantroom and network retrofits to improve performance (e.g. Heat Network Efficiency Scheme funded projects).
Heat pump retrofits to decarbonise existing buildings (e.g. PSDS project delivery management).
HIU and heat meter upgrade/replacement works.
District Heating project installations, including energy centres, buried networks and substation plantrooms.
Duties & Responsibilities
Core Role
To manage the above projects, you will be expected to:
Manage a ranch of projects, with multiple live contracts at different stages of design/construction/commissioning.
Oversee and monitor the Health & Safety management of the project, ensuring the relevant RAMS are in place for all internal and external works and all near misses, incidents and accidents are reported in line with the relevant processes.
Ensure FairHeat is fully compliant with the Construction and Design Management Regulatory (CDM 2015) and ensure that all legal duties are carried out, documented and regularly reviewed.
Monitor and measure project expenditure against budgets throughout the project lifecycle and report to line management.
Develop and maintain effective working relationships with Clients and other key stakeholders.
Advice our clients on their CDM 2015 duties and provide support as required to assist them with the management of these duties.
Manage tender processes for both design and contractor packages, including preparation of bid materials, review of tender responses, responding to RFIs and making recommendations to the Head of Delivery on appointments.
Overall contract management to ensure the work is being delivered in line with the contractual scope/appointments.
Manage the projects during delivery. This will involve ensuring the contracted scope is delivered within the agreed budget and timescales. You will be expected to own and manage the project risk registers and use these as your primary communication tool to internal and external stakeholders on project risks, delays, changes and opportunities.
Ensure the projects have sufficient resources allocated to them, and that the resources have suitable experience, competence and training to deliver the scope of works under the contract. This will involve the production and management of project programs/Gantt charts/coordinated resource plans.
Due to the nature of the role, you also be expected to take technical ownership on the onsite Quality Assurance of the delivered system. This will involve coordination and management of FairHeat’s engineering resource to support as necessary, but you will be responsible for:
Administration of FairHeat’s industry leading Employer’s Requirements for heat networks.
Ensuring the technical submittal and contractor design approvals process has been complete before purchase or installation of equipment.
Ensuring method statements have been approved before commissioning activities commence.
Ensuring water quality is being monitored onsite and the results are within the contracted KPI limits.
Ensuring the installation has been inspected and signed off at the contractual milestones prior to handover.
Ensuring the contractual KPIs have been independently tested by FairHeat prior to handover, such as Acceptance Testing and plantroom load testing.
Ensuring the O&M manuals and as built documentation is provided prior to final contactor payment.
Communication, management and resolution of any snags/issues/remedial measures that arise from the above Quality Assurance process.
In addition, you will have responsibility for managing key clients, involving building client relationships and producing proposals that match FairHeat services with their requirements.
The Project Manager is expected to provide mentorship to all engineers, ensuring the upskilling and knowledge growth of these individuals. You will also be expected to support the wider team in developing Project Management competence within the business.
It is expected that the Project Manager will develop into a leading expert within the market with regards to heat network construction, performance monitoring and the cost and effectiveness of implementing different types of physical interventions to heating systems and component equipment (e.g. HIUs). As part of this, you will be expected to support FairHeat in their industry initiatives, which includes technical webinars to CIBSE, steering committee members of various working groups/technical standards and marketing events.
Support the development of new tools and systems and ad hoc projects
Support in identifying, scoping, receiving management sign off and then project managing:
o Business improvement tools such as new processes and documentation.
o New ways of working e.g. more efficient utilisation of resources.
Support business development activity and project management of FairHeat projects
Assist the Associate/Principal Engineer in producing quotes for projects, based on calculation of likely time cost against client requirements.
Develop and maintain client relationships and ensure these grow overtime into successful long-term partnerships.
Assist the Head of Delivery in managing projects to ensure safe delivery within time and cost, ensuring clear, timely communication to both clients and the MD when likely overruns are identified.
Key Requirements
BEng or MEng degree in a relevant engineering discipline OR equivalent qualification in construction/project management.
Minimum 5 years’ experience in project management and/or technical management of M&E systems/heat networks.
A CSCS Card.
SMSTS/SSSTS qualified.
A HSE recognised First Aid at work qualification.
Engineering project management experience of M&E systems, ideally heat networks.
Budget and contract management of construction packages, ideally M&E and/or heat networks.
Desirable
Direct experience of managing the delivery of internal building communal heating system upgrade works (dwelling, network and plantroom).
Direct experience of the delivery of major Energy Centre and/or buried network projects for large scale District Heating networks.
Knowledge of District Heating network design, construction and operations.
APM/PRINCE2 or equivalent Project Management Qualification.
Salary, Benefits and Other Information
Attractive & market competitive remuneration in heat network business sector.
Annual discretionary bonus.
FairHeat will match 5% pension contributions.
25 days annual leave in addition to the normal public/bank holidays.
Full time, 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday, 9.00am – 5.30pm.
Can work up to 2 days per week from home.
Be part of a growing innovative business and help shape the future of energy.
Collaborative, supportive, flexible and friendly environment.
Comprehensive Induction Programme.
Buddy Scheme.
2 Volunteer / Social Engagement Days.
Quarterly and annual social events, from sports day to a whole company getaway.
Free coffee, teas and fruit every day, and a variety of beverages.
FairHeat is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of any kind: FairHeat is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. FairHeat is committed to achieving a diverse workforce through application of an affirmative action, equal opportunity approach in all aspects of employment including recruitment, hiring, promotions, discipline, terminations, salary, benefits, and training.
