At Knight Frank we believe in enduring partnerships, with our people and with our clients. This has been our philosophy for 125 years and we now benefit from a property services company that is big enough to be global yet small enough to make it work through the very highest level of customer service.

We have built an internationally-connected, diverse yet balanced organisation on a work ethos of collaboration, teamwork, leadership and adaptability.

All opinions are respected and everyone is invited to contribute. We think everyone should love working at Knight Frank. We understand that the only way we will continue to thrive is through the commitment and passion of our people. That is why investing in our people is as important to us as investing in our clients.

THE ROLE
The Public Sector is an area of immense opportunity and is of considerable strategic importance to Knight Frank. We see the role of the Public Sector expanding across all property sectors with a need for the very best strategic, commercial and financial advisory services rooted in mixed-use property expertise.

We are in the process of creating one of the market leading Public Sector Advisory teams with ambitious growth plans in the short term.

As a team, our over-riding goal is to make a positive difference by working hand in hand with central and local government and other Public Sector bodies, to help them to generate better value for money, manage risk and deliver ambitious regeneration programmes. We provide a full range of multi-disciplinary services to our clients combining expertise in property, commercial and financial matters. This includes including production of HM Green Book business cases, advice on PFI expiry strategies, advice on strategic, commercial and delivery structures, financial structuring, governance and procurement advice.

This position would suit someone who is interested in learning about how to develop and deliver advisory mandates to central and local government and other public sector clients. You will be comfortable working in a wider team and confident to present to our clients. You will also be comfortable working with numbers and capable of turning that analysis into easy-to-read narrative for inclusion in client reports.

Learning and development will be provided, along with on-the-job experience and training.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Support with proposal development and delivery of engagements.
Support the team on business development and identification of opportunities for the Public Sector Advisory team and wider Knight Frank business.
Produce high quality presentation and reports for clients.
Produce development appraisals (using industry standard software) and high-level financial models, including working with wider Knight Frank teams, inputting into and appraising financial models.
Supporting senior members of the team to provide strategic consultancy advice.
Active participation in business development activities and client pitches
Promoting/referring Knight Frank’s wider consultancy and agency services to clients.

EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
Professional Experience Profile
Relevant degree plus professional qualification in the property and/or financial sectors (e.g. MRICS, ACA, CFA).
Good project management skills and ability to deliver projects to time, quality and financial deadlines.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with experience of reporting and presenting to clients or wider Knight Frank teams.
Effectively deals with a wide range of technical issues and client situations

Personal Experience Profile
Personable and engaging personality
Personal drive and ambition
Someone that engenders trust and confidence from team members and clients
Organised and methodical in approach
Collaborative and values led approach

Job title: Pharma Strategy and Competitive Intelligence Managers and Consultants
Description:
Job description
Our client requires a full time Project Manager focused on competitive intelligence led initiatives within the Pharmaceutical and Biopharma sector. Your main responsibility will be to manage client projects, ensuring delivery of the project in line with client expectations.

You will need to successfully coordinate the internal research team to deliver projects against the plan and within budget, including report generation, leading project calls/updates with the client, monitoring actual progress against forecasted progress and raising any risks / red flags as appropriate. Whilst taking your own initiative is an imperative, you will be mentored and guided by the owners of the business; who between them have more than 35 years of Pharmaceutical and Biopharma competitive intelligence experience.

About the company:

Our client is a specialist consultancy, providing back-to-basics primary competitive intelligence in a legal and ethical manner. Everything that they do is based on asking the right questions of both our clients and our sources. This ensures effort is focused on what matters rather than peripheral activity; providing our clients with robust and validated intelligence insights. Most of their work is focused on the healthcare sector with projects covering a broad range of therapy areas and topics.
The owners of the business are looking for an ambitious biological/natural scientist who has ideally completed a PhD and wanting to expand their career horizons into the world of business. Life is never dull with each project different from the next and plenty of opportunity to think and act creatively. We are a small business and being able to take initiative, think independently and learn quickly will allow you to thrive working for us.
The ideal candidate will learn from the owners the art of competitive intelligence and as time goes by, become an integral part of the business. If working-for-yourself is an aspiration then talking to us is a significant first-step toward that goal.

Scope for the role:

1. Client and Account management
Manages regional accounts or sections within large global accounts.
Manages client relationships, ensuring client satisfaction throughout the project lifecycle and identifying areas for future account growth.
Manages business development activity within assigned engagements, working with client leads to deliver against key account plans.
Scopes project opportunities and prices projects.

2. Project Management
Manages large, complex projects, ensuring seamless delivery of the project in line with client timelines and expectations.
Developing reports from the intelligence collected via the research team
Reports need to contain analysed competitor insights that include, but are not limited to, answering the Key Intelligence Questions, competitor roles within industry/market trends, competitor regulatory and clinical strategies, competitor payer and market access strategies, pipeline asset review, competitor tactics at a local level, potential positioning and competitive threat assessments
Manages delivery of project according to plan and within project budget, incl. key milestones, delivery timelines, review sessions, with an eye for available capacity and for potential issues and risks
Manages the internal project team and sub contractors, including global teams as necessary.
Supports the development of project team members by aligning development needs to project deliverables and facilitating a feedback culture.
Conducting limited competitive intelligence research as required
Congress Attendance: conducting primary research to gather information for specific projects on an as needed basis
The ability to travel ~20% of the time to visit clients, attend a medical conference or competitive intelligence networking event

Key Skills
Creative, robust thinking and analysis skills – ability to conceptualise complex data into digestible and meaningful insights for clients
Subject matter expertise or the ability to quickly learn and immerse yourself into a new therapy area based on your academic capabilities
A natural communicator both verbally and in writing
Must be able to demonstrate mastery of secondary data and ability to use these data in addressing a specific business need /question
Ability to use problem-solving logic to complete assigned tasks
Good attention to detail
Ability to multi-task and deliver high quality outputs under time-pressured deadlines
Flexible and hard-working team player
Responsive to client need
Highly proficient in Microsoft Office (to include Excel and PowerPoint) and able to produce deliverables which tell a competitive story

Qualifications:
A BSc is essential in the biological /medical sciences. MSc or PhD is preferred
Deep familiarity, and in-market experience, with the EU pharmaceutical market, through recent employment with EU-based consulting firm or leading pharmaceutical company
Experience of recent management consulting experience, with company recognised as leading in its field
Track record of professional success, with successive stages of advancement/ promotion
Robust knowledge and several years of recent and hands-on competitive intelligence experience in the pharmaceutical industry, including issue monitoring and coverage of industry conferences, primary C.I., CI deep dives, workshops, scenario planning, and synthesis/ insight generation
Proven Leadership skills (functional, team, client, team, etc.)
Depth in one or more of the following therapeutic areas:
Oncology
Immunology
Cell & Gene

Citron Hygiene is one of the UK market leaders providing washroom and waste services. We are seeking new Hygiene Technicians to join our Service Team. As a Hygiene Technician you play a critical role in servicing our customers washrooms and building healthy spaces. If you enjoy working independently, as part of a team and are passionate about delivering exceptional customer service to our customers, then look no further.
Responsibilities
Driving from home to our customers on your pre planned route (single premises or multi stop dependant on customer requirements).
Carrying out a service and exchange of Citron Hygiene products whilst on the premises.
Being the face of Citron Hygiene and providing exceptional customer service to all our customers.
Maintaining great communication with your Service Coordinator (based at the Service Centre) throughout your working day to ensure all planned stops are completed and escalating/resolving any issues which arise in a timely manner.
Returning to the Service Centre one or two times per week to unload and replenish stock.
Qualifications
Full UK Manual Driving Licence, with a maximum of 3 points.
ADR Licence would be advantageous but not essential.
Successful applicants will be subject to an Enhanced Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check.
Competencies
Patience – this role involves travelling during peak periods to and from customers premises and unfortunately traffic issues are unavoidable.
Being comfortable working within the washroom environment for male, female and unisex users.
Professional – conducting yourself in a professional manner is key to this role for both the business and its customers.
Citron Hygiene has a wide range of customers across several different sectors including CQC (Care Quality Commissioned) registered service providers, including but not limited to care homes and nursing homes. Sadly, COVID-19 has taken many thousands of lives among older people, those with underlying health conditions and those who need the level of care provided in care homes.
The Scientific Advisory Group for Emergencies (SAGE) Social Care Working Group has highlighted that people living in care homes have been particularly impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic, due to a combination of a heightened risk of severe outcomes following COVID-19 infection and the risk of outbreaks in closed settings. Under The Health and Social Care Act 2008 (Regulated Activities) (Amendment) (Coronavirus) Regulations 2021, any person entering the premises of a CQC (Care Quality Commissioned) registered service provider will need to be vaccinated unless they are exempt under the regulations.
Please note candidates must have received both doses of the Covid-19 vaccination or be willing to do so unless medically exempt, in order to comply with new legislative requirements for CQC registered service providers.

Care Team Leader
Foxbridge House, Orpington
£1000 joining Bonus
Pay £12.50ph days and nights
Refer a friend £500
If you have NVQ Level 3 and proven experience of caring for older people, and are looking for a rewarding role that comes with excellent training and great opportunities for personal development, join Care UK as a Team Leader and make a real difference.

Being a Team Leader at Care UK
Team Leaders at Care UK are flexible in approach and have broad experience of caring for others and leading shifts. They’re great at building relationships and inspiring others too. Collaborating and sharing information and ideas comes naturally to them, as does using tact and diplomacy to deal with challenging situations and quickly resolving them. Their innovations help to raise standards, while their passion for what they do is second to none. And, they consider it a privilege to be trusted to look after others. Do you have the same sort of attributes? Then we could have just the role for you.

Chloe (Team Leader) Short v1 from Care UK on Vimeo.
What you’ll be doing
Being a Team Leader Is about acting as a role model by leading and supervising carers day-to-day, working alongside them and completing regular staff appraisals. It’s also about taking responsibility for case managing residents and liaising with families, health care professional and other stakeholders to ensure that the best care plans are created and delivered. Working closely with nurses to develop the services we provide is an important aspect of the role too, as is administering medication and carrying out risk assessments. Put simply, it’s about making a difference. A real difference.

What you’ll need
Well-organised, IT literate and adept at allocating and delegating work appropriately, you have a proven ability to lead and supervise others and a good understanding of care planning processes. What’s more, you're trained, or willing to train, to administer medication and used to contributing to, monitoring and implementing changes that improve outcomes for residents. Above all, you have a natural ability to help make the lives of others more fulfilling and want to work in an environment where the work can be hard, but also fun and rewarding.

The benefits
Competitive rates of pay – we continuously review pay in your local market
Opportunities to progress through our personalised career paths into more senior and management roles whilst growing your earnings
Earn whilst you learn and take on a variety of apprenticeships applicable to your role enabling you to increase your pay once achieved
Competitive refer a friend scheme of up to £1000 depending on role
Quality and free training to help develop and enhance your skills
Bank holiday enhancements
Cycle to work scheme
Flexible hours, including day, night or weekend shifts
Free DBS
Thousands of online and in-store discounts across big known retailers enabling our colleagues to make big savings on every day shopping such as holidays, supermarkets and travel.
Employee Assistance Programme – Immediate access to a confidential telephone counselling and legal information service which operates 24 hours a day, 365 days a year to include support such as financial and family concerns


One of the UK’s leading care home providers, Care UK run over 120 homes and day clubs across the UK that provide residential, nursing, dementia and end-of-life care for older people. A top rated employer in best quality results, our goal is to help every employee fulfil their potential by providing first-class training and support.

Fulfilling lives, fulfilling Careers.
Foxbridge House care home located in Orpington, Kent offers the highest standards of specialist care for older people.
This beautiful, spacious and purpose-built care home, which opened in March 2013, has a wealth of luxury features, designed to create a lively, family atmosphere and to enable residents to get the most out of every day. Our facilities include a hair and nail salon, a luxurious retro-themed cinema – with a cinema club that the residents run themselves – plus a coffee shop, Cherries, which is a popular spot for socialising with friends and family. Lounges, dining rooms and comfortable sitting areas throughout the care home also add to the ‘five star’ feel.
Foxbridge House care home provides a wide range of care options to suit different needs. We provide residential and nursing care, as well as short respite care. This is ideal for giving family carers a well-earned break. Their older loved one also enjoys a change of scene in stunning surroundings in the 24-hour care of our dedicated team

Linked to continued growth Claims Consortium Adjusting are looking for a Property Loss Adjuster. The ideal candidate will have or are working toward relevant professional qualifications, with experience of handling domestic and/or commercial property losses over £25,000.
A full driving licence is a requirement of this role.
Location: The role will be home-based with a requirement to travel within the North London region.
Salary: £35,000 - £45,000 DOE #TransparencyScheme

Key Accountabilities:
Conducting site visits and assessments to establish the cause and quantum of Insurance claims.
Empathising and engaging with the customer to ensure that they are treated as an individual.
Taking the time to consider the impact of the claim and the required claim stages on the customer. Maintaining confidentiality and high personal ethical standards throughout.
Appropriately obtaining high quality information by investigating in a timely manner, supported by site notes, photographs, witness statements, and other appropriate evidence.
Understanding the relevance of the information obtained to decide upon a step-by-step plan to conclude the claim.
Demonstrating the confidence and knowledge to make decisions regarding policy liability, quantum and subrogation and risk management issues. Recognising when assistance is required from other colleagues when issues arise outside of the scope of the individual’s expertise.
Effectively maintaining the line of communication between the various parties, thus orchestrating a successful claims outcome and creating a ‘joined up’ process.
Providing a high level of technical, quality and customer service commitment. Complementing CCG’s goal to be the ‘best’ in the market.
Remaining customer and client focused throughout the life of a claim, taking all the necessary steps to achieve customer satisfaction within the parameters of policy cover.

Qualifications & Experience:
Property claims insurance experience - essential.
As an individual, you will have a proven track record of exhibiting a professional and personal approach when dealing with customers.
To be CII/CILA Qualified or working towards.

#TransparencyScheme
The Government launched its Transparency Pilot Scheme on International Women’s Day 2022 as part of its initiative to level up. The scheme aims to support objectives around Gender Pay Gap by encouraging organisations to promote transparency with salaries when advertising any job roles. Evidence shows that by stating salaries on job adverts, Women can negotiate pay on a fair basis. At CCG our objective is to be Employer of Choice, through our passion and dedication to Diversity, Equality and Inclusion recognising everyone is different together.
Don’t think you meet all the skills and qualifications listed? Studies have shown individuals with protected characteristics, such as women, people of colour or those in Neurodiverse groups (and many more) are less likely to apply for a role if they don’t meet all the requirements on a job advert. Clams Consortium Group strives to lead the way in creating a culture that promotes not only an equal but more importantly, an inclusive workforce that allows all our employees to be their authentic selves. If this role is something you’re excited about, but your experience doesn’t align with every qualification outlined, don’t stress it, we would encourage you to still apply as you may be the just the candidate we are looking for, for this position or another role.

About Signal - Who are we?
We're on a mission to change the way businesses make decisions with our cutting-edge AI technology. To achieve that, we’re looking for passionate people to join our open and unconventional workplace. Our inclusive environment welcomes skills and experiences from diverse backgrounds and defines who we are.
About the role - What’s your purpose?
Signal AI’s API suite has already enabled a vibrant ecosystem of solutions developed on top of our cutting-edge capabilities and insights, and we are looking to build on that momentum in 2023. The Product Manager - API and Integrations will continue to develop our API offering, adding new types of capabilities and insights to our API suite in order to support existing and new use cases. Working with vertical-focused product strategists, they will also identify and develop third-party integrations and partnerships opportunities for Signal AI.
Day-to-day responsibilities - What you will be doing?
Working directly with customers / developers leveraging the API to develop new solutions
Working with Engineering and Data Science to expose existing and future Signal AI capabilities and insights programmatically through a suite of API endpoints, and working with Product Strategy, Marketing and Commercial to ensure the API’s success
Identifying, prioritising and developing integrations, enabling Signal AI insights to surface in third-party software tools across multiple use case verticals (reputation, investment management, audit, risk etc.)
Guiding the evolution of the public API in line with user feedback and latest Developer Experience standards and driving the development of our developer portal.
Work with Product Marketing to bring in market research insights into the team, to guide the evolution of the API. Understand what other best-in-breed APIs do better than us, around onboarding, developer experience, integrations offering, marketing, etc.
Working with Engineering, Data Science and Marketing/Commercial to create “code as collateral” (e.g. client SDKs, Jupyter notebook solution patterns.)
Guiding the process of developing/acquiring internal&external tooling around the API
Who are we looking for?
The person in this role will need to be very comfortable with APIs, and able to interact with the API suite (e.g. directly using code or using tools such as Postman). Previous API product management experience and good working Python/SQL knowledge is a big advantage
You will have the ability to develop deep understanding of, and empathy for, the developers using our API
You will have the ability to consider multiple use cases and verticals when prioritising the development
Experience working with highly technical, AI/ML-driven data products
Ability to navigate the complexity of managing API and data products, including working closely with data engineering, data science and legal/compliance
Unlimited holiday entitlement;
Hybrid Working Environment - we have a hybrid remote policy with 2-3 days remote per week, plus Summer&Winter fully remote blocks wherever works for you, including abroad;
Share options;
Enhanced Maternity, Paternity and Dependents Leave policies;
Health Cash Plan/ Pension plan / Income Protection / Life Insurance / Access to free therapists via Spill.

Up to 45 min call with Snr PM
Case Study

Reporting Line > Technical Manager

Here at Woods Foodservice LTD, we are knownas market leaders in the quality sector of the catering industry. We are at an exciting point of progression in the company, making it a great time for new recruits to join our journey. We provide high quality ambient, chilled, fresh, and frozen produce from around the world and supply some of the most prestigious chefs in the country. At present, most of our customer are London-based, but we have already begun the expansion process into other major UK cities such as Manchester, Brighton and Bristol. The future is very promising!
A critical part of our renowned success is our exceptional level of customer service. This is a department that we are constantly looking to improve and modernise to make our customers’ experience with us as comfortable as possible.
Requirements:
A new requirement for a Technical Assistant acquires a very important role within our company. The main responsibility of the Technical Assistant will be to provide administrative support to the Technical Manager, in overseeing the day-to-day Food Safety, Health Safety and Welfare of our multi-million pound operation and it’s people; both internal and external. Assisting the Technical Manager in ensuring continued conformity with quality procedures, and reviewing customer and suppliers calibration contracts from the on-set is an important aspect of this exciting and equally challenging role.
An ability to demonstrate confidentiality; excellent organisational and communication skills is vital for this role.
Flexibility to learn, develop and deliver is essential!
This is a critical role in ensuring that we deliver excellence to our premium clientele. The successful candidate will have demonstrable experience, ideally gained in FMCG, Food Distribution or Warehouse setting; and an associated relevant qualification in HSEQ.

o To follow up with each department on a regular basis on all due and outstanding training and report to the Technical Manager on any non-conformities
o To support with short and long-term project work, i.e. implementation and delivery of an in-house induction program

o Draft emails and letters as required to be sent to relevant stakeholders.
o Carry out routine office duties to assist the Technical Manager including dealing with telephone and other messages, e-mailing, copying and filing.

o 2.1 Bachelor’s Degree in any field and any relevant Compliance qualifications such as NEBOSH
o Demonstrates commercial acumen and the ability to make reasoned decisions
o Ability to work with people at all levels and from all backgrounds
o Ability to multi-task, prioritise, and have good time management skills

o Polite friendly manner with a positive “can do attitude”

As a Senior Portfolio Analyst with Convera based in our London office, you will support portfolio management operations, gather crucial metrics and analytics, and provide key support to the Portfolio Management & Metrics team.
The Senior Portfolio Analyst reports to the Technology Portfolio Manager and works as a part of the Portfolio Management & Metrics team, which belongs to the Product & Technology Group at Convera. This new role will be a key part of our Technology Investment Governance process. Further, it will support the Convera business by creating transparency, clarity, and alignment across our cross-functional teams with a specific focus on idea intake, capacity planning, prioritized resource allocation and business case assessment. This role will enable us to make smart, strategic decisions that help optimize our technology investment portfolio, aligning with our broader strategic and financial objectives.

You will be responsible for:
Drive idea intake process with key stakeholders and business partners, creating business cases to understand the key aspects of new technology investment opportunities (new products, feature upgrades, customer requests, non-discretionary projects, etc.) and how they align to our strategic and financial objectives
Develop cost, revenue, and risk assessment estimates with input from key partners to drive v.1 and v.2 of business cases before review by the Product & Technology leadership team
Align key stakeholders through capacity planning coordination – collaborate with key stakeholders from Engineering and Product/Program Management to develop a capacity planning methodology that aligns all key stakeholders
Efficiency creation and effectiveness - implement digital tools and accelerators to drive efficiency, alignment, and transparency regarding idea intake, capacity planning and resource allocation
Prepare reports and presentations – regularly prepare and generate capacity planning reporting and presentations for portfolio reviews and ad hoc internal reviews
Conduct retroactive reviews - measure and analyze our performance and value realization on past projects (actuals vs. estimates)
Regularly collaborate with business stakeholders to understand goals, timelines, assumptions, risks, and other considerations
Exercise superb follow-up and follow through skills in all facets of management, driving problems to resolution quickly
Maintain an enterprise Product and Technology cross-functional roadmap and collaborate with other product roadmap owners to create a holistic view of all work in the Product & Technology portfolio
You should apply if you have:
Minimum of 2-4 years of experience working in a hands-on environment in a portfolio/PMO/business analysis role, ideally with a technology focus
Outstanding experience in business case development and understanding how to extract technical requirements from product and software development/engineering teams
Experience in extracting projected costs, revenue drivers, and risks from teams
Experience in Jira, capacity planning software, and/or portfolio management software is a plus
Critical, data-driven decision-maker who has strong analytical ability/fluency
Excels in team environment with the ability to collaborate and liaise with geographically distributed teams
Ability to articulate ideas to audiences with varied experience and levels throughout the organization
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, report writing and presentation skills
Self-starter with ‘can-do’ attitude, a service mindset, and proactive in responding to requests
Professional, detail-oriented, and organized, with outstanding follow-up abilities
About Convera
Convera is the largest non-bank B2B cross-border payments company in the world. Formerly Western Union Business Solutions, we leverage decades of industry expertise and technology-led payment solutions to deliver smarter money movements to our customers – helping them capture more value with every transaction. Convera serves more than 30,000 customers ranging from small business owners to enterprise treasurers to educational institutions to financial institutions to law firms to NGOs.
Our teams care deeply about the value we bring to our customers which makes Convera a rewarding place to work. This is an exciting time for our organization as we build our team with growth-minded, results-oriented people who are looking to move fast in an innovative environment.
As a truly global company with employees in over 20 countries, we are passionate about diversity; we seek and celebrate people from different backgrounds, lifestyles, and unique points of view. We want to work with the best people and ensure we foster a culture of inclusion and belonging.

We offer an abundance of competitive perks and benefits including:
Market competitive monthly gross salary
Opportunity to earn an annual bonus
Great career growth and development opportunities in a global organization
A flexible approach to work
Generous insurance (health, disability, life) and retirement programs
Paid holidays, time-off and leave policies for life events (maternity, paternity, adoption, bereavement, military)
Paid volunteering opportunities
There are plenty of amazing opportunities at Convera for talented, creative problem solvers who never settle for good enough and are looking to transform Business to Business payments. Apply now if you’re ready to unleash your potential.

Citron Hygiene is one of the UK market leaders providing washroom and waste services. We are seeking new Hygiene Technicians to join our Service Team. As a Hygiene Technician you play a critical role in servicing our customers washrooms and building healthy spaces. If you enjoy working independently, as part of a team and are passionate about delivering exceptional customer service to our customers, then look no further.
Responsibilities
Driving from home to our customers on your pre planned route (single premises or multi stop dependant on customer requirements).
Carrying out a service and exchange of Citron Hygiene products whilst on the premises.
Being the face of Citron Hygiene and providing exceptional customer service to all our customers.
Maintaining great communication with your Service Coordinator (based at the Service Centre) throughout your working day to ensure all planned stops are completed and escalating/resolving any issues which arise in a timely manner.
Returning to the Service Centre one or two times per week to unload and replenish stock.
Qualifications
Full UK Manual Driving Licence, with a maximum of 3 points.
ADR Licence would be advantageous but not essential.
Successful applicants will be subject to an Enhanced Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check.
Competencies
Patience – this role involves travelling during peak periods to and from customers premises and unfortunately traffic issues are unavoidable.
Being comfortable working within the washroom environment for male, female and unisex users.
Professional – conducting yourself in a professional manner is key to this role for both the business and its customers.
Citron Hygiene has a wide range of customers across several different sectors including CQC (Care Quality Commissioned) registered service providers, including but not limited to care homes and nursing homes. Sadly, COVID-19 has taken many thousands of lives among older people, those with underlying health conditions and those who need the level of care provided in care homes.
The Scientific Advisory Group for Emergencies (SAGE) Social Care Working Group has highlighted that people living in care homes have been particularly impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic, due to a combination of a heightened risk of severe outcomes following COVID-19 infection and the risk of outbreaks in closed settings. Under The Health and Social Care Act 2008 (Regulated Activities) (Amendment) (Coronavirus) Regulations 2021, any person entering the premises of a CQC (Care Quality Commissioned) registered service provider will need to be vaccinated unless they are exempt under the regulations.
Please note candidates must have received both doses of the Covid-19 vaccination or be willing to do so unless medically exempt, in order to comply with new legislative requirements for CQC registered service providers.

Post Title: Pre School Manager Reports to: Early Years Operations Manager/ Head Teacher
· Drive and deliver the highest standards of care throughout the pre school as detailed in the childcare audit and Ofsted / ISI inspections.

#TransparencyScheme
The Government launched its Transparency Pilot Scheme on International Women’s Day 2022 as part of its initiative to level up. The scheme aims to support objectives around Gender Pay Gap by encouraging organisations to promote transparency with salaries when advertising any job roles. Evidence shows that by stating salaries on job adverts, Women can negotiate pay on a fair basis. At CCG our objective is to be Employer of Choice, through our passion and dedication to Diversity, Equality and Inclusion recognising everyone is different together.
Don’t think you meet all the skills and qualifications listed? Studies have shown individuals with protected characteristics, such as women, people of colour or those in Neurodiverse groups (and many more) are less likely to apply for a role if they don’t meet all the requirements on a job advert. Clams Consortium Group strives to lead the way in creating a culture that promotes not only an equal but more importantly, an inclusive workforce that allows all our employees to be their authentic selves. If this role is something you’re excited about, but your experience doesn’t align with every qualification outlined, don’t stress it, we would encourage you to still apply as you may be the just the candidate we are looking for, for this position or another role.

Main Responsibilities:
The Regional Operations Managers roles have been designed to support and assist senior managers in the delivery of a high quality service by:
· To ensure all company policies and procedures are actioned correctly.
· Adopting a measured approach, to include KPI trends, planned audits, responsive audits and other quantitative and qualitative data to inform Overarching Local Action Plans and decision making at a strategic level.
· Maintaining and improving corporate standards, policy and procedures relating to Regulatory guidance, good practice and Legislation. Ensuring documentation is embedded and maintained in a standard and consistent format company-wide.
· To develop, plan and undertake full quality reviews annually and five Thematic reviews per annum. Identify key themes from audit through robust and meaningful analysis.
· Monthly visits to the allocated services in liaison with the Director of Quality Assurance, Deputy Director of Quality Assurance, Line Manager and Operations Director. Provide support to Home Managers to evidence timely progress of action plans and to ensure momentum of quality improvement.

· Collating centrally and distributing company wide information/advice in support of other key tasks.
· Promote continuous quality improvements, set standards, monitor, and evaluate practices. Be responsible for a consistent approach to high standards in practice, through evaluation and monitoring.

· Ensure care is delivered in accordance with all relevant legislation and codes of practice.

· by promoting a reflective, learning culture where all staff can engage and contribute to quality standards.

Global Relay is the leading provider of cloud-based archiving, information governance, surveillance, and eDiscovery solutions to the global finance sector. We help financial services firms preserve and supervise their communications data for regulatory compliance, risk mitigation, and litigation readiness. We deliver our services to over 20,000 customers in 90 countries, including 22 of the top 25 global banks. Our market-leading archiving service supports email, instant messaging, text, market data chat, social media, enterprise social networking, voice, trade data, websites, and more. Recently, we also launched a compliant messaging platform specifically for the finance industry.
We’ve won major awards for our growth, management, and culture – including the Deloitte Fast 50 Leadership Award, Canada’s 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures, and the Deloitte-sponsored Canada’s Best Managed Companies awards. Our Global Operations & Development Center is located in Vancouver, BC, Canada. In addition, we have offices in six other cities across the world, including major financial centers like New York, Chicago, and London.
Having established our dominance in the North American finance industry, we have been expanding our London operations to better serve our UK and EU customers. Our four-story EMEA headquarters on Cannon Street (near St. Paul’s Cathedral) features state-of-the-art amenities, a spectacular view of the city, and an Executive Briefing Center for customer forums and other events.
We provide fantastic opportunities to individuals passionate about business and technology. These opportunities include working alongside members of our leadership team. Receiving mentorship from seasoned technology and business professionals. And doing business with the world’s largest, most influential banks and enterprise organizations.

The Intermediate Java Developer is a member of a small, highly focused team, responsible for building services for highly scalable and robust messaging, data acquisition and archiving systems, using leading edge technologies. We encourage our developers to think beyond a single component to build complete system solutions. Challenge yourself by learning new technologies, and apply your skills across our different projects and application domains. If you are committed to code that is clean, well-tested, well-reviewed, performant and secure then you’ll fit in around here.

Micro-services Container Platforms (OpenShift, Kubernetes, CRC, Docker)

Collaborate with product owners on user story generation and refinement

Due to continued growth, we now have a fantastic opportunity for a full time School Caretaker to join Upton Grange School. The successful candidate will be responsible for supporting the Site Resources Manager with the maintenance and health and safety.
Who we are looking for
We are looking for a School Caretaker who has a suitable qualification (or provide evidence of experience) of one of the following trades - carpentry, plumbing, decorating. Someone who is ICT literate for updating systems, able to priorities tasks anticipate and reduce risk where possible and an effective communicator. Upton Grange School is a new specialist ASD provision. As part of the Hillingdon Manor group of schools and the Outcomes First Group, Upton Grange will offer day provision to children with Autism from the ages of 4 to 11 years old.
Upton Grange will provide specialist education for c35 pupils, aged between 4-11 years. Upton Grange deploys a wide range of teaching strategies to engage and develop the progress of learners, who present with a range of learning difficulties and styles. Our pupils are taught in smaller class sizes and work towards an Equals Semi-Formal Curriculum and National Curriculum expectations where appropriate.
Options Autism the UK’s leading independent provider of specialist education and residential care for vulnerable children and young people. As part of Outcomes First Group we are leading our sector in setting and delivering new approaches that provide measurable outcomes for those in our care.

A wide range of health, wellbeing, and insurance benefits
100’s of discount options valid in the UK and abroad

Critical illness cover
And that’s not all, we place the outcomes of the children and vulnerable young adults in our services at the heart of everything we do, so you’ll wake every day in the knowledge that your role will have a significant positive impact on the lives of others.
We are committed to the safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people. All successful applicants will be subject to a fully enhanced DBS.

Job title: Vice President, Transaction Advisory Services- Financial Due Diligence
Description:
In a world of disruption and increasingly complex business challenges, our professionals bring truth into focus with the Kroll Lens. Our sharp analytical skills, paired with the latest technology, allow us to give our clients clarity—not just answers—in all areas of business.
We embrace diverse backgrounds and global perspectives, and we cultivate diversity by respecting, including, and valuing one another. As part of One team, One Kroll, you’ll contribute to a supportive and collaborative work environment that empowers you to excel.


Kroll's transaction Advisory Services (TAS) practice provides seamless analytical advisory through the deal continuum, from transaction origination to closing.


At Kroll, your work will help deliver clarity to our clients’ most complex governance, risk, and transparency challenges. Apply now to join One team, One Kroll.


Background and objectives


Operating from more than 28 countries and 70 offices, Kroll helps clients realise business goals across M&A, restructuring, financing and other corporate transactions. Complementing its existing Global TAS practice and focused on rapid market share gain, Kroll is in the process of expanding the team in London and is offering the rare opportunity to join a team that is in ‘high growth’ with unmatched benefits and challenges:



Key role in shaping and driving the growth of the Kroll TAS business in the UK, Europe and Global markets


High levels of responsibility and autonomy


Work-winning, client development and execution opportunities based on an issues-lead approach across a range of sectors - variety and stretch


Opportunities to work alongside colleagues on multi-disciplinary projects as part of a collegiate and entrepreneurial group


Flexible and performance-based reward structure that is based on a “one-firm” approach and not constrained by territorial/personal boundaries

Real opportunity for accelerated progression



Role responsibilities


The strategic objective for TAS is to expand into the corporate and private equity markets where work-winning is based more on a combination of content-lead account management and delivery rather than the traditional execution-only role with work-winning being primarily a Partner responsibility. The successful implementation of this go-to-market route requires a senior team that has the experience and appetite to challenge traditional models. Key responsibilities include:



Work seamlessly with the Managing Director(s) and Directors to position Kroll on all relevant private equity and selected corporate transaction deal flows


Support with the identification of new business opportunities and develop long-term business relationships


Support with the development of key client accounts and ensure that all “insights” are taken to market


Manage the execution of buy-side and sell-side financial due diligence engagements for private equity, lender, and corporate clients


Advise clients on post-acquisition steps to achieve anticipated earnings/cash flow improvement


Work closely with the broader Kroll team to ensure the application of sound project management principles and quality assurance at all stages and phases of projects


Manage key project metrics


Understand the capabilities of our wider firm and identify opportunities to cross-sell additional services to our clients


Play an active role in people initiatives, including recruiting, developing and retaining staff



Requirements


High degree of personal drive and motivation to succeed


Considerable deal experience including financial due diligence, working with other service lines and well versed in the concept and practice of “content-lead” account management


Demonstrated superior analytical and problem-solving skills


Demonstrated interpersonal and client relationships skills


Proven written and verbal communication skills


Demonstrable experience in planning, preparing and reviewing deliverables in various forms including written reports, presentations and discussions with the client


Highly proficient in Microsoft Office, with focus on PowerPoint and Excel


Experience working with diverse teams


Flexibility to travel, as needed



To qualify for the role you must have


A Degree (ideally in a financially related topic with accounting knowledge)


ACA (or equivalent) qualification


Strong commercial experience and/or relevant industry or transaction experience (including financial due diligence experience), preferably for a minimum of 3 years

Project management skills with the ability to manage more than 1 project at a time, if required


A passion to provide high quality service to your clients



Ideally, you’ll also have


Experience in using PowerQuery and PowerBI is preferable



Necessarily successful candidates will have a set of characteristics and attributes that can thrive in this challenging and dynamic environment. We value the ability to operate with flexibility and autonomy whilst being part of a tight-knit, collaborative team who have fun working hard. We don’t support a parochial, “eat-what-you-kill” culture and are looking for strong team players who will absolutely buy-in to the longer-term strategic ambitions of the wider business.


In order to be considered for a position, you must formally apply via careers.kroll.com.


Kroll is committed to equal opportunity and diversity, and recruits people based on merit.

INTRODUCING CONVERA
Want to be part of a transformation journey with a company that feels like a start-up but already has a successful business with significant runway for stronger and faster growth? Are you interested in building a career in Fintech at a place with the ambition and means to become a unique B2B platform that is truly agile-at-scale? Do you want to collaborate somewhere with great people from a wide variety of backgrounds because people are what power our company’s success?
Then Convera is the place for you! In 2021, we launched Convera, a company committed to bringing its customers the most advanced business payments and FX platform in the world. Convera was formed to acquire the assets and companies that previously comprised Western Union Business Solutions, a division of The Western Union Company. Convera’s acquisition of Western Union Business Solutions is subject to requisite work council and trade union consultations, regulatory approvals and other customary closing conditions. Following this acquisition, Convera will become one of the largest non-bank B2B cross-border payments companies in the world. Leveraging decades of industry expertise to deliver smarter money movements, Convera is committed to ensuring that our customers capture more value with every transaction.
WHAT WE DO & WHO WE SERVE
Providing tech-led payment solutions to a broad range of organizations globally, Convera serves customers ranging from small business owners to enterprise treasurers to educational and financial institutions. Delivering solutions ranging from simple currency exchanges to sophisticated cross-border payments platforms and solutions, everything we do is designed to enhance the customer experience and seamlessly power their global commerce needs.
In 2020, the business processed over $110 billion in transactions. With an existing customer base of more than 30,000 small and medium-sized businesses, educational institutions, financial institutions, law firms, and NGOs spanning over 40 countries and territories and 140 currencies, the business possesses a truly global footprint and serves some of the fastest-growing segments of the B2B cross-border payments markets. Powered by a sophisticated and expansive global settlement network, Convera’s capabilities are built on efficiency, accuracy and compliance at its core, alleviating risk and accelerating smarter decision making. As a standalone fintech, Convera will build on its customer-led culture and accelerate its investments in technology, product innovation and people to drive growth.
The ideal candidate has strong experience in proactively driving measurable impact, quantitative and qualitative problem solving, and executive communications. There are many backgrounds that successful candidates could draw from – some of the most common ones include management consulting, corporate strategy, strategic business operations (e.g. Product) and investment (e.g. private equity, investment banking) roles.

In your role as Transformation & Strategy Lead, you will:
Support strategy development and execution, executive communications, and execution of organizational outcomes.
Question the status quo, pressure test our direction and drive strategic decisions by crisply framing problems, potential paths and tradeoffs
Lead major workstreams, as necessary, to successfully execute Convera’s corporate strategy
Conduct quantitative and qualitative analyses using internal (e.g., financials) and external (e.g., benchmarks) sources to support strategy development.
Including moderately complex business case development and financial modeling.
Including defining the opportunities and risks of our current product, customer, and geo footprint; identify and assess the viability and size of new business opportunities
Build thought leadership in market & competitive insights to inform Convera's strategy and execution
Understand Convera's business model and the business landscape we operate in to provide credible and foundational context for the team's work
Understand, develop insights on, and communicate the most impactful customer, market and macro-level payments trends
Develop insights on competitive trends, and deep understanding of competitors' business models, GTM approaches, value propositions, partners & M&A activity
Decipher potential major disrupters (e.g. blockchain) impacting the future of the industry and how to adapt our strategy/business model to take advantage
Both support and lead priority transformation initiatives partnering with leaders across the org
Lead issue resolution with senior leaders, progress reporting, and tracking initiative results & impacts
Support colleagues across the business on presenting data-informed insights and recommendations that enable senior leadership to make informed choices
Collaborate with colleagues across functions and markets to solve strategic problems, drive success of our transformation program, make recommendations, and enable Convera to move quickly
Effective in a hybrid work environment, combining virtual work with in-person meetings.
Working knowledge of and experience applying strategy skillset (e.g., highly structured thinking / problem solving; insights development; executive communications and influencing), and rigorous program/project management of complex, multi-dimensional initiatives
A successful Transformation & Strategy Lead for this fintech should ideally have:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong experience with data analysis, synthesis and problem solving.
Professional courage to take on issues and challenges.
Deals well with ambiguity, can take an idea and turn into execution.
Strong collaborator, partnership skills, builds relationships, understands how to find common ground.
Humble, can-do attitude with a learning mindset and ability to thrive in ambiguity; you are intellectually curious, have a passion for excellence and want to make a big impact
Proficient in PowerPoint, Excel and Word as tools in business logic development, analytics/modeling and communication to executive audiences
High degree of digital / technical literacy preferred
Bachelor's degree or MBA preferred from an accredited educational institution
Able to travel as required
Indicative salary, bonus & benefits:
Market salary
Opportunity to earn an annual bonus
Great career growth and development opportunities in a global organization
A flexible approach to work
Generous insurance (health, disability, life) and retirement programs
Paid holidays, time-off and leave policies for life events (maternity, paternity, adoption, bereavement, military)
Paid volunteering opportunities

An exciting opportunity has now arisen for a Self-Employed Warrant Officer to join our Field Resolution team servicing the Doncaster postcode and surrounding areas. Experience of executing warrants of entry for utility clients is preferred, along with great communication skills and significant experience of negotiating with individuals from all walks of life. You should also be fluent in English and possess the tenacity and drive to go the extra mile when required.
This self-employed role offers a choice of days to supply your services but end of month company targets will drive certain requirements to supply on specific days. You will also require a reliable vehicle as the work allocated to you may require travel outside your local area.
The Role
Working on behalf of major household names from the Utilities sector, you will visit residential and commercial customers to execute warrants of entry and fit Pay as You Go Gas and Electricity meters.
You will manage a small team of operatives, including meter engineers and locksmiths. You will be responsible for taking the lead role with customers and either negotiating payments and payment arrangements or directing the meter engineer to fit a Pay as You Go meter.
You will also take overall responsibility for the safety of your team and conduct a full risk assessment on arrival at each address. You will review household vulnerabilities and the customer’s ability to pay, whilst taking appropriate measures to ensure that social distancing and infection control protocols are fully adhered to. This will include ascertaining whether customers or any member of their household has COVID-19, are displaying any of the symptoms associated with the virus and whether anyone in the household is shielding.

A full Driving Licence.
Use of a reliable vehicle.
A clean DBS (our policy is to apply for this automatically)
A healthy credit history (we will consider adverse circumstances where arrangements have been entered to)
A flexible approach to working hours and travel, and a willingness to go that extra mile when required.
Be receptive and open to coaching and feedback to enhance performance delivery.
Satisfy all regulatory requirements.
Benefits
A minimum of £100 per day plus additional installation incentive
Full Training provided
Working with market leading brands
Additional work streams may also be available along with opportunities for upskilling.

In a changing market environment, where customer expectations continue to grow and there is an increasing demand for personalised customer experiences, Customer Analytics is leading the charge to enable and deliver this personalised experience through data analytics.
To deliver on this vision our team leverage internal and external data and apply data analytics and visualisation techniques to maximise the value of this data, explain it back to the business, and deliver positive outcomes for our customers and our business.
The complex challenges the team faces means there is considerable opportunity for team members to grow and develop both their technical and non-technical skills to achieve their full potential at Bank of Ireland.

The Data Analytics Manager will play a key role as a senior member of the Customer Analytics team. Experience working in a commercial, marketing or trading performance role.

Experience of working in Agile delivery squads.

Experience with Teradata, Tableau or similar data technologies.

Demonstrable experience measuring the value of analytics in terms of increased revenue, customer outcomes or reduced cost.

The Role
PEI Group is seeking an experienced editor to join our fast-growing special projects team. As a Special Projects Editor, you will produce reports and other ad-hoc publications across our titles which include Infrastructure Investor, PERE, Private Equity International and Private Debt Investor.
The reports will typically have sponsor involvement and cover topics as diverse as ESG, human capital and trends in technology. There’ll also be opportunities to produce podcasts – a growing area for special projects.
The successful candidate is likely to have demonstrable print experience, ideally in a B2B or finance publication, with a good understanding of alternative assets and the private equity sector.
We are looking for someone who can:
Produce supplements and other ad-hoc publications, both print and digital, as well as podcasts to complement PEI Group titles.
Oversee production of each supplement or special project, managing flatplans and adhering to deadlines.
Collaborate with colleagues across offices to develop original content ideas for print, podcasts and videos.
Write, commission freelancers and edit copy to a high standard in terms of accuracy and style.
Liaise with external clients and sponsors to ensure guest commentaries, keynote interviews, roundtables and related materials are produced to PEI and client standards.
Who we are:
PEI Group is a subscriber-focused business intelligence company. With our multi-talented global team of over 300 people, spread across EMEA, USA & Asia, our purpose is to inform and connect investment professionals across global, specialised markets. We identify specific high growth, high value investment sectors and themes where deep insight, strong market relationships and active capital flows are critical for success.
What we do:

PEI Group provides industry-leading journalism, data and market insight to subscribing clients via a wide portfolio of specialist brands supported by our robust and scalable digital publishing, analytics and database platform.
We also track the firms and individuals who shape markets and bring client-communities together to enable knowledge sharing, profile building and relationship development through professional networks and events.
Wherever our markets are active – in New York, Los Angeles, Tokyo, Sydney, Hong Kong, London and elsewhere – PEI is hard at work examining crucial market forces and shifting investment themes, identifying active investors and their capital allocations, and scanning ahead for regulatory changes, new compliance requirements and other risk factors.
Requirements
Requirements
Skills & Experience
Formal journalism education or training is highly desirable
Minimum of 3-5 years’ demonstrable experience in a journalism/editing role, ideally for a finance or B2B title
Editorial experience in print publications, especially magazines, is preferable
Experience of working with sponsors and commercial partners to produce thought leadership
A good understanding of both print and digital journalism and the different approaches required
Ability to co-ordinate editorial, production and design teams to meet deadlines
An understanding of alternative assets and the private equity sector
Ability to research market trends and data and help shape potential feature/supplement themes
Personal Attributes
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Organised and approachable – we’re looking for someone who’s friendly and pleasant to work with but can still balance priorities when it comes to deadlines and producing high-quality content
Fast learner with a passion for content
Able to remain focused in the face of multiple competing priorities and ensure key deadlines are met
Data-savvy with the ability to turn complex survey results into accessible editorial content

Do you love events? Do you want to work on something unique and challenging? Do you want to be instrumental in bringing inspiration and joy to tens of thousands of people as you deliver well considered, high quality experiences? This could be the position for you, and it comes with an unmatched reward; a deep feeling of pride when you witness your hard work become reality, and the incredible impact it has on people’s lives.
About Wildkind
Wildkind is primarily an events business with two market leading event properties; Camp Wildfire and Camp Kindling. Since being founded in 2015 we have been growing at 100% year on year. Over the next 10 years we aim to take our unique events worldwide to inspire, challenge and entertain over 1 million customers.
An incredible community has grown around our events and is now the centre-point of everything we do. As well as investing in the growth of our events we are looking to expand our retail and media business lines to provide even more value to this group.
Our mission
To spark curiosity, encourage endeavour and create joy.
Our culture
We have a supportive, growth focussed working culture and will invest in education and experimentation to push the boundaries of your abilities and our shared achievements. We champion diverse skill sets, perspectives and discussion; everyone is encouraged to be themselves and input into the organisation and work at all levels. We care deeply about our work having a positive impact on our customers, colleagues, communities and the environment. We promote creativity and adventure in everything we do.
Key Information
Salary: £35,000 to £45,000 per year depending on experience
Social: Monthly adventures/parties with your team
Health: £500 per year for your physical/mental health
Education: £1000 per year for your learning and development
Annual Leave: 30 days (including public holidays)
Location: Hybrid (Min 5 days per month in London Office)
Hours: Flexible 40hrs per week (3 hours per day between 10:00-18:00 GMT/BST)
Start Date: Mar/Apr 2023
Application Deadline: Midnight on 15th Feb 2023
Your mission
Manage the delivery of our events from concept, to live, to evaluation. Booking and managing suppliers and staff. Coordinating with venues and local authorities. Managing event budgets and project timelines. Understanding our customers to ensure their expectations are met. Developing repeatable processes to improve efficiency and quality of our events. Developing new event formats.
Your objectives
1. Manage the delivery of 3x events in Aug & Sep 2023.
2. Create a scalable model enabling us to deliver a growing number of events with efficiency and to a high standard, over the next 3 years.
3. Develop new event formats to build the offering to our community and our opportunities for revenue.
Your responsibilities
As a company we focus on objectives and results, with individuals driving the decisions on the best ways to achieve them. We have included this list of responsibilities to give you an idea of the starting point for this position; the exact responsibilities will develop under your leadership.
End-to-end event management, planning and delivering Wildkind events & experiences to a high standard.
Management of each event’s budget, ensuring each event meets its profit targets without compromising on quality. Creating and managing project timelines, ensuring key milestones are met.
Management of all event paperwork and documentation, including risk assessments and emergency plans.
Liaising with key stakeholders such as venue owners, local authorities, emergency services and local residents.
Designing event site plans (using CAD or similar) with consideration of customer experience, operational efficiencies, and lisencising and H&S regulations.
Working closely with our marketing and customer service teams to ensure customer communications about events are accurate and timely.
Collating all event requirements, creating detailed specifications and ensuring they are all provided.
Procurement of all suppliers and staff for delivery of events (structures, toilets, showers, vehicles, trackway, power, water, fencing, site crew, security, traffic management, sound, lighting, staging, set, backline, recycling, cabins, etc).
Onsite event management & delivery, overseeing suppliers, site management & crew and ensuring events run punctually.
Sourcing & building an effective network of highly skilled and reliable contractors and suppliers.
Researching and developing potential new event formats and how they could be delivered.
Your experience
Demonstrable experience managing the planning and delivery of outdoor events.
Experienced in site plan design, focusing on both customer experience and operational efficiencies.

Our large portfolio of clients, which includes many of the Fortune 250, come from a broad range of vertical markets including healthcare, retail, hospitality, financial services and utilities.
Job Role
Eckoh is looking for a highly skilled Software Engineer to join a team dedicating delivering Eckoh’s customer solutions.
Eckoh is looking for motivated people who want to continue build their career in the technology industry. Your drive to engage, knowledge share, collaborate and learn is a must. This position offers continued exposure and learning to areas of Implementations.

Job title: EHR Digital Programme Clinical Change Lead
Description:
Job Title:  EHR Digital Programme – Clinical Change Lead
Location:  1 London Bridge with expectation to visit other sites
Salary Range: Competitive
Contract Type: Fixed Term Contract up to 3 years
Reporting to: CMIO / CCIO
We are actively recruiting for EHR Digital Programme Clinical Change Lead’s for a number of areas; OPD, UCC, Midwifery, Imaging, Laboratory Operations, Nursing and Therapies, Oncology, Pharmacy, Theatre/Anaesthetic and Critical Care.
About HCA Healthcare UK:
It is a hugely exciting time for our organisation. We are pioneers in providing healthcare solutions to our patients as part of an established US healthcare organization built on over 50 years of experience. To continue our success, we are implementing our five-year One HCA UK strategy, which includes ambitious growth plans, the opening of new sites and significant investments in enhancing effectiveness and alignment as a group.
These growth plans include implementing a real time end-to-end Electronic Health Record (EHR) platform, a multi-million-pound investment, and part of our long-term digital transformation initiative. Focused on advancing our technology and integrating web-based navigation, this EHR will allow HCA UK clinicians and colleagues to enhance patient safety, quality and care and to maintain our outstanding ratings and continue to be a global market leader in complex care. Therefore, we are investing in a new workforce to lead this change, and we are actively recruiting now for a 2023 start, focused on change management, transforming work practices, and project delivery of goals and objectives.
In summary:
Change leader focusing on clinical workstream within the HCA UK division wide transformational programme that will introduce new ways of working for clinicians and colleagues, providing front-line patient care through a new Electronic Health Record system.
This is a non-clinical role but will be responsible for supporting clinical teams. The role holder will lead, facilitate and be responsible for change management activities required to support the implementation of new EHR systems/technologies and related processes associated primarily (but not exclusively) to clinical processes across the HCA UK.
The post-holder will work with key stakeholder groups (clinical and non-clinical) and facilitate contribution from staff across the HCA UK to develop business and process change and support new improved ways of working to optimise the realisation of benefits.
Specific deliverables and top priorities for this role are:
Experience of leading a team within the clinical workstreams
Accountability for the Change Management Plan for clinical business areas
Responsibility for the business requirements of clinical business areas being met within the EHR delivery
Active oversight of Implementation and transition to BAU
Pro-active management of risks and issues and adherence to programme governance
Developing tracking for benefit realisation to feed into the programme benefits
Successful candidates will need:
Change Management qualification or equivalent experience
Lean Six Sigma / BA qualification advantageous
Previous responsibility for delivery of the change management for a significant change programme
Experienced in process re-design
Ideally, experience of an EHR implementation but not essential
Delivery of a significant change programme
Experience within a clinical setting
Excellent stakeholder management
Good attention to detail
If you would like to join HCA Healthcare UK as a EHR Digital Programme Clinical Change Lead and be part of an organization shaping a healthier tomorrow, we invite you to apply. Our application process is quick and easy, completing a 2-minute questionnaire and upload a CV.

About Tropicana Brands Group

Tropicana Brands Group (TBG) brings together an exciting, global portfolio of some of the world's most iconic juice brands including Tropicana, Naked, KeVita, Izze, Dole and Copella. Established in 2022 as a joint venture between PAI Partners and PepsiCo, the company aims to promote new growth for its business, opportunities for its people and accelerate a vision to quench the world's thirst for more delight and nourishment.
With a global footprint of more than 2,000 associates that spans North America and Europe, we are proud of our industry-leading capabilities in areas that include innovation, R&D, manufacturing, distribution, sales, marketing and nutrition expertise.
What's Your Role?

TBG is looking for someone to add to their Global Communications Team who can lead Communications and Public Affairs efforts in support of their European business, which exists primarily in the UK, France and Belgium where we have a large manufacturing footprint.
This person will be responsible for serving as the key communications resource for the European team, across both external and internal channels. This includes serving as a critical counselor on any external-facing brand communications, adapting a global, corporate narrative to further our agenda in Europe with key stakeholders (including media, key opinion leaders and government regulators) and working closely with the HR team to ensure our workforce is engaged and informed.
Reporting directly into the Head of Global Communications and indirectly into the CEO of the European Business Unit, this role will also need to collaborate closely with other leaders across the team including members of the legal, regulatory and marketing teams. Candidates should be based in London.
This is a unique and exciting opportunity to serve as a critical and influential subject matter expert for a growing portfolio. As such, the ideal candidate will be experienced, motivated, and inspired by the opportunity to shape a communications agenda and ways of working.
Key Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Corporate + Brand Communications
Lead strategic, external communications efforts on behalf of the company, including building outreach plans, narratives and content to reach targeted audiences.
Support local executives to vet and coordinate any appropriate visibility efforts
Manage incoming media inquiries from European outlets to our brands or TBG
Support the business in managing the communications aspect of any market specific crises or issues
Public Affairs
Help shape the company's government affairs capability including the establishment of processes, procedures and tools to unlock efficiency
Participate in industry trade associations and coalitions, negotiate industry positions/policies, and help build consensus consistent with TBG's global corporate view.
Serve as a liaison to key business partners on critical policy issues that may affect our business as well as manage any associated regulatory and consumer/reputational risks.
Internal Communications
Work closely with the local HR team to articulate key policies and procedures to employees
Support the development of internal communications pieces on behalf of the EU CEO as appropriate
Assist in building out cultural initiatives

Qualifications / Requirements:

The most appealing candidates will have the following qualifications:
8-10 years of experience in a Communications or Corporate Affairs based role
Strong understanding of the food and beverage sector
Experience navigating the policy and government affairs space
Expertise in external communications, including proficiency in all aspects of media relations
Enthusiasm for building something new and operating in an agile manner
Excellent writing and presentation skills
Ability to manage and influence multiple stakeholders, external and internal
Executive presence inclusive of strong verbal and written communications skills
A forward thinker who has a vision and enthusiasm for building something new
A growth mindset and ability to operate with agility
Comfort managing multiple priorities and serving many partners in a fast-moving environment
Must have ability to work independently and efficiently with little supervision
Must be willing to travel internationally when required and operate in different countries
Fluency in French is appreciated, not required
