Position Overview
The Project Manager is responsible for managing project scope all scales of events. This position will monitor progress and performance against the project plan, identifying, resolving, escalating operational problems, and minimising delays. This position is responsible for the end-to-end execution of projects from event design and development through closing. The Project Manager will ensure successful and profitable execution of events by following Technical and Production Standards and supporting the implementation of processes and SOP’s that drive consistency in event production. This position will partner with Project Management, Sales, and Operations teams in determining event technical requirements and communicating event execution plan with all parties. The Project Manager will report to the Director, Project Management or General Manager in area.

Key Job Responsibilities

Event Project Management
Prepare and communicate technical production & labour schedules, sub-rental requirements, project scope, execution plan and individual responsibilities to team members, vendors and venue partners.
Determine and secure the resources required to successfully complete each project.
Drive Results - Maintain focus on client needs by attending client meetings, creating and maintaining organised show documentation and responding to client concerns and questions.
Monitor project scope throughout the event planning process and adjust as necessary to ensure the successful completion of the project.
Assist sales and operations teams to help determine equipment needs and technical solutions for the project.
Assist with the creation of technical diagrams when required.
Review all sales documents to confirm that the equipment and technical positions will meet the client’s needs.
Deliver World Class Service - Develop and maintain strong relationships with clients at all levels of their organisation and provide outstanding customer service while focusing on client retention.
Provide leadership for Technical teams on events.
Ensure that all the necessary HSE documentations including but not limited to Risk Assessments and Method Statements are in place and communicated to the project delivery team prior to the execution of an event.

Event Execution
See the Bigger Picture - Act as the project leader and onsite contact for the client throughout the event.
Manage all phases of event technical execution from load-in through run of show to load-out.
Assume ownership of inventory management throughout the event.
Communicate the project plan and client expectations to event team.
Manage onsite changes, including schedule, equipment or workforce modifications.
Value People - Mentor and communicate with Encore Team Members on event execution and best practices to help improve the local knowledge base and experience in the market.
Do the Right Thing - Ensure compliance with established Technical Standards and Production Standards.
At all times, the Project Manager is expected to abide by all health and safety requirements to company and international standards and to ensure that all team members and subcontractors working onsite adhere to the same.
Follow up with clients on-site to ensure that their needs are met and the equipment setup is working properly.
Financial Management
Assist in the creation, analysis, and execution of the project budget, partnering with regional leadership to mitigate external workforce and sub-rental spend.
Manage event costs to align with budget and ensure all onsite changes are communicated to sales for billing purposes.
Assist with the completion of post-event client invoice. Work with operations management to ensure the prompt payment of all external vendors
Ensure compliance with Encore Policies and Procedures to minimise company’s exposure to liability claims and property damage, theft and misappropriation.

Administrative & Training
Complete Encore post-event process, to include the completion of all post-show reporting, confirming all workforce hours are accurately entered and ensuring that outsourced equipment is returned to appropriate provider.
Participate in the development of Project Management SOP’s.
Conduct review and analysis of proposed events as required.

We're currently recruiting for a Credit Risk Specialist to join our Counterparty Credit Oversight Team to provide advice, independent opinion and assurance in alignment with the Group Risk's Mission to promote informed decision making and controlled risk-taking that improves customer outcomes and delivers long term value for shareholders.
Location: London
Salary: Competitive salary + up to 32% bonus, private medical insurance, excellent pension scheme, electric vehicle scheme, life assurance, 38 days holiday (including Bank Holidays) and much more!
Job Type: Permanent
Job Contact: Amanda Foskett
Closing Date: 3rd February 2023

We have an incredible opportunity to join us here at Phoenix Group as a Credit Risk Specialist in the Counterparty Credit Oversight (CCO) team within Asset Management Risk.
Who are we?
We want to be the best place that any of our colleagues have ever worked.
We are the UK's largest long-term savings and retirement business with c.13 million customers and c.£300 billion of assets under administration. As a market leader and FTSE100 organisation, we understand that our scale and expertise means that we have a key role to play for our customers, colleagues and our communities to help as many people as possible secure a life of possibilities. We are tackling key environmental and social issues such as transitioning our portfolio to net zero by 2050 - but we're not done yet.
We've seen huge growth and change, and this means there is enormous opportunity for our 7,000 colleagues to grow alongside us.
Flexible working
You can expect to work in a hybrid manner with time spent working in the office and at home. We believe that work/life balance offers benefits for customers as well as ensuring that you can balance a successful career with your life outside of work. We will discuss flexibility, what is important to you and balancing this with business requirements during the recruitment process.
We want to hire the whole version of you.
We are committed to ensuring that everyone feels accepted and safe at work and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Everyone is valued at Phoenix regardless of age, gender identity, neurodiversity, race, disability, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, socioeconomic background or anything else. Whether it's joining one of our internal employee networks, being an ally, taking positive action or simply being there to listen, everyone at Phoenix is valued and respected.
If you need any help or adjustments to the recruitment process due to health, disability or anything else, please let us know so we can help you to be the best version of yourself.
The role
The role will support the ambition to build the oversight model and capabilities in providing advice, independent opinion & assurance and to promote informed decision making and controlled risk-taking that improves customer outcomes and delivers long-term value for shareholders.
Responsible for periodic risk reviews considering emerging thinking / best practice, e.g., specialist risk reviews to ensure the appropriate identification and management of financial risk in targeted areas of the business including advising business risk owners on issues identified in risk reviews and solutions to those issues.
Assist the Head of Credit Counterparty Oversight with further developing and enhancement of the Line 2 counterparty credit oversight framework for Phoenix Group & Phoenix Asset Management, managing a variety of risk management related tasks and activities simultaneously.
Keep abreast of developments in the Capital & Financial markets and the impact it may have on our credit portfolio.
Monitor credit rating changes by External Credit Assessment Institutions on existing counterparty exposures, including corporates and financial institutions.
Contribute to Senior Management/Board risk reporting on the effectiveness of the Risk Management Framework, risk exposure and appetite, and the appropriateness of actions taken to manage risk effectively.
Establish relationships with key stakeholders across the Group, including risk peers, asset management and senior managers to support the implementation of an effective Risk Management Framework and to manage risk exposure.
Managing a variety of Risk Management related tasks and activities concurrently, meeting expectations on agreed deliverables and timescales.
What are we looking for?
Strong fundamental skills to provide Group Counterparty Credit oversight and monitor exposure accumulation.
- Ability to think critically, independently and creatively and think 'outside-the-box' - propose new analytical approaches and provide solutions.
Good understanding of the UK long-term life insurance business, including SII, annuities/BPA transaction, unit-linked, with-profits and the regulatory requirements governing insurance companies with particular emphasis on investments, ALM and Matching adjustment portfolios.
Forthright and persistent to ensure assurance views are understood and acknowledged.
Excellent communication and organisational skills, including experience of drafting reports for presentation at senior management / executive level.
Drive and flexibility to undertake a wide range of projects / activities simultaneously.
Demonstrable ability to work constructively in a diverse and multicultural team environment.
Min of 3 years credit & financial risk experience within either a commercial/investment bank or re-/insurance company.
Professional qualification in risk, finance, investment, or equivalent financial discipline (e.g. CFA, FRM, ACA or similar)
SQL, Bloomberg, Aladdin experience
Why choose us?
Bring your 'whole self', skills and dedication to the Phoenix Group and we'll recognise your effort, support your development and help to drive your ambition. We'll ensure you're rewarded for your contribution with a competitive package that includes an attractive pension, annual bonus potential, private medical insurance, generous holiday entitlement, enhanced maternity and adoption leave and a range of other financial services and lifestyle flexible benefits.
Sound good? If you are ready to help us make Phoenix the best place you've ever worked, we'd love to hear from you.

Domestic & General is a company with an ambitious future. We are expanding our horizons and entering new markets and we need your expertise to help make it happen. We are an international company who works with some of the worlds most respected and well-known brands of domestic appliances and electronic consumer goods. Salary: Competitive + excellent benefits including 30% - 60% bonus, private medical insurance, 10% pension + much more!
Location: London
Job Type: Permanent
Job Contact: Amanda Foskett
Closing Date: 10 February 2023
We have an incredible opportunity to join us here at Phoenix Group as Head of structuring and securitisations Oversight to join our Illiquid Asset Oversight team to provide a professional service applying investments, actuarial, technical & business knowledge to support the delivery of informed & effective decision making in order to deliver the company strategy.
Who are we?
We want to be the best place that any of our colleagues have ever worked.
We are the UK's largest long-term savings and retirement business with c.13 million customers and c.£310 billion of assets under administration. As a market leader and FTSE 100 organisation, we understand that our scale and expertise means that we have a key role to play for our customers, colleagues and our communities to help as many people as possible secure a life of possibilities. We are tackling key environmental and social issues such as transitioning our portfolio to net zero by 2050 - but we're not done yet.
We've seen huge growth and change, and this means there is enormous opportunity for our 8,000 colleagues to grow alongside us.
Flexible working
You can expect to work in a hybrid manner with time spent working in the office and at home. We believe that work/life balance offers benefits for customers as well as ensuring that you can balance a successful career with your life outside of work. We will discuss flexibility, what is important to you and balancing this with business requirements during the recruitment process.
We want to hire the whole version of you.
We are committed to ensuring that everyone feels accepted and safe at work, and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Everyone is valued at Phoenix regardless of age, gender identity, neurodiversity, race, disability, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, socioeconomic background or anything else. Whether it's joining one of our internal employee networks, being an ally, taking positive action or simply being there to listen, everyone at Phoenix is valued and respected.
If you need any help or adjustments to the recruitment process due to health, disability or anything else, please let us know so we can help you to be the best version of yourself.
The role
The successful candidate will join the newly formed asset management risk team as it builds its oversight model and capabilities. This role will sit in the investment management oversight team and will include responsibilities for managing the team's oversight of direct origination activities in the group.
As well as the following responsibilities:
Assist Head of IAO to develop a Risk Management oversight function in respect of investment activity across the Phoenix Group, and Phoenix Asset Management and work with the Board Investment Committee, BRC and management to maintain an appropriate legal entity investment risk governance framework
Design and implement Line 2 oversight risk framework for the structuring of assets of Phoenix Group shareholder funds
Liaise with main stakeholders involved in the structuring process (Phoenix Asset Management, Retirement Solutions, Treasury, Capital Management and so on), provide guidance and recommendations
Assess appropriateness of structured solutions for Phoenix Group shareholder assets backing annuity business (Matching and Non-Matching Adjustment funds) and other balance sheet items (e.g. Own funds, SCR, risk Margin and so on) in consideration of internal Phoenix Group KPIs and KRIs, risk management standards, business aspirations and external regulatory requirements
Ongoing risk oversight of the implementation of asset structures, support design of appropriate risk management information packs with relevant KPIs and KRIs
Assess asset risks emerging from BPA transactions, portfolio rebalancing, appropriateness of the asset strategy, consistency with internal risk policies and regulatory requirements.
Keep abreast of developments in UK Life insurance industry (e.g. Solvency II regulatory changes, PRA supervisory statements, market trends) and in the capital markets, providing risk function with key market updates and developments
Conduct ad-hoc investment risk assessments as needed
Support review of investment proposals by contributing expertise to advise and challenge of line 1 proposals as needed .
Ensure the risks related to structuring and securitisation are captured and consistent with Group risk management standards
Identify, and lead targeted line 2 reviews of group structuring and securitisation capability
Provide support, including the knowledge on structuring and securitisation across the Investment Risk team to ensure effective and efficient management of financial risks.
Attend and present findings and recommendations to senior investment and risk management in an effective and insightful way
Senior stakeholder management including representation at governance forums, committees and independent oversight bodies as required
Provide oversight, coaching, mentoring and support to junior members of the team
What are we looking for?
Track record of developing, implementing or providing oversight on the structuring or securitisations of annuity and non-annuity backing assets
Experience on-boarding and transitioning BPA collateral to SAA to inform and evolve best in class oversight framework for onboarding assets particularly where illiquids are required
Extensive Knowledge of the markets, competitors, products, services, trends, impacting forces and factors, that make up the industries which Phoenix operates in
Experience on-boarding and transitioning BPA collateral to SAA to inform and evolve best in class oversight framework for onboarding assets particularly where illiquids are required
Wide ranging exposure to primarily less liquid (e.g. ERMs, collateralised loans, derivatives, repacks, structured notes, and so on) asset classes and integrating into SAA
Excellent communication and influencing skills (both written and verbal)
Ability to challenge status quo in effective and constructive manner
Strong in analytical and problem-solving skills to understand the root causes and provide solutions
Strong in performing quantitative analysis with the attention to detail
Consistently and constructively challenges proposals to improve business outcome
Knowledge
- Strong academics and quantitative background - degree or professional qualification in a risk, finance, actuarial or equivalent discipline
Knowledge of the markets, competitors, products, services, trends, impacting forces and factors, etc. that make up the industries in which Phoenix operates
Experience of reporting and presenting at senior management / executive level.
Why choose us?
Bring your 'whole self', skills and dedication to the Phoenix Group and we'll recognise your effort, support your development and help to drive your ambition. We'll ensure you're rewarded for your contribution with a competitive package that includes an attractive pension, annual bonus potential, private medical insurance, generous holiday entitlement, enhanced maternity and adoption leave and a range of other financial services and lifestyle flexible benefits.
Sound good? If you are ready to help us make Phoenix the best place you've ever worked, we'd love to hear from you.

Job title: EHR Digital Programme Clinical Change Lead
Description:
Job Title:  EHR Digital Programme – Clinical Change Lead
Location:  1 London Bridge with expectation to visit other sites
Salary Range: Competitive
Contract Type: Fixed Term Contract up to 3 years
Reporting to: CMIO / CCIO
We are actively recruiting for EHR Digital Programme Clinical Change Lead’s for a number of areas; OPD, UCC, Midwifery, Imaging, Laboratory Operations, Nursing and Therapies, Oncology, Pharmacy, Theatre/Anaesthetic and Critical Care.
About HCA Healthcare UK:
It is a hugely exciting time for our organisation. We are pioneers in providing healthcare solutions to our patients as part of an established US healthcare organization built on over 50 years of experience. To continue our success, we are implementing our five-year One HCA UK strategy, which includes ambitious growth plans, the opening of new sites and significant investments in enhancing effectiveness and alignment as a group.
These growth plans include implementing a real time end-to-end Electronic Health Record (EHR) platform, a multi-million-pound investment, and part of our long-term digital transformation initiative. Focused on advancing our technology and integrating web-based navigation, this EHR will allow HCA UK clinicians and colleagues to enhance patient safety, quality and care and to maintain our outstanding ratings and continue to be a global market leader in complex care. Therefore, we are investing in a new workforce to lead this change, and we are actively recruiting now for a 2023 start, focused on change management, transforming work practices, and project delivery of goals and objectives.
In summary:
Change leader focusing on clinical workstream within the HCA UK division wide transformational programme that will introduce new ways of working for clinicians and colleagues, providing front-line patient care through a new Electronic Health Record system.
This is a non-clinical role but will be responsible for supporting clinical teams. The role holder will lead, facilitate and be responsible for change management activities required to support the implementation of new EHR systems/technologies and related processes associated primarily (but not exclusively) to clinical processes across the HCA UK.
The post-holder will work with key stakeholder groups (clinical and non-clinical) and facilitate contribution from staff across the HCA UK to develop business and process change and support new improved ways of working to optimise the realisation of benefits.
Specific deliverables and top priorities for this role are:
Experience of leading a team within the clinical workstreams
Accountability for the Change Management Plan for clinical business areas
Responsibility for the business requirements of clinical business areas being met within the EHR delivery
Active oversight of Implementation and transition to BAU
Pro-active management of risks and issues and adherence to programme governance
Developing tracking for benefit realisation to feed into the programme benefits
Successful candidates will need:
Change Management qualification or equivalent experience
Lean Six Sigma / BA qualification advantageous
Previous responsibility for delivery of the change management for a significant change programme
Experienced in process re-design
Ideally, experience of an EHR implementation but not essential
Delivery of a significant change programme
Experience within a clinical setting
Excellent stakeholder management
Good attention to detail
If you would like to join HCA Healthcare UK as a EHR Digital Programme Clinical Change Lead and be part of an organization shaping a healthier tomorrow, we invite you to apply. Our application process is quick and easy, completing a 2-minute questionnaire and upload a CV.

About Tropicana Brands Group

Tropicana Brands Group (TBG) brings together an exciting, global portfolio of some of the world's most iconic juice brands including Tropicana, Naked, KeVita, Izze, Dole and Copella. Established in 2022 as a joint venture between PAI Partners and PepsiCo, the company aims to promote new growth for its business, opportunities for its people and accelerate a vision to quench the world's thirst for more delight and nourishment.
With a global footprint of more than 2,000 associates that spans North America and Europe, we are proud of our industry-leading capabilities in areas that include innovation, R&D, manufacturing, distribution, sales, marketing and nutrition expertise.
What's Your Role?

TBG is looking for someone to add to their Global Communications Team who can lead Communications and Public Affairs efforts in support of their European business, which exists primarily in the UK, France and Belgium where we have a large manufacturing footprint.
This person will be responsible for serving as the key communications resource for the European team, across both external and internal channels. This includes serving as a critical counselor on any external-facing brand communications, adapting a global, corporate narrative to further our agenda in Europe with key stakeholders (including media, key opinion leaders and government regulators) and working closely with the HR team to ensure our workforce is engaged and informed.
Reporting directly into the Head of Global Communications and indirectly into the CEO of the European Business Unit, this role will also need to collaborate closely with other leaders across the team including members of the legal, regulatory and marketing teams. Candidates should be based in London.
This is a unique and exciting opportunity to serve as a critical and influential subject matter expert for a growing portfolio. As such, the ideal candidate will be experienced, motivated, and inspired by the opportunity to shape a communications agenda and ways of working.
Key Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Corporate + Brand Communications
Lead strategic, external communications efforts on behalf of the company, including building outreach plans, narratives and content to reach targeted audiences.
Support local executives to vet and coordinate any appropriate visibility efforts
Manage incoming media inquiries from European outlets to our brands or TBG
Support the business in managing the communications aspect of any market specific crises or issues
Public Affairs
Help shape the company's government affairs capability including the establishment of processes, procedures and tools to unlock efficiency
Participate in industry trade associations and coalitions, negotiate industry positions/policies, and help build consensus consistent with TBG's global corporate view.
Serve as a liaison to key business partners on critical policy issues that may affect our business as well as manage any associated regulatory and consumer/reputational risks.
Internal Communications
Work closely with the local HR team to articulate key policies and procedures to employees
Support the development of internal communications pieces on behalf of the EU CEO as appropriate
Assist in building out cultural initiatives

Qualifications / Requirements:

The most appealing candidates will have the following qualifications:
8-10 years of experience in a Communications or Corporate Affairs based role
Strong understanding of the food and beverage sector
Experience navigating the policy and government affairs space
Expertise in external communications, including proficiency in all aspects of media relations
Enthusiasm for building something new and operating in an agile manner
Excellent writing and presentation skills
Ability to manage and influence multiple stakeholders, external and internal
Executive presence inclusive of strong verbal and written communications skills
A forward thinker who has a vision and enthusiasm for building something new
A growth mindset and ability to operate with agility
Comfort managing multiple priorities and serving many partners in a fast-moving environment
Must have ability to work independently and efficiently with little supervision
Must be willing to travel internationally when required and operate in different countries
Fluency in French is appreciated, not required

Job Description:
Job Title
Customer Solutions Engineer
Department
Professional Information Business
Location
London or Barcelona
About us
For more than 130 years, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world’s top business entities. Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including Factiva, Dow Jones Newswires, Risk and Compliance, The Wall Street Journal, Barron’s, MarketWatch, Financial News, and our text mining and analytics platform Factiva Analytics.
Factiva Analytics enables customers and partners to integrate with Dow Jones’ world-class professional information and patented taxonomy, allowing them to interact with it in new and innovative ways which include building their own custom solutions.
At Dow Jones we live at the intersection of advanced data capabilities, award-winning journalism and innovative technology to deliver news, tools and financial insight to move markets, inform critical decisions and power top companies and careers.
Role
Our Customer Solutions Engineers (CSE) are critical technical partners for our customers and sales teams. The CSE will drive the technical integration for Dow Jones’ prospects, customers and partners, who range from cutting-edge startups and incubators to the world’s most respected corporations.
In addition to working with customers, the CSE team defines best practices and architecture patterns relevant to customers' needs and incorporates trending technologies and techniques into the proposed solutions.
Responsibilities
Work with Sales, their prospects and customers looking to understand and exploit integration possibilities with Dow Jones data and services. Design solutions and implementation guidance
Determine technical and business requirements from customers and propose technical solutions in a professional manner and to agreed timeframes
Demonstrate solutions that meet the customers’ business requirements and address any technical and product questions during the sales cycle.
Advise and guide prospective customers during their integration of Dow Jones data and services including building and managing proof of concepts
Share best practices, model designs etc. with prospects and customers for both technical development and in support of customer’s internal approvals processes
Provide feedback to Dow Jones Product and Technology teams on emerging requirements and themes and customer technology trends.
Contribute to the team’s portfolio of best practices and processes.
Stay aware of emerging technologies and techniques that can be beneficial to the role and team.
Skills & Experience
Required:
Professionalism and a customer-first approach
More than 5 years’ prior work in a customer-facing customer engineering role
Software development experience using Agile development practices.
Intermediate knowledge of SQL, Python and NodeJS languages.
Demonstrated experience building and leading technical product demonstrations that include APIs.
Business acumen and strategic problem-solving skills to assist with customer requirements
Experience responding to functional and technical elements of RFIs/RFPs
Degree in Computer Science or a related field
Highly Desired:
Experience working with Google Cloud Platform (GCP), particularly BigQuery
Strong coding skills in any modern programming language.
Experience working with Cloud services for data ingestion, processing and storage.
Understanding of Machine Learning techniques, specifically, Natural Language Processing (NLP) and text mining.
Experience and familiarity with our products and lines of business including Factiva, Risk & Compliance, Newswires, etc.
Dow Jones , Making Careers Newsworthy

Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, please reach out to us at TalentResourceTeam@dowjones.com. Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world’s top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron’s, MarketWatch and Financial News.
This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

SHEPPERTON
HIGHLY COMPETITIVE SALARY DEPENDING ON EXPERIENCE PLUS EXCELLENT BENEFITS
Our client is a leading multi-disciplined construction and resource management group, operating across the UK and Ireland, and delivers innovative, safe and sustainable solutions to the most complex construction and resource management challenges. They are a market-leading, ambitious and inspirational organisation which continues to evolve and grow. This is possible because of their exceptional people and the continuing investment in them and their journeys with the company.
In alignment with The Company’s Health and Safety system, SHED (“Safe Home Every Day”), The Quantity Surveyor will be:
· Responsible for the day to day administration of the commercial function of the Project(s).
· Demonstrate a deep understanding of the project(s) contractual and commercial requirements.
· Demonstrate a thorough understanding and competent execution of the monthly reconciled values and updated forecasts for approval by the Commercial Manager/Senior Quantity Surveyor.
· Demonstrates a sound understanding around the valuations cycle and associated deadlines, prioritising and managing both their own and the team’s time accordingly.
· Demonstrate confidence and competency, with minimal input from the Commercial Manager/Senior Commercial Manager with dispute resolution and contractual entitlement.
· Establish and maintain strong relationships with and effectively interfaced at peer level with the Company’s clients to agree valuations and variations.
· Interface with and form productive effective relationships with the site team(s) and the client team.
· Successfully interpreting information obtained from the site team(s) for incorporation into the account.
· Demonstrate inspirational leadership of the Commercial team around supporting, mentoring and coaching Graduates, Trainees and AQS’s, proactively assisting with their role specific training and development.
In line with the Company’s relevant policies and procedures, the Quantity Surveyor’s responsibilities will span and include the following:
Stakeholder Management
Liaise with all external and internal stakeholders to enable the projects to progress without delay, ensuring that all reasonable requests are met in a timely, efficient manner.
Interfaces with the business to deliver professional and competent advice and support, to ensure that the projects are managed in accordance with the contract, and meet the required reporting deadlines.
Cost Management, Reporting and Supporting
Interfaces with the business to deliver professional and competent advice and support, to ensure that the projects are managed in accordance with the contract, and meet the required reporting deadlines.
Provide clear and accurate information to the site team(s) and commercial manager.
Prepare monthly internal values (IV).
Prepare and monitor the construction budget.
Prepare monthly KPI reports.
Change Management
Maintain and update change register.
Manage and report change control procedures within each specific contract and ensuring that they are adhered to by all parties.
Ensure variations are submitted in accordance with the contract.
Procurement
Oversee Sub-Contract and Special Supplies procurement and administration/payments.
Prepare Subcontract orders for sign off by the Commercial Manager.
Sub-Contract/Special Supplies Administration
Prepare and assess applications, including any changes and make recommendations.
Raise Subcontract payment certificates for sign off by the Commercial Manager.
Preparing general correspondence on behalf of the business.
Subcontract administration/payments.
Production and distribution of detailed meeting minutes for all subcontract meetings.
Contractual Compliance, Quality and Risk Management
Liaise with the project managers to review and update the risk registers aligned with any early warnings
Identify principal risks and opportunities, raises, addresses and resolves problems at a project level and supports the project delivery team, maintain a schedule of potential financial implications for the various projects.
Demonstrate a complete understanding of the contractual liabilities and responsibilities.
Prepare and monitor risk register.
Prepare and monitor cause and effect schedule.
Interrogate costs and report on variance from construction budget and advise operations system on how impact can be mitigated.
Forecast problems/potential issues.
Collaboration and Teamwork
Manage a programme of current workload in order that all commissions receive the relevant allocation of resource to efficiently commercially manage them.
Effective day to day administration of the commercial management of the project(s).
Support and advise operations team in submission of contract correspondence.
Support, mentor and verify the work of assistant quantity surveyors.
Desirable Skills & Experience
Expertise in administering high value, multi-disciplinary construction project work packages / contracts utilising forms of contract such as the NEC3 suite.
Degree qualified in quantity surveying or other relevant business discipline.
Professional qualification and/or membership of the RICS or other relevant Chartered Institute would be an additional advantage.
Comfortable communicating with all levels of Senior Management and Stakeholders.
Demonstrates the ability to build excellent relationships
Acute attention to detail.
Demonstrates previous successes in delivering against deadlines.
Experience in writing contract communications.
Experience in creating cost reports and CVRs (Cost value reconciliations).
Demonstrate clear understanding of the construction process.
Demonstrate proficiency in a range of IT systems.
Previous experience in a role of either assistant quantity surveyor or quantity surveyor.
Should this amazing Quantity Surveyor role be of interest to you, please submit your CV to Anna Maguire.

Location: London and surrounding areas
Salary: £34,000 - £36,000 PA (accommodation, expenses and paid travelling time to be met by the Company)
We are a market-leading specialist external building and roof maintenance service provider, providing commercial clients with a complete external building fabric maintenance solution throughout the UK. We work on large commercial, listed, tall, challenging to access and industrial buildings undertaking planned, reactive roof maintenance and façade refurbishment projects.
We support clients with a variety of commercial roofing services from planned roof and gutter maintenance solutions, repairs, replacement and lining, liquid-based roof coatings, roof sheet/cladding sheet replacement as well as some more traditional leadworks and tile replacement works where required. Our core business provides specialist façade refurbishment solutions from specialist façade cleaning, repairs, recoating and redecoration, as well as a specialist working at heights services using abseiling and cradle methods of access.
We are looking for an ambitious and positive individual with trade experience of roof maintenance to help support our growing requirements for specialist refurbishment and maintenance projects. The ideal candidate will have experience of industrial and commercial roofing as a primary discipline, and experience in a variety of trade skills that can help solve problems across multiple building materials would be desirable although not essential.
If you want to be part of a growing company, practically minded, take pride in your work and enjoy variation to your daily tasks, this is an exciting and potentially varied position. The company will provide the successful candidate with all the support and further training needed to develop their skills as an individual, ensuring we collectively build competence and confidence for both personal and business growth. The ideal candidate will be given ownerships and encourage to grow as part of the business and supported at each stage to grow.
Key Responsibilities
· Ensuring high-quality customer service
· Delivering safe, well planned and effective working practices
· Undertaking high-quality roof and gutter maintenance repairs
· Providing planned and re-active maintenance solutions to key customers
· Completing project development reports and communicating all progress to internal business
· Undertaking site and access surveys to help with any pre-project planning
· Help with the development of technical repairs, product search and replacement specifications where needed
· Sourcing suitable repair products with an innovative approach
· Removing failed materials, preparing the substrate and completing repairs
· To work with and solve problems with other building materials such as masonry, render, cladding and concrete i.e. cleaning, repairs and redecorating
· Report, update business of project progress, risks and control measures within the team
· Working away will form part of the works at different stages
Attitude, Skills, Experience and Attributes
· A positive, problem-solving approach to daily tasks
· A desire to learn, expand skills and grow
· Open-minded, adaptable and willing to work outside of the main skill set to support the team and business
· Keen to learn new skills, undertake further training and grow within a business
· 5 years plus experience working with commercial buildings repairs ad roofs
· Ability to proactively identify future additional repair needs and communicate

Job title: Senior Analyst – Regulatory Affairs and Aggregate Risk (RAAR) – Stress Testing
Description:
Do you have an interest in understanding the risks faced by diversified financial institutions? Are you looking for a challenging role as part of a dynamic team? Join our Regulatory Affairs and Aggregate Risk (RAAR) team and play a key role in providing valuable insights across EMEA businesses and regulated entities risk profile and financial strength using the Enterprise-Wide Stress Testing frameworks.
As a member of the team, you will play a key role in the development of material components of our stress testing framework. You will have the opportunity to work with the risk frameworks that cover enterprise-wide stress testing, scenario design and risk identification; oversight of capital adequacy (ICAAP/ICARA), and climate risk scenario analysis.
The role offers plenty of exposure and you will have the opportunity to collaborate and connect with stakeholders in the EMEA region and globally, across the organisation. This will include with Macquarie’s operating businesses, Risk Management Group, Group Treasury, Finance, and senior management and entity Boards.
To be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following key skills and experience:
Good knowledge of stress testing, and familiar with UK or EU regulatory requirements and guidance around stress testing and ICAAP or ICARA.
Experience in a related role or one which provides for transferable skills within a financial institution, consultancy practice, regulatory body or rating agency.
An academic background ideally with in a quantitative discipline, with an understanding of macroeconomics and risk management.
Keen and broad interest in financial markets, including current and prospective macro-economic, financial, commodity and asset management market trends.
Strong technical, analytical and programming skills (R, Python or similar) with the ability to communicate complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders at all levels.
A strong preference for working collaboratively with strong verbal, written, communication and presentation skills.
If this sounds like the opportunity to further build your career in finance than please apply via the link.
About the Risk Management Group
The Risk Management Group (RMG) is an independent, centralised unit responsible for ensuring all risk across Macquarie are appropriately assessed and managed. Its divisions include Behavioural Risk, Compliance, Credit, Financial Crime Risk, Internal Audit, Market Risk, Operational Risk, Regulatory Affairs and Aggregate Risk, and RMG Enterprise Support.
Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable workplace enables us to embrace that diversity to deliver more innovative and sustainable solutions for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. At Macquarie, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If you're inspired to deliver on our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’, we want you on our team. If you need adjustments made to the recruitment process, please reach out to your recruiter.
As an inclusive employer, Macquarie does not discriminate on the grounds of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marriage, civil partnership, pregnancy, maternity, race (including colour and ethnic or national origins), religion or belief.
Joining Macquarie means you’ll be able to work in a way that suits you best. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways. Talk to us about what working arrangements would help you thrive.

About Macquarie
A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 18,000+ employees and offices in 33 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

DaVita International delivers dialysis care to over 40,000 patients across 350 clinics in 10 different markets covering Europe, Asia Pacific and Latin America. Our parent company, DaVita Inc. is one of the largest health care providers in the United States.
Over the last decade, we set out to be the world's greatest dialysis company, and over the next decade, we are poised to build the greatest healthcare community the world has ever seen. When you join the International DaVita Village, you're joining a winning team.

As Senior Legal Counsel Data Privacy at DaVita International your responsibility will be to ensure DaVita International’s compliance with all Data Privacy (DP) laws and regulations in multiple jurisdictions spanning the globe (excluding the USA). You will report to the General Counsel of DaVita International with a dotted line to the enterprise Chief Privacy Officer, who is based in the USA.
What will you be doing?
Develop, implement, and share privacy and data protection policies and best practices across the different jurisdictions and with the US DP team
Assist with DP breaches in coordination with US DP team and local DP officers in each jurisdiction, as appropriate
Provide privacy risk management advice, strategic guidance and support to other functional lanes including Compliance, IT, People Services (HR), and Clinical teams
Advise the International team on privacy risk and maintaining a privacy risk register
Perform audits in each jurisdiction to determine our compliance with local regulations
Support and arrange for training on DP compliance for employees
Actively liaise with US DP team on international DP governance matters
Engage in DP related Due Diligence on M&A transactions
Dotted line functional supervision and direction over in-country DP officers in DaVita International markets

What you’ll need to succeed?
Qualified Lawyer with at least 5 years PQE experience of data privacy law (including GDPR) in an international setting gained in private practice at a law firm, relevant government regulator, and/or in-house legal department at an international organization,
Relevant International Association of Privacy Professionals (IAPP) Certified Information Privacy Professional (CIPP) certifications (e.g., CIPP/E, CIPP/A) preferred.
Proven experience conducting data privacy compliance audits and the design and implementation of improvement plans
Desire to be part of a fun, yet hard-working team
A proactive, innovative and pragmatic approach to problem solving and an ability to think critically and independently with attention to detail
Effectiveness and fluency in English (native or near native speaker level)
Experience in healthcare is a plus
Live, uphold and model Company’s core values of Service Excellence, Integrity, Team, Continuous Improvement, Accountability, Fulfilment and Fun

What can you expect when you join our Village?
A competitive market rate salary
6% Employer pension contributions
Private Medical Insurance & Dental Cover
25 days holiday (33 including bank holidays)
A comprehensive benefit package including Life Assurance, Income Protection & Employee Assistant Programme
Performance-based rewards based on stellar individual and team contributions
A "community first, company second" culture based on Core Values that really matter
An exciting, collaborative and driven multinational environment
Dedication, above all, to caring for our patients and teammates

Whether it's joining one of our internal employee networks, being an ally, taking positive action or simply being there to listen, everyone at Phoenix is valued and respected.
If you need any help or adjustments to the recruitment process due to health, disability or anything else, please let us know so we can help you to be the best version of yourself.
The role
An amazing opportunity to play a pivotal role in the development of Phoenix Asset Management's approach to risk management. Reporting directly to the Phoenix AM CRO, this role will ensure the investment risk of the organisation is understood and well managed.
You will be the key risk liaison crossing between actuarial development, financial reporting, and asset management investment decisions.
Regular attendee at Investment Management Committee, Internal Credit Rating Committee , Portfolio & Credit Committee, Actuarial Technical Group, Model Change & Matching Adjustment steering committees.
Attend Board Investment Committee and Model Governance Committee, plus interact with PRA as required
Lead Line 2 validation of Matching Adjustment applications
Lead Line 2 reviews of proposals from Asset Management and Open business on new assets and new structuring proposals
Develop a suite of management information to monitor investment risk
Liaise with actuarial and finance to ensure modelling changes and processes are made to reflect changes in investment risk profile
Contribute to AM CRO report and Group CRO report to ensure investment risk issues are appropriately reflected to the board
Understanding evolving regulatory requirements to ensure the investment portfolio maintains capital efficiency
Understanding external, macro economic and geo-political risks to be able to initiate stress testing as crises and events unfold.

What are we looking for?
Actuary, accountant or other qualified professional, with post qualified experience working in a financial risk environment, either in Line 1 or Line 2.
Understanding of matching adjustment, Solvency II internal models and Solvency II regulatory requirements
Awareness of market best practice in managing investment risk
Experience working with complex financial products such as Equity Release Mortgages, securitisation, derivatives and illiquid assets
Experience working in an asset management environment, or within the asset management function of an insurance company
Why choose us?
Bring your 'whole self', skills and dedication to the Phoenix Group and we'll recognise your effort, support your development and help to drive your ambition. We'll ensure you're rewarded for your contribution with a competitive package that includes an attractive pension, annual bonus potential, private medical insurance, generous holiday entitlement, enhanced maternity and adoption leave and a range of other financial services and lifestyle flexible benefits.
Sound good? If you are ready to help us make Phoenix the best place you've ever worked, we'd love to hear from you.

Position Overview
The Project Manager is responsible for managing project scope all scales of events. This position will monitor progress and performance against the project plan, identifying, resolving, escalating operational problems, and minimising delays. This position is responsible for the end-to-end execution of projects from event design and development through closing. The Project Manager will ensure successful and profitable execution of events by following Technical and Production Standards and supporting the implementation of processes and SOP’s that drive consistency in event production. This position will partner with Project Management, Sales, and Operations teams in determining event technical requirements and communicating event execution plan with all parties. The Project Manager will report to the Director, Project Management or General Manager in area.

Key Job Responsibilities

Event Project Management
Prepare and communicate technical production & labour schedules, sub-rental requirements, project scope, execution plan and individual responsibilities to team members, vendors and venue partners.
Determine and secure the resources required to successfully complete each project.
Drive Results - Maintain focus on client needs by attending client meetings, creating and maintaining organised show documentation and responding to client concerns and questions.
Monitor project scope throughout the event planning process and adjust as necessary to ensure the successful completion of the project.
Assist sales and operations teams to help determine equipment needs and technical solutions for the project.
Assist with the creation of technical diagrams when required.
Review all sales documents to confirm that the equipment and technical positions will meet the client’s needs.
Deliver World Class Service - Develop and maintain strong relationships with clients at all levels of their organisation and provide outstanding customer service while focusing on client retention.
Provide leadership for Technical teams on events.
Ensure that all the necessary HSE documentations including but not limited to Risk Assessments and Method Statements are in place and communicated to the project delivery team prior to the execution of an event.

Event Execution
See the Bigger Picture - Act as the project leader and onsite contact for the client throughout the event.
Manage all phases of event technical execution from load-in through run of show to load-out.
Assume ownership of inventory management throughout the event.
Communicate the project plan and client expectations to event team.
Manage onsite changes, including schedule, equipment or workforce modifications.
Value People - Mentor and communicate with Encore Team Members on event execution and best practices to help improve the local knowledge base and experience in the market.
Do the Right Thing - Ensure compliance with established Technical Standards and Production Standards.
At all times, the Project Manager is expected to abide by all health and safety requirements to company and international standards and to ensure that all team members and subcontractors working onsite adhere to the same.
Follow up with clients on-site to ensure that their needs are met and the equipment setup is working properly.
Financial Management
Assist in the creation, analysis, and execution of the project budget, partnering with regional leadership to mitigate external workforce and sub-rental spend.
Manage event costs to align with budget and ensure all onsite changes are communicated to sales for billing purposes.
Assist with the completion of post-event client invoice. Work with operations management to ensure the prompt payment of all external vendors
Ensure compliance with Encore Policies and Procedures to minimise company’s exposure to liability claims and property damage, theft and misappropriation.

Administrative & Training
Complete Encore post-event process, to include the completion of all post-show reporting, confirming all workforce hours are accurately entered and ensuring that outsourced equipment is returned to appropriate provider.
Participate in the development of Project Management SOP’s.
Conduct review and analysis of proposed events as required.

Company: Glen Grant Ltd
Campari Group today is a major player in the global branded spirits industry, with a portfolio of over 50 premium and super premium brands, marketed and distributed in over 190 markets around the world, with leading positions in Europe and the Americas.

Headquartered in Milan, Italy, Campari Group owns 22 plants worldwide and has its own distribution network in 22 countries, and employs approximately 4,000 people.

Shares of the parent company Davide Campari - Milano N.V. are listed on the Italian Stock Exchange since 2001. Campari Group is today the sixth-largest player worldwide in the premium spirits industry.

CAMPARI GROUP UK
Campari Group UK is Campari Group’s subsidiary in the UK market, headquartered in London. A multicultural and dynamic team, Campari Group UK comprises of over 70 ‘Camparistas’ from over 10 different nationalities.
At the heart of Campari Group UK are three main portfolio offerings. The first is the Aperitivo Champions portfolio, led by the iconic Italian brands Aperol and Campari. The second is the Disruptors portfolio, featuring distinctive brands like Wray & Nephew Rum, BULLDOG Gin and Espolon Tequila. Finally there is the Prestige Challenger portfolio, including super premium brands such as Appleton Estate Jamaican Rum, Wild Turkey Bourbon, Grand Marnier and Lallier Champagne.
In total, the company is proud to offer an unrivalled portfolio of more than 50 distinctive and desirable premium spirit brands.
Visit www.campariuk.com to find out more about the company and range of brands or follow Campari Group UK on Instagram or Twitter at @CampariGroupUK.

ROLE OVERVIEW
The Commercial FP&A Manager will enable the Commercial function in partnership with Sales and CCM organisations, drive profitable growth through increased focus on the effectiveness of Trade- and Promo investments, and through the proactive identification of profit/growth opportunities across Channel, Customers and Brand combinations.
The position will work cross-functionally to design and develop processes and procedures, tools and ways of working to implement and lead the Commercial Finance function for Campari UK.
The function also provides recommendations, analytics and integrates data as needed to support for short-to-long term decision-making, drive key initiatives as well as supports the budgeting and forecasting processes.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND ACTIVITIES
Business and Analytical Support
Guide and support Commercial and CCM functions during the budgeting and forecasting process in order to build Trade Term & Promo Investments budget proposals/inputs, ensuring the outcomes are consistent with overall financial goals of the company.
Co-pilot development of Trade Term & Promo Investment strategy Commercial and CCM teams to deliver value and profit growth across Channels / Customers / Brands combinations.
Maintain and analyse P&L and run Value Chain by Channels, Customers and Brands. Develop process and simulation tools to track profitability of key combinations across Channels, Customers, Brands to i) aiming to ensure achieving defined financial and business KPIs ii) identify opportunities to further improvements of financial and business KPI’s via Revenue Optimisation programs as well as iii) providing general recommendation to management. Identifying risks and opportunities for target achievement.
Provide analytical support pre-/post-mortem to determine the feasibility, financial return on investment, estimated spend and forecasted targets (target KPI’s) for Commercial programs.
Analyse and monitor sell-in/sell-out and depletions trends, competitive pricing and external size mix trends to identify risks and opportunities and proactively provide recommendations to management to improve mix and profitability across Channels, Customers and Brands.
Lead the planning and implementation of price negotiations from Commercial Finance function perspective by providing value adding financial case scenarios.

Reporting
Direct Reporting line into Finance Director.
Managing of one direct report.
Coordinate with FP&A team monthly Top Line closing process (Turnover, Excise Tax, Net Sales) providing commentary on the performance against budget and business KPI’s.
Consolidate and submit financial data as required to support the company Budget Planning and forecasting processes from a Commercial and CCM PoV.
Manage internal and external audit procedures in the responsible area
Lead Customer Business Management (CBM) tool implementation, track issues/need for system improvement and act as a local expert (super user) of the tool to continuously educate Commercial and CCM Teams via sharing best practices of the CBM tool.

Key Relationships
Internal / Local: Leadership Team, Commercial and CCM Teams (all layers), FP&A and Accounting, Marketing, Customer Service, GBS
Internal / Regional: Regional FP&A, Regional IT Team
External: External Auditors, Consultants involved in Commercial projects being rolled out locally, Finance counterparts of customers

ESSENTIAL SKILLS REQUIRED
Education and Experience
Min. Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or Business related field is required. Master’s degree would be a plus.
Min. 5 years business experience in Commercial Finance & Controlling of multinational FMCG companies with focus on Sales and Commercial Customer Marketing area
Experience in FP&A / Accounting / Tax is a strong plus
Experience with planning and reporting tools
Highly analytical with advanced commercial awareness
ACA / ACCA / CIMA qualified or equivalent with strong academics.
People Managerial experience is a plus
Fluent English is a must, any other foreign language is a plus

Functional and Technical
Strong understanding of complex pricing and profitability simulation models.
Outstanding analytical ability to conduct research, analyse and organise large quantities of data and resolve complex problems. Drive actionable insights from massive data sets.
Able to identify problems and suggest excellent implementation of solutions.
Advanced Excel user is a must. Power BI knowledge is a plus.
SAP R3 and/or S4 Hana is a must
Experience with legacy systems to manage commercial finance is a strong plus

Personal competences
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Proven leadership skills with demonstrated experience in leading and driving change across the organisation and positively influence management.
Leadership skills and ability to present effectively business results and financial analysis to Senior Management and broader audience.
Strongly customer focused
Strong focus and attention to details
Excellent interpersonal skills. Be a strong team player with a sense of ownership and initiative to drive things forward.
Proactive, pragmatic, hands on approach, problem solver
Flexible, but firm when necessary

What’s on Offer
Be part of an inclusive, talented, fun, dynamic, passionate and welcoming team!
Competitive salary and generous bonus scheme
Opportunities to win incentive trips
Hybrid working week with 3 days in the office and 2 days from home
Private Medical and Dental healthcare available to you and your family at no extra cost
25 days holidays, plus bank holidays and days-off between Christmas and New Year
Generous pension scheme where employees contribute 2% and the company contributes 8%
Enhanced parental leave & pay and access to coaching for new parents
Fitness allowance to support your mental and physical wellbeing
Access to a wide range of learning resources including LinkedIn Learning
Life assurance cover of four times your annual salary
Income protection
Support for your charitable fundraising efforts
Enjoy our portfolio of brands with our product allowance
We are based in 14-16 Great Portland Street, our newly opened Campari House of Campari Group UK, with an amazing set up to experience with different bars across all floors where you can invite your friends / family to visit and enjoy a cocktail or two!
Wide range of exciting activities organised by our employee council including cocktail and cooking masterclasses
A chance to catch up with other Camparistas during our monthly networking sessions at the bar
Monthly birthday celebrations with cake
Free coffee, tea, biscuits and fruit available in the office

OUR ETHOS
‘Together’ is the way we see our business, a joint effort by ourselves, our customers and partners, working with passion behind every brand and every cocktail being served. Together we embrace our own responsibilities and share our knowledge and best practices, accepting failures and helping others to do the same, with honesty and courage. Together we break any cultural, organizational and geographical barriers, working across countries, businesses and functions, trusting each other on the ground of the values and common goals we share.
Our commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:
At Campari Group we believe in building more value together, thus we see diversity in all forms as a source of enrichment. Our employment policies and practices ensure that we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities in all aspects of employment without regard to any individual’s race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or characteristics or expression, political affiliation or activity, age, veteran status, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Note to applicants:

Qredo works at the cutting-edge of cybersecurity, decentralized finance and blockchain. Role
This is a hands-on role for a highly experienced Python developer who enjoys the rapid pace of innovation in decentralized finance and has an in-depth of knowledge and passion for building secure solutions. Diagnose and resolve system issues in production and external customer facing environments

Performance tuning, improvement, balancing, usability, automation

We're currently recruiting for a Credit Risk Specialist to join our Counterparty Credit Oversight Team to provide advice, independent opinion and assurance in alignment with the Group Risk's Mission to promote informed decision making and controlled risk-taking that improves customer outcomes and delivers long term value for shareholders.
Location: London
Salary: Competitive salary + up to 32% bonus, private medical insurance, excellent pension scheme, electric vehicle scheme, life assurance, 38 days holiday (including Bank Holidays) and much more!
Job Type: Permanent
Job Contact: Amanda Foskett
Closing Date: 3rd February 2023

We have an incredible opportunity to join us here at Phoenix Group as a Credit Risk Specialist in the Counterparty Credit Oversight (CCO) team within Asset Management Risk.
Who are we?
We want to be the best place that any of our colleagues have ever worked.
We are the UK's largest long-term savings and retirement business with c.13 million customers and c.£300 billion of assets under administration. As a market leader and FTSE100 organisation, we understand that our scale and expertise means that we have a key role to play for our customers, colleagues and our communities to help as many people as possible secure a life of possibilities. We are tackling key environmental and social issues such as transitioning our portfolio to net zero by 2050 - but we're not done yet.
We've seen huge growth and change, and this means there is enormous opportunity for our 7,000 colleagues to grow alongside us.
Flexible working
You can expect to work in a hybrid manner with time spent working in the office and at home. We believe that work/life balance offers benefits for customers as well as ensuring that you can balance a successful career with your life outside of work. We will discuss flexibility, what is important to you and balancing this with business requirements during the recruitment process.
We want to hire the whole version of you.
We are committed to ensuring that everyone feels accepted and safe at work and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Everyone is valued at Phoenix regardless of age, gender identity, neurodiversity, race, disability, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, socioeconomic background or anything else. Whether it's joining one of our internal employee networks, being an ally, taking positive action or simply being there to listen, everyone at Phoenix is valued and respected.
If you need any help or adjustments to the recruitment process due to health, disability or anything else, please let us know so we can help you to be the best version of yourself.
The role
The role will support the ambition to build the oversight model and capabilities in providing advice, independent opinion & assurance and to promote informed decision making and controlled risk-taking that improves customer outcomes and delivers long-term value for shareholders.
Responsible for periodic risk reviews considering emerging thinking / best practice, e.g., specialist risk reviews to ensure the appropriate identification and management of financial risk in targeted areas of the business including advising business risk owners on issues identified in risk reviews and solutions to those issues.
Assist the Head of Credit Counterparty Oversight with further developing and enhancement of the Line 2 counterparty credit oversight framework for Phoenix Group & Phoenix Asset Management, managing a variety of risk management related tasks and activities simultaneously.
Keep abreast of developments in the Capital & Financial markets and the impact it may have on our credit portfolio.
Monitor credit rating changes by External Credit Assessment Institutions on existing counterparty exposures, including corporates and financial institutions.
Contribute to Senior Management/Board risk reporting on the effectiveness of the Risk Management Framework, risk exposure and appetite, and the appropriateness of actions taken to manage risk effectively.
Establish relationships with key stakeholders across the Group, including risk peers, asset management and senior managers to support the implementation of an effective Risk Management Framework and to manage risk exposure.
Managing a variety of Risk Management related tasks and activities concurrently, meeting expectations on agreed deliverables and timescales.
What are we looking for?
Strong fundamental skills to provide Group Counterparty Credit oversight and monitor exposure accumulation.
- Ability to think critically, independently and creatively and think 'outside-the-box' - propose new analytical approaches and provide solutions.
Good understanding of the UK long-term life insurance business, including SII, annuities/BPA transaction, unit-linked, with-profits and the regulatory requirements governing insurance companies with particular emphasis on investments, ALM and Matching adjustment portfolios.
Forthright and persistent to ensure assurance views are understood and acknowledged.
Excellent communication and organisational skills, including experience of drafting reports for presentation at senior management / executive level.
Drive and flexibility to undertake a wide range of projects / activities simultaneously.
Demonstrable ability to work constructively in a diverse and multicultural team environment.
Min of 3 years credit & financial risk experience within either a commercial/investment bank or re-/insurance company.
Professional qualification in risk, finance, investment, or equivalent financial discipline (e.g. CFA, FRM, ACA or similar)
SQL, Bloomberg, Aladdin experience
Why choose us?
Bring your 'whole self', skills and dedication to the Phoenix Group and we'll recognise your effort, support your development and help to drive your ambition. We'll ensure you're rewarded for your contribution with a competitive package that includes an attractive pension, annual bonus potential, private medical insurance, generous holiday entitlement, enhanced maternity and adoption leave and a range of other financial services and lifestyle flexible benefits.
Sound good? If you are ready to help us make Phoenix the best place you've ever worked, we'd love to hear from you.

Track record of developing, implementing or providing oversight on the structuring or securitisations of annuity and non-annuity backing assets

Job title: EHR Digital Programme Clinical Change Lead
Description:
Job Title:  EHR Digital Programme – Clinical Change Lead
Location:  1 London Bridge with expectation to visit other sites
Salary Range: Competitive
Contract Type: Fixed Term Contract up to 3 years
Reporting to: CMIO / CCIO
We are actively recruiting for EHR Digital Programme Clinical Change Lead’s for a number of areas; OPD, UCC, Midwifery, Imaging, Laboratory Operations, Nursing and Therapies, Oncology, Pharmacy, Theatre/Anaesthetic and Critical Care.
About HCA Healthcare UK:
It is a hugely exciting time for our organisation. We are pioneers in providing healthcare solutions to our patients as part of an established US healthcare organization built on over 50 years of experience. To continue our success, we are implementing our five-year One HCA UK strategy, which includes ambitious growth plans, the opening of new sites and significant investments in enhancing effectiveness and alignment as a group.
These growth plans include implementing a real time end-to-end Electronic Health Record (EHR) platform, a multi-million-pound investment, and part of our long-term digital transformation initiative. Focused on advancing our technology and integrating web-based navigation, this EHR will allow HCA UK clinicians and colleagues to enhance patient safety, quality and care and to maintain our outstanding ratings and continue to be a global market leader in complex care. Therefore, we are investing in a new workforce to lead this change, and we are actively recruiting now for a 2023 start, focused on change management, transforming work practices, and project delivery of goals and objectives.
In summary:
Change leader focusing on clinical workstream within the HCA UK division wide transformational programme that will introduce new ways of working for clinicians and colleagues, providing front-line patient care through a new Electronic Health Record system.
This is a non-clinical role but will be responsible for supporting clinical teams. The role holder will lead, facilitate and be responsible for change management activities required to support the implementation of new EHR systems/technologies and related processes associated primarily (but not exclusively) to clinical processes across the HCA UK.
The post-holder will work with key stakeholder groups (clinical and non-clinical) and facilitate contribution from staff across the HCA UK to develop business and process change and support new improved ways of working to optimise the realisation of benefits.
Specific deliverables and top priorities for this role are:
Experience of leading a team within the clinical workstreams
Accountability for the Change Management Plan for clinical business areas
Responsibility for the business requirements of clinical business areas being met within the EHR delivery
Active oversight of Implementation and transition to BAU
Pro-active management of risks and issues and adherence to programme governance
Developing tracking for benefit realisation to feed into the programme benefits
Successful candidates will need:
Change Management qualification or equivalent experience
Lean Six Sigma / BA qualification advantageous
Previous responsibility for delivery of the change management for a significant change programme
Experienced in process re-design
Ideally, experience of an EHR implementation but not essential
Delivery of a significant change programme
Experience within a clinical setting
Excellent stakeholder management
Good attention to detail
If you would like to join HCA Healthcare UK as a EHR Digital Programme Clinical Change Lead and be part of an organization shaping a healthier tomorrow, we invite you to apply. Our application process is quick and easy, completing a 2-minute questionnaire and upload a CV.
